story:
LET’S TALK ABOUT THE PROJECT

Let’s Shojo is not a comic, nor a manga or comic strip, but a mix of all of them. It’s a collection of one shots each of which is parody of a different genres of manga (in particular the shojo), for instance, there is a maho shojo, a yaoi story, but also an harem reverse and ecchi ones and much more.
In this comic, the main characters, Sybil and Cloud, are forced by an author obsessed with shojo manga to perform every sort of shojo. They should be able to count on the help of “The Brutes”…between a soccer game and another…
Will our heroes survive the shojo mangas?

Let’s Shojo is black and white and roughly 160 pages of sheer fun!

 

 

 

 

SO HOW DOES INDIEGOGO WORKS?

Over in the top right corner of this page is the goal. That's how much I will need to product and translate (I need to pay a Italian-English translator because my English isn’t perfect as you can see) my comic.
If the goal is reached, I’ll start to product and translate “Let’s shojo”, at the moment I’ve drawn my comic in Italian on paper sheets.
If the goal is exceeded, it will mean more comic will be produced! Every dollar over the goal line means a larger quantity of “Let’s shojo” can be ordered.
If the goal is not reached before the end of the 60 days then you will not be charged anything. You only pay if the project reaches its goal before the deadline!

 

 

HOW MUCH WILL THIS COST, AND WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

I'm asking for $ 8,800 dollars to pay for the printing and shipping of the copies of the comics, but also to pay the translator (for the English version) and the co-workers which will help me during the production.

WHAT DO I GET OUT OF IT?

Participating in this Indiegogo project will net you lots of nice rewards. Along the right side, you will see categories, with dollar amounts. By pledging that amount, you will receive the rewards listed in their respective boxes.
Here are some examples of rewards:

THANK YOU!

Whatever happens I want to say a big thank you to all those people who will support my project, since thanks to Indiegogo and You this project has had a chance to become a reality! -^_^-

NOTE: SHIPMENT

We have no problem to send to:
Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech republic, Estonia, France, Germany, Great Britain,Greece, Hungary, Japan, Israel, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovenia, Slovakia,Spain, San Marino, USA, Stato del Vaticano, Swiss.
For orders out of the above list please add $5 for shipping.

The Author

My name is Daniela Errico I was born in Naples, Italy. I like to draw since I was a child. My first drawing was a princess …so banal! =.=’
Luckily growing up I have changed my subjects and one day I started to drawing strips, then comics and finally: here we are!
Even if I hold Master Degree in Mathematics and Ph.D. in Applied Mathematics and Informatics, (I genuinely love biomathematical models -^_^- ), I never stop drawing, because I really enjoyed doing comics, especially the funny ones!
Unluckily, in this period I have lost my job (my old company is in financial trouble) and even if I'm finding a new job I'm still employed...
But now I (forcefully) have a lot of free time, so I have thought time has come to try to produce one of my comics: I really want to know if you like and enjoy reading it!!!

story:
My Sweet Lady (MSL) is a new and wacky action-adventure comedy comic book series by Justin Raimey (Artist/Story) and Terry L Raimey (Story). The story focuses on a cake princess with a rotten attitude named Lady White Cake, and her quest to transform into someone that everyone will love and respect with the help of her little friend, Cupcake. Due to the sudden and mysterious death of Lady White’s father, the King, she will have to take his place as ruler of her kingdom in a month's time, while uncovering the truth behind her father's death. Every chapter of MSL will be published (printed) in full-color comic book issues.

Exclusive Signed Special Edition Comic Book for donors!

Here are a couple of sample pages from the comic book.  




 

Why are we raising funds?

We require funding for the production and advertising campaign of this new comic book series.


Budget Info:

$5,000 Advertising: publications (magazines), social networks, digital media networks (websites)

$3,700 Print and distribute 4 comic book issues: (we plan to print about 2,000 copies this year, 500 copies of each issue)

$11,000 Trade shows, promotional events and book shows including travel expenses

$500 Office/admin supplies

Asking for $3500 to assist us in our business operations outlined above.


All (100%) funds raised in this campaign will go into this project.  None of the money raised on this campaign will go into our pockets. We will only retain profits from the sales of each issue.

My Sweet Lady is an action-adventure comedy comic book series about a country full of personified pastry people with a diet of only meat. The target audience for this series is 13 and up, both male and female. 

My Sweet Lady is a great name for this series because it describes the comic perfectly. The story is about Lady White Cake, a cake personification who is trying to be sweet in order to gain the affection of her citizens. When it comes to the title of this series, “Sweet” is a play on words that can be defined in two different ways; sweet as in the setting of the story, which takes place in a land full of pastry people, and sweet as in a personality trait. Join Lady White on her journey to become a “likable” person through the teachings of an innocent Cupcake. Some of the traits that Lady White will learn on her adventures are honesty, compassion, integrity, generosity, love, selflessness, willingness to protect others, friendship, and sacrifice.

The reader may even learn a thing or two about how to treat people by reading MSL.

Format/Genre Facts

  • 36 pages per issue
  • Size 6 5/8" x 10 1/4"
  • Full Color
  • Comedy, Action-Adventure
  • Recommended for ages 13+
  • Male/Female audiences 



Lady White Cake is a young princess who is destined to rule over a land of pastry people who have a diet of only meat. Her father, the king, has suddenly died and now Lady will take his place as queen. Although Lady is a princess, she is rude, antisocial and just plain mean to everyone. No one in the kingdom respects her and she will have to find a way to gain that respect.  

Cupcake is a little girl who lives in the land of the pastry people. She is the niece of Lady White Cake’s bodyguard. Cupcake is the only pastry in the entire kingdom who admires Lady White Cake; this is mostly due to her naiveté. She will become Lady’s only friend and she will show Lady how to be a good person and how to have fun through their many adventures in the kingdom.

Scotchy Brown (Butlerscotch) is one of Lady White’s bodyguards and Cupcake's uncle. Lady White Cake and Scotchy butt heads a lot.  They do tend to make friendly bets with each other often during the boring events they attend.  He’s not a very fun person to be around because he is always so serious.

This campaign will offer a variety of sweet rewards for our lovely supporters!  Just check out the side tier info or below to see what reward suits you best.  If this campaign reaches its $3500 goal, we will send your much deserved rewards to you in January 2014.

What's that?  You don't live in the United States?  No problem, we will send rewards internationally also!

Get this donor exclusive comic book cover, a spoof of a popular video game cover, if you donate $12 or more!  This cover will not be sold in stores, a must have collector's item.

This signed art print is a reward for anyone who donate $20 or more.



If you wonderful peeps end up backing this project beyond our goal of $3500, we will hit the stretch goal campaign.  This means more rewards for you and everyone else who meet the contribution requirements!  So, if this campaign gains $300 more dollars after the main goal of $3500 has been reached, anyone who has or will donate $12 or more will receive two exclusive MSL button pins added to their rewards!  And that is only the first stretch goal!  We will reveal the remaining stretch goals and stretch goal rewards as the campaign progresses!

Black Streak Entertainment specializes in publishing books and creating gifts for kids, teens and young-adults. Our goal at Black Streak Entertainment is to make the world an awesome place by offering products that appeal to the fun and young at heart! Learn more about us at our official website blackstreakbooks.com


Hey, even if you are unable to donate to this campaign, your support in other ways (telling your friends about MSL, liking My Sweet Lady on Facebook, Tweeting #MSL, fan art, etc.) is much appreciated!

story:
About Nobsland:

Nobsland is a comic series I created since 2009, I have written more than 50 episodes so far, each of the stories has 4 panels in a single page, which looks like a full page newspaper layout (because I hearted the comic strips on newspaper). The comics have been published on multiple platforms in the Asia region, but never been printed yet. 

The book is about the interesting life of the characters living in "Nobsland", also some environment issues, jokes on the pop-culture and feedback to the real world.

I started this campaign to print the book for 2 reasons. First, I treasure the reading experience with a tangible book. Second, I want to share the stories to more people from other parts of the world.


Why I raise $2,000:

  1. To produce full color print
  2. To employ a native speaker to rewrite the scripts
  3. To ship the book to every part of the world (so no additional shipping fee would be charged)

If I can't raise more than $2,000 before the end of campaign, indiegogo will refund your money to you.

Production Specs:

The book will be printed in full color, A4 size art paper, 52 pages included the covers, with 43 selected stories.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you like my campaign but you can’t contribute, you can simply help me sharing this page to the comic lovers you know, I am very appreicated with it :)

Thanks so much!

story:
Sophie goes on tour!

Hello Everyone! My name is Sophie Labelle, the French-Canadian artist behind Assigned Male, a webcomic about a bunch of sarcastic trans and queer teenagers that has been running since 2014. I've also been giving talks and doing events all over the place in the past few years! In 2020, it's reaching new heights with my first actual World Tour, for which I've been receiving invitations on every continent of the world.

As a trans woman, I feel very privileged to be able to do this. In the past, every speaking tour I did allowed me to meet members from trans, queer and feminist communities of so many various backgrounds that every time, I've been learning and growing so much from these encounters.  And this time, I'd like to share that experience with everyone!

That's why I'll be consigning stories from my world tour into illustrated letters, which I'll send you, the backers, by physical mail or email. Then, at the end of the tour, I will turn these letters into chapters of a tour book, with more drawings!

How will it work?

Obviously, the funds raised will mainly go toward the printing of the book, which is estimated to be about 200 pages at the end. I have self-published more than a dozen books already, and estimate the costs to be around 10ca$/unit. I'd like to print at least 1000 of them, so that's why 10,000ca$ (7,500us$) is the minimum.

The rest of the funds will help fund the tour itself, since many trans organisations who will be hosting me don't have the means to pay for the traveling part. I am doing all this by myself, with no agent, and working closely with each organisation that invite me.

You will receive 12 letters/emails from February to June, each corresponding to a country or region I'll be visiting during the tour. These different parts are each described in the Chapters section!

If we reach the second goal, which will be announced in an update once and if the first goal is reached, everyone who signed up for a book will get it hardcover!

So is it like a travel guide?

My goal with this project is to share the stories I'm collecting from my point of view as a traveling trans artist.

When I was a teenager, the idea of traveling while trans seemed to be a risky one, and the risk is real. Violence exists everywhere, but so do we. 

This project isn't a travel log, and even less some ethno-sociological study. It's an art project, which will revolve around encounters and anecdotes, and will remain entirely subjective to my own experiences, perceptions and emotions. 

It will also be limited by which organizations invited me for this tour, which, sadly, need an internet connection, access to specific social media in order to be familiar with my work online, and to be located in a country without laws that forbid their existence.

This tour doesn't include any country of the Americas, which I will tour later in the coming year. If this campaign is successful, I'll consider making a similar project then!

White Canadian citizen breezing through borders, how nice

As I mentioned earlier, the point of view that I have is very privileged : being white and holding a Canadian passport opens many doors. This tour and the stories I will share from it are going to be heavily influenced by that. This project might not even be doable for someone else in another situation!

That's why I decided to give 5% of the funds raised to "Black and Pink", an organization close to my heart which runs different programs for jailed or homeless queer and trans youth. You can donate, volunteer, learn more or even become a penpal with an incarcerated queer or trans person here : https://www.blackandpink.org/ .

Other Ways You Can Help

Pledging isn't the only way to help! Sharing the campaign on social media goes a long way. You can also show up at the events - most of them will be pinned on my Facebook page, at www.facebook.com/assignedmale .

Chapter list

As mentioned earlier, this list doesn't include any country or region from the Americas, which will come later - you can however already message me about it!

In this list, you will find the subjects of the letters I will write and send you, in order :

1. Australia

2. New Zealand

3. South Africa

4. Hong Kong / Taiwan

5. Thailand

6. England

7. Isle of Man / Ireland

8. Germany / Switzerland

9. Denmark / Sweden

10. Belgium

11. France

12. Epilogue

story:
STRETCH GOALS

1500 - Coloured Digital comic,  Script and making of bonus material

5k -  Dramatised read through of the book

10k - upgrade print copies

 

Summary

Hi I'm Ben lunato I'm best known for my work in games with several released indie titles and credits in AAA games. I've always had an interest in Comic book characters in storytelling but have never explored comics until comics gate started. I loved seeing a  Successful boomer movement stand up for itself and strike out of there one and make something super successful. I met Aidan McDonah he instantly got my work and we both loved japanese car culture. We worked on a book preview to see if we could work together and if we had what it took. We did big time.This is our first book together and The first crowdfunding project, we want to prove we can deliver a physical book and tell an amazing story.

 

Down Hill King is a 150 page book, yes this is a lot but its a storry that needs the space to tell it right. and we have done a 45 page prevew to show you all that we can do this and fast.

45 page book prevew

here:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fY7DnerXae6zJUELGmO1yZWMM6e456gw/view

 

story

Downhill King is the story of Clint racing fast cars after school. He is stubborn, he has a chip on his shoulder and he doesn't know when to stop. Clint agrees to street-race Drake, and with Angelina his girlfriend in the car, Clint crashes, killing evry one but himself. Clint wakes up in the hospital missing his legs and an arm, abandoned by his family. He's unable to process or live with what he's done.But something strange happened that night and The dead have other plans for Clint.

 

perks?

As first timers we want to keep things as simple as possible when it comes to perks and stretch goals. The only physical object is the book. But there will also be some Digital only perks and stretch goals that we can 100% deliver on.

 

Ways You Can Help!

Help Get me on Live streams if you know anyone or have a live stream podcast YouTube channel anything with any size of audience and you think I should promote the book or appear don’t hesitate to contact me or spam them.

  • benlunato@gmail.com
  • ben.lunato
  • +44 7482204885

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We are new at this

It’s true that we are both first time comic book makers that’s why we’ve done the research and put in the work. We’ve done a 48 page test run to prove we can do it we watched the videos read the PDFs, we are avoiding the first major problem which is random crap we wanna make a comic book we don’t wanna make T-shirts, The book is the only product we are manufacturing printing standing behind we just made this project 100% more likely to succeed.

 

Failure to deliver

We will be working with a US printer and fulfilment service this means we’re not getting as large a slice is the pie as others but this is the safest way of going about my first book.

 

Where is my money going?

The bulk of the money is going towards printing and distribution The rest is going to the artist Aidan.

Summary
Hi I'm Ben lunato I'm best known for my work in games with several released indie titles and credits in AAA games. I've always had an interest in Comic book characters in storytelling but have never explored comics until comics gate started. I loved seeing a  Successful boomer movement stand up for itself and strike out of there one and make something super successful. I met Aidan McDonah he instantly got my work and we both loved japanese car culture. We worked on a book preview to see if we could work together and if we had what it took. We did big time.This is our first book together and The first crowdfunding project, we want to prove we can deliver a physical book and tell an amazing story.
 
Down Hill King is a 150 page book, yes this is a lot but its a storry that needs the space to tell it right. and we have done a 45 page prevew to show you all that we can do this and fast.
45 page book prevew
here:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fY7DnerXae6zJUELGmO1yZWMM6e456gw/view
 
story
Downhill King is the story of Clint racing fast cars after school. He is stubborn, he has a chip on his shoulder and he doesn't know when to stop. Clint agrees to street-race Drake, and with Angelina his girlfriend in the car, Clint crashes, killing evry one but himself. Clint wakes up in the hospital missing his legs and an arm, abandoned by his family. He's unable to process or live with what he's done.But something strange happened that night and The dead have other plans for Clint.

 
perks?
As first timers we want to keep things as simple as possible when it comes to perks and stretch goals. The only physical object is the book. But there will also be some Digital only perks and stretch goals that we can 100% deliver on.
 

Ways You Can Help!
Help Get me on Live streams if you know anyone or have a live stream podcast YouTube channel anything with any size of audience and you think I should promote the book or appear don’t hesitate to contact me or spam them.

benlunato@gmail.com
ben.lunato
+44 7482204885

 

 











 
Risks & Challenges

We are new at this
It’s true that we are both first time comic book makers that’s why we’ve done the research and put in the work. We’ve done a 48 page test run to prove we can do it we watched the videos read the PDFs, we are avoiding the first major problem which is random crap we wanna make a comic book we don’t wanna make T-shirts, The book is the only product we are manufacturing printing standing behind we just made this project 100% more likely to succeed. Failure to deliver
We will be working with a US printer and fulfilment service this means we’re not getting as large a slice is the pie as others but this is the safest way of going about my first book. Where is my money going?
The bulk of the money is going towards printing and distribution The rest is going to the artist Aidan.

story:
Short Summary

Chased to the brink of extinction, Humanity takes refuge on the black market trading hub Equan Yas. Reduced to extreme poverty, and treated as second class citizens by the planet’s inhabitants, humans must fight to survive.  For the first time  all 3 of the main Metal Made Flesh books are available in a paperback omnibus.

Metal Made Flesh centres on three main characters, the cold, merciless cyborg Izobel Vice who loses more of her humanity with each passing upgrade; the psychopathic assassin Phaeon Nex, and Kalibos, a hideous mutant war machine. 

Metal Made Flesh features artwork and stories from series creator Simeon Aston, and writer Jeremy Biggs. along with writers and artists from Marvel and 2000AD including:

Boo Cook (2000 AD, Elephantmen)

TC Eglington (Judge Dredd)

Gary Erskine (Star Wars, X-men)

Josan Gonsalez (The Future is Now, Ghost in the Shell)

Hector Trunnec (Carol)  

Phil Buckenham (Twisted Dark)

Cy Dethan

Peter Cooper

Vittorio Astone (Heavy Metal)

There are three books in the Metal Made Flesh Series. Book One was released in 2014, and the subsequent two books were Crowdfunded in 2015 and 2016.

What You Get

The project is already fully funded, so you're rewards are guaranteed!

Paperback Omnibus - £20

Individual Books in Hardback - £25 each

Choose one of the original individual books in hardback!

Pictured above: A selection of paperbacks and hardbacks from the original editions.

Metal Made Flesh 2: Blood and Oil

Metal Made Flesh 3: Vengeance 

Individual Paperback - £15

Complete your collection - individual paperback books available separately.

One Shots / Artbook / Bible - £10 each

The Bible:   A look at the world and species of Metal Made Flesh

Deception: An In-Universe One shot that takes place between Metal Made Flesh 2 and 3.

The Artbook:  A selection of art from Metal Made Flesh artists

Art Prints - £20

Choose one of the following A3 Art Prints

Izobel: Melancholia

Metal

Blood and Oil

Phaeon Bridge

Phaeon Dive

T-shirts - £25

T-shirts in Mens and Womens fit, sizes Small to 2XL.

Phaeon Nex Tee

Blood and Oil Tee

Metal Tee

 “Cyberpunk GOLD... ART in its truest form... a privilege to own work like this.” -Gary Watson Comics Anonymous 

 “If Blade Runner and Judge Dredd are even remotely your thing, then you will not be disappointed.” -Richard Cosgrove Shadowlocked.com 

“Gritty, adult sci-fi with few punches pulled.... cyberpunk with great hardware.” -Strictly Kev (DJ Food), Ninja Tunes

A Page from Metal Made Flesh by Noel Guard

A page from Metal Made Flesh by Simeon Aston

story:
Who is Grant Reed?

Born on May 6, 1976 in North Bay Ontario, my twin (Gary) and I, have always felt the creative urge that differentiates us from our peers. As a kid, I always had a book in my hand and took my share of ribbing that went along with being a passionate reader and having the last name of Reed. (No I have never really understood this, but kids can be cruel…sometimes it’s best to play along.)

By the age of twelve I knew I wanted to tell stories. Inspired by David Gemmell, writers of the Forgotten Realms and Dragonlance novels, and anything with a fantastical flair – be it film or written word –I armed myself with the knowledge and skills it would take to tell my own story.

In 1999, after two years of hard work, I finished my first novel entitled “Shadow of the Makarios”. I had accomplished what I set out to do, and feverishly hit the streets trying to sell my work. Dozens of rejections later, and with the need to put food on the table for my young family, I reluctantly, ever so slowly and painfully… gave up on the dream….almost. 

I have since written three other novels in the fantasy genre, (two with Gary) but have had little success in promoting these titles. (If success were measured by the wall of rejections I have acquired over the years, then I would be triumphant. I’ll know when I have reached my goal though, for the wall will cease to grow. Either I will have finally found someone interested in my work or I will have dropped dead from trying.)

Despite the fact I have not fulfilled my dreams as a writer, I refuse to give up. Over the years a little nagging moth has flitted around the inside of my head promoting the idea of a graphic novel to get the story of “Shadow of the Makarios” out there so that people could enjoy it. You are, after all, the reason I wrote it.

Working fourteen hour days seven days a week for the past three months I have endeavored to create something I could share with you. Now as my contract with the I.T. company I work for comes to an end I am faced with finding new work, or once again attempting to pursue my one true love of storytelling.

What I need

I have taken into consideration the bare minimum income I will need for the next year to pay my bills, and combined that with printing cost to do an initial run of “Shadow of the Makarios” the Graphic Novel – volume 1. (As well as printing costs for the original novel and artwork for perks).

I need $28,000 of which $10,000 covers the printing costs (300 novels and 300 Graphic novels and Art) and a further $2000 pays off the Fees for this site.

I also need another 12 months to finish Volume 1. I have completed 20% of Volume 1 while working a full time job as well as 6 hours a night on the comic (every night) to do so. If I am able to work on this full time, I may even finish sooner than expected.

What you get

You get a top quality 150 page full color signed copy of “Shadow of the Makarios” the graphic novel Volume 1.

You also get the original “Shadow of the Makarios” a full 458 pages, an original novel by Grant Reed.

You get continued entertainment from a man who has dedicated many years of his life to telling fantastical tales for your enjoyment. Please help keep the dream alive, and I will keep working hard to entertain YOU!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

 

Visit me on Facebook, https://www.facebook.com/grant.reed.311#!/pages/Grant-Reed/214710555231982

 

Send me a note of encouragement: reedg06@gmail.com

 

Check out my YouTube channel:

http://www.youtube.com/user/reedg06?feature=mhee


Watch: Evolution of a Frame (1,2,3) on my channel

story:
Mi is ez?

Tisztelt Rajongók és Ismerkedők, a Kerekerdő Lakói blog már 2008 júliusa óta csillapítja a perverz képregényekre éhes internetes közösség étvágyát.

Végre túl vagyunk az 1000. bejegyzésen, visszatekintve pedig azt vettem észre, hogy nagyon ráférne egy ráncfelvarrás, és bizony szívesen venném kezembe fizikai formában is képsoraimat. Erről szól ez az egész kampány, hogy azok akik hasonlóan éreznek a képregényemmel kapcsolatban, megkapják a lehetőséget, és hozzájárulhassanak saját és mások nyomtatott példányaihoz.

Miért ennyi?

Az összegyűjtött pénzt a Kerekerdő Lakóinak újrarajzolására, nyomtatott megjelenésére -valamint a támogatókhoz történő eljuttatására- fogom fordítani.

Nem árulok zsákbamacskát: 100 színes (A5-ös) oldalon fognak megjelenni
a 3 kockás képsorok (2-3 darab/oldal), amiknek újrarajzolása több hónapon át történő teljes munkaidős elfoglaltságot jelent számomra. Hosszas kalkuláció mellett arra jutottam, hogy 800 példány alatt képtelenség nyereségesre kihozni a projektet, ezért ez a hatalmas támogatói összeg. De fejenként szállítási költséggel együtt Nektek "csak" egy hétvégi buli ára: 3000Ft.


Mit kapok a pénzemért?

Minimum egy konkrét példányt, de választhatóak extra támogatói csomagok is. (jobb oldalon a lista)

Mivel a fix finanszírozás lehetőségét választottam, ha a kampány nem érne célt, akkor a támogatók visszakapják a pénzüket, és mindenki éli tovább az életét.

Még valami?

Már csak annyi, hogy nagyon köszönöm, ha támogatsz/megosztasz, vagy bármilyen módon segíted a kampányt!

story:
READ THE BOOK FROM THE BEGINNING HERE. 

WHAT IS ICHABOD AND WHY IS IT WORTH YOUR TIME (and support)?

Ichabod Jones is a critically acclaimed, original comic book series that follows the exploits of an insane and fundamentally deranged mental patient that escapes from a maximum security asylum to rid the world of monsters during the apocalypse with the (usually unwelcome) help of the omniscient, impatient, and authoritative voice in his head.

Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter is a project near and dear to my heart. I wrote it in 2010 and Viper picked it up for digital distribution in 2011. 

The project came out digitally in 2012 to great reviews. Here's just a small sample of them:

  • "...five of five stars, it is awesome and well worth getting...this one is well worth the couple of bucks you will spend. Overall truly fun to read, and extraordinarily well done. I need to go find the physical copy of this comic book so I can add it to my own library."- Comics Forge
  • "Nohelty does a wonderful job pacing this series, letting the second half of issue 2 take you full steam into Ichabod’s insanity (or maybe reality). There simply is no middle ground. When trapped with other asylum members, both alive and dead, Ichabod devises a way out of entrapment that relies on the literal “intestinal” fortitude of a slayed “monster” to give then a lifeline of hope out of their pit of despair (for the obtuse, he climbs out of trouble using entrails – damn you obtuse and your obtuseness). Issue three becomes even more insane; once outside of entrapment Ichabod and his followers find a deserted wasteland (i.e. welcome to the apocalypse, kids). From here things just get stranger with Dune-like sandworms and a town that seems to be anything but salvation."- Ain't It Cool News
  • ."..I’m glad I got the chance to read Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter. The journey is a strange one but I couldn’t help but be enthralled the entire time." - My Comic Network
  • "IJ: MH is not just a visually cool-frightening book to look at. It’s pretty mental too." - Buy Indie Comics

WHY DO I NEED YOUR HELP IF I ALREADY HAVE A PUBLISHER?

Because I DON'T. I had a publisher yes, but those days are long past. 

While my ex-publisher was putting out the book electronically, I was ecstatic about the reviews and outpouring of support. But there was always something missing: a print run. 

I'd been trying to set up one ever since I started producing the book. In fact, we produced eight pages of never before seen content just for the trade!

Eventually, I was told that my publisher wouldn't put the print run together unless I funded it myself. I politely asked for them to relinquish the rights back to me so I could explore other venues, which they graciously did. 

Now the book is wholly mine again, and I'm raising money to get this book out there into your hands. Because to me, comics are meant to be felt, touched, and held; not read on a computer screen. 

AND THAT'S WHAT BRINGS ME TO YOU...

I'm not asking for money in order to make a project. I've already made a project. It's finished. But it's a tremendous financial burden to pay everybody associated with the book, which I did. Thousands upon thousands of dollars. And I just don't have more funds to get this book out the door. 

What I need is your help to get the book printed, onto book shelves, to conventions, and into your hands in the way I've always meant it to be viewed. 

It's been my dream since I was a kid to see a comic book in print, and the only way that will happen is with your support. 

SO WHAT'S IN THE BOOK ANYWAY? 

Volume one will bind the first four issues of Ichabod Jones: Monster Hunter, plus the epilogue and back matter. It's bananas.

story:
JUDGES: A NEO NOIR CRIME THRILLER

Judges is a passion project for our team.  We've been working on this story for over a year and a half and have 8 issues fully mapped out and written.  Judges is an anthology at heart -- it revolves around a key set of characters, with many others coming and going.  

Our main characters are:

Lukas Seek -- The son of a murdered vigilante.  He's looking for his father's killer.

Royal -- A mysterious former bank robber that offers Lukas an intriguing deal.

Alex Mullen -- An alcoholic, depressed Remorse detective.  He's thrust right into the middle of many of our character's stories.

Azrael -- She fights for the abused women in Remorse.  The first time we meet her, she's preventing a rape.  She was abused by her stepfather as a child, so she knows that pain and aims to stop it.

The Handsome Bastard -- Handsome was former military & CIA.  His daughter was kidnapped for sex-trafficking purposes and never seen again.  He now fights the Siete Cartel's sex trafficking rackets, vowing to end it for good.

This story takes each of these characters to multiple locations in our Universe; a bank robbery in Grayedge, a temple in Mexico, an FBI morgue in New York, and a radical church in Athens (we're even planning an arch that takes some of our characters to Bruges, but that's a secret, so shh!).  

These characters cross paths with many others, such as a vengeful FBI agent, a former Navy SEAL turned cartel enforcer, and a crazy and powerful woman at the head of the cartel, only know as "La Bruja".

OUR GOALS


One of the big goals with Judges is to bring light to some dark issues that are close to our hearts.  The Handsome Bastard was kind of transformed into this character that's sole purpose in life was fighting sex trafficking.  

We talked about this for a while and realized that when people think of sex trafficking, usually it's accompanied by, "Oh, that happens to them.  That happens over there."  But it happens in our own backyards.  It happens everywhere.  And we want people to see that and decide to do something about it.

With Azrael, we wanted to create a strong woman that women & girls alike could look up to.  And while some of the things she does may be unsavory, she is fighting for the abused women and girls in Remorse.

Judges is dark & gritty, but also has some tender moments between characters.  It's really one big character study, set in a harsh and unforgiving city.  We dive into the fundamentals of what can happen to good people when they're surrounded by so much evil and hatred.

We hope this story has a little something for everyone.

Judges is a passion project for our team.  We've been working on this story for over a year and a half and have 8 issues fully mapped out and written.  Judges is an anthology at heart -- it revolves around a key set of characters, with many others coming and going.  

Our main characters are:
Lukas Seek -- The son of a murdered vigilante.  He's looking for his father's killer.
Royal -- A mysterious former bank robber that offers Lukas an intriguing deal.
Alex Mullen -- An alcoholic, depressed Remorse detective.  He's thrust right into the middle of many of our character's stories.
Azrael -- She fights for the abused women in Remorse.  The first time we meet her, she's preventing a rape.  She was abused by her stepfather as a child, so she knows that pain and aims to stop it.
The Handsome Bastard -- Handsome was former military & CIA.  His daughter was kidnapped for sex-trafficking purposes and never seen again.  He now fights the Siete Cartel's sex trafficking rackets, vowing to end it for good.
This story takes each of these characters to multiple locations in our Universe; a bank robbery in Grayedge, a temple in Mexico, an FBI morgue in New York, and a radical church in Athens (we're even planning an arch that takes some of our characters to Bruges, but that's a secret, so shh!).  
These characters cross paths with many others, such as a vengeful FBI agent, a former Navy SEAL turned cartel enforcer, and a crazy and powerful woman at the head of the cartel, only know as "La Bruja".
OUR GOALS
One of the big goals with Judges is to bring light to some dark issues that are close to our hearts.  The Handsome Bastard was kind of transformed into this character that's sole purpose in life was fighting sex trafficking.  
We talked about this for a while and realized that when people think of sex trafficking, usually it's accompanied by, "Oh, that happens to them.  That happens over there."  But it happens in our own backyards.  It happens everywhere.  And we want people to see that and decide to do something about it.
With Azrael, we wanted to create a strong woman that women & girls alike could look up to.  And while some of the things she does may be unsavory, she is fighting for the abused women and girls in Remorse.
Judges is dark & gritty, but also has some tender moments between characters.  It's really one big character study, set in a harsh and unforgiving city.  We dive into the fundamentals of what can happen to good people when they're surrounded by so much evil and hatred.
We hope this story has a little something for everyone.

story:
Peter Pan, a graphic novel.

Firstly, let me thank you for taking the time to check out what I hope you will agree is an exciting new project.  This book is something I believe in passionately, and have been working towards for many years.

So sit back, relax, and join me on a trip to the most magical world ever imagined...

So...what is crowdfunding all about? 

Simple!  Take a look at my project, and if you believe in it, you can help make it happen with a contribution...and grab yourself an awesome perk at the same time!

Your conrtibution is helping to fund the actual creation of the book.  Every contributor to this project will be a part of this book forever!

Now let me make this clear, straight off...I do not intend to make money from sales of this book.  For me, reaching my fund total and having the opportunity to create this book is enough.

All my royalties from sales of this  book will be donated to Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity (GOSH)...for all time! This means that a small contribution to my project from you can turn in to a larger donation to GOSH from me...this book really could be the gift to them that keeps on giving! 

When J M Barrie died, he left all the rights to Peter Pan to GOSH. 

Who am I?

My name is Stephen White, I am a writer/artist from Edinburgh, in bonnie Scotland.

I have been a regular contributor to Scottish comics institutions, The Dandy and The Beano for many years.

I have had three books published (as writer and artist) under the pen-name, STREF'...MILK+ (a graphic novel aimed at the mature reader) in 2010, RAISING AMY (a collection of newspaper style cartoon strips for all ages) in 2011, and X (a graphic novel for the mature reader) in 2012.

You can check out my work in my PORTFOLIO

Peter Pan and me!

Why am I the right guy for the job?  Why is this story so special to me?

Well..to me, PETER PAN is the greatest story in the world, and one I have been hooked on (no pun intended!) since I was a small boy...

It's all a bit embarrassing really, but what the hey!  I am asking you for contributions here, so the least I can do is bare a little of my soul in return...so here goes!

When I was a little boy I was completely obsessed with Peter Pan!  I used to dress up as Peter (remember I was only five!) and my costume was complete with green tights and glitter for fairy dust.  So convinced was I that I actually WAS PETER PAN, that I used to try and climb out of my bedroom window and fly away!  I did this so often that my Uncle had to put bars on it!  Unfortunately, he put them on horizontally, and I used them as a ladder to get even higher!

As a treat, I was taken to see PETER PAN in pantomime at the King's Theatre in Edinburgh.  It is my earliest memory!  Not because I sat through the entire show spellbound, as you might imagine...rather, because of the moment of Peter's entrance.  He had just appeared as a silhouette behind the bedroom window, when...BAM!  The fire curtain came down, blocking off the stage.  There was a fire in the theatre and everybody was evacuated!

I never got to see PETER PAN that day, and I have been fascinated with the story and the character ever since!

My campaign...

An exciting new project creating a faithful graphic novel adaptation of J.M.Barrie’s classic story, Peter Pan, generating funds for Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity!

Not sure what a graphic novel is?  Basically, a graphic novel is a full lenght comic book story, in the tradition of the Tintin or Asterix books.

Can you believe there is no graphic novel adaptation of this Peter Pan already?!! The story is ideal for adaptation into this popular medium, and like J. M. BARRIE'S original book, it will appeal to both children and adults alike, for all time!

My adaptation will be faithful to the original vision of the author, which is darker in tone than the Disney version that the majority of the world is familiar with.  It will also contain scenes from the book that were not included in Disney's version!

YOU can help bring this much loved work to a new generation in a format they will relish, and offer a fresh vision to other generations already familiar with the story.

YOU will be generating funds for GREAT ORMOND STREET HOSPITAL CHILDREN'S CHARITY by doing so...

Ready to begin!

THE SCRIPT:

The adapted script is already written and has been read by several other professionals, including Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity, and former editor of THE DANDY, Morris Heggie, who has over forty years experience. I have many professional colleagues at hand for expert advice and support with all aspects of, and through all stages of this project.

THE ARTWORK:

I intend a classic visual style for the book, that will make it timeless...think Winsor McCay  (Little Nemo in Slumberland) meets Herge (Tintin). 

Funding and perks!

I am asking for $32,000, or £20,800 to make this project happen. Yes, that's a lot of money...why so much?

Because the project will take me a full year to complete!  I'm going to pour all my love for Peter Pan into this project, and I intend to produce two high quality pages of artwork per week. This will allow me the time I need to make them as good as they need to be!

The finished book will be 96 pages long (full colour), which breaks the total down to an individual page rate of $333 or £216.  I have written the adaptation myself, and will also be the penciler, inker, colourist, letterer and graphic designer of the project .

Any professional will tell you this is a very reasonable page rate for this amount of work.

The fund total will also cover the cost of printing and postage for the first edition copies of the book.  These will be signed, numbered, and issued exclusively to those that have claimed the book as a perk! 

Please remember, the book will take a year to produce, so most of the perks are long-term. The high resolution images will be available instantly.  Every one who contributes more $5 or more will receive these as soon as the campain ends successfully!

Other ways to help!

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help!

If you can't contribute financially to this project, you can help by spreading the word!  Please Tweet, blog and Facebook this project around. You can also visit/like/share the Facebook page, Pan by Stref'.

Thanks for taking the time to look at my project.  I hope you decide to become part of it, and join me on this magical adventure to bring Peter Pan to life in a new format!   

Stephen White.

story:
Project: M.O.T.H.E.R., as seen on  "THE BIG BANG THEORY", is the Brain Child of Indy Filmaker Nate Brandon. Nate has spent months developing the entire series to ensure that readers will engulf themselves in the intense science fiction odyssey that is Project: M.O.T.H.E.R. Nate has teamed up with some of the hottest artists in the industry to create this epic on going monthly title.Jimbo Salgado of IDW Fame, along with Kate Finnegan the colorist for the growing popular title The Legend of Oz: The Wicked West, and with several other up and coming stars of the industry. At first the goal was to make the comic series, but now it has evolved into a project that is going to help struggling artists in the industry. Nate has started his own label known as STRICK 9 COMICS and its his goal to help writers meet artists  that normally wouldn't have the chance of doing so. He wants to kickstart the industry into a new age with more creator owned titles than ever before.

As for what our first goal is, the $8,500.00 will be used for paying for the Artists, Coloroists and Letterers' cost to help sell our comic. We have two more goals. One, if we can raise $18,000.00 then we can get 2 issues out and make our title a self sustaining title and two, if we can raise $38,000.00 than we can start making our way to various Conventions to meet all of you, our fans, and make new ones on the way. If we hit our other two unofficial goals than we will be increasing the rewards with several very unique special rewards also, the profits of Project: M.O.T.H.E.R. will also go to helping fund other creator owned comics.

Now on to a little bit about Project: M.O.T.H.E.R. Issue #1

M.O.T.H.E.R. 4 was created by a ancient race known as the Plutarians. The Plutarians were a civil race with rich knowledge of science and mathematics. The whole purpose of the Plutarians life was the pursuit of knowledge. They had sent out Mobile Operation Space Informational Robots into all of the galaxies to find out about alien civilazations. On one of the planets a M.O.S.I.R. Unit had visited it was destroyed in an alien invasion. These aliens are known as the Winshai, lead by their emperor Lem Jei. The Plutarians feared that this was going to happen to their planet. With the knowledge they had obtained from all of the M.O.S.I.R. Units they created the M.O.T.H.E.R Units (Mobile Operations Time Hopping Enforcement Robot) to protect their planet and all of the valuable knowledge  they had obtained.  M.O.T.H.E.R. 4 was sent to TXR-12, a Human Colony, to infiltrate the Winshai Empire. M.O.T.H.E.R. 4 is designed to take down the Winshai Empire from the inside out. 

Once on TXR-12, M.O.T.H.E.R.4 assumes the identity of Donna Walsh, a politician of the TXR-12 Senate. The Plutarians had found out Ms. Walsh had gone missing during this time and she would make a prime candidate for M.O.T.H.E.R.4. To work her way into the Winshai Empire. M.O.T.H.E.R.4 started to work her way up the ranks and then hit a bump in the road. Donna Walsh was found alive and it would compromise her covert operations. M.O.T.H.E.R decided to use her time hopping device and hop back in time 1 day before Donna was found. This is where issue 1 starts off.

We plan on making the first issue and distributing it thru Toledo Publishing. The Challenge is the $8500.00,which is what I need to pay the artists to make this happen. The other is that if we can make $18,000.00 so we can make sure that this wonderful comic will become a self sustaining title. The first months returns will pay for the third months comics, and the second months returns will pay for the fourth months returns and so on and so forth. If we can raise $38,000.00 than we can start making our way to various Conventions to meet all of you, our fans, and make new ones on the way. Then with the profits that are left over we can start funding our other titles that you as a fan will love to read!

story:
The Intro

My name is Christina Escamilla. I am a queer feminist Latina author and publisher with interests in the creepy, macabre, and disturbing. While little bits of myself can be found in all of my writing, the Horror Queen graphic novel is especially drawn from many key moments of my life, including surviving trauma and managing mental illness.  A lot of the supernatural elements found in the novel are allegories with dealing with these issues. Not only that but I have also partnered with my cocreators and besties Dane Ashton and Ibrahim Alhebeba to bring you the most compelling storyline possible.

                                                          

 

The Story

Alex Santos has a dark and seedy past. Sins that she is trying to atone for. She seeks the help of Jasmine, the psychic vampire and after trying a spell together they inadvertently release The Mist, an ancient and terrifying creature. It speaks of a ritual that will release the horror queen, a ruler for the new dawn that is coming.


All that is needed is for them to gather the twelve talents, scattered across the world.

The characters are as diverse as my friends, family, and creative team, and equally fascinating. Also~ The novel is filled with touches from Brujería, Santería, Paganism, Hoodoo, and Arabic Mysticism. All of which the creative team has experience with in some form or the other (feel free to ask us questions, we love sharing our thoughts and opinions) :)

Contributors to this campaign will help me take the first steps in completing my magnum opus, and make a diverse, fascinating, and yes, macabre story reach those who may not see themselves or their struggles represented in mainstream media. 

The Artist

The art for the graphic novel is done by Monica Chhay with the coloring done by myself and the lettering done by one of the co-creators, Dane Ashton. 

Who is Monica?

Monica was born under the Taurus constellation during the year of the Earth Snake.  She recently graduated from the University of Houston-Clear Lake with a BFA in painting and is currently working on building her portfolio for grad school. She enjoys things such as the occult, astrology, numerology, spirituality, crystals, lifting, and magick.  She hopes to spread a little bit of magic all around the world with her art.

What Are We Asking for and Why

My team and I are requesting $5,000 (USD).  These funds will go towards the following:

  • Paying the wonderful and talented artist, Monica Chhay*
  • Publication and Production
  • Marketing

* The comic costs $45 per page for the art and we are seeking to finish the first two issues.

The Perks

Complete images of the perks will be forthcoming.  Stick with us! :)

But...but what if we faillll?

In the unfortunate event that the entire goal is not reached, the Horror Queen team's priority is to compensate our fabulous artist and publish the issues ourselves, then print as many as we can afford. 

Please Support Us Because.....We Love You

Growing up as a young, queer Latina, I would have loved to see someone like me in comic books or cartoons. When I began my journey into adulthood, I could not find enough characters that reflected my struggles with mental illness and trauma. I decided that if I did not write mine and my friends' stories, that nobody would. What I did not expect was to have random strangers tell me that my characters felt real, and that they could relate to them. By supporting my writing and this campaign, you will be bringing relatable characters into the lives of people who do not see themselves in mainstream media.

I have self-published multiple books, but this is my largest project to date, and I will need your support to make it happen. 

If you cannot support my campaign at this time, feel free to purchase single issues of the comic when they become available. 

Share this campaign! Everybody has a weird cousin who would be into this, I promise!

Interested in more of my writing? Visit my website at www.horrorqueen.net, or check out my other books on Amazon here.

story:
what is the summer of Blake Sinclair?

The Summer of Blake Sinclair is an online slice of life/social sattire comic. So far the comic is 10 chapters long! remember that you can read it online for free, here; http://blake-sinclair.smackjeeves.com

it is set in the summer between University terms and follows the life of a student and his friends.

the comic was based closely on my expriences at university, and is ultimately my observations on the problems faced when dealing with Life Before, after and During University Education - and mostly explores the 'Hipster Culture'.

 the main character of the story (Blake), deals with identity, 'fake' 'truth' the blur, and what it means to be Hipster and to be part of the Generation Y culture.

lastly, all these themes are wrapped up in a cute little romance and drama story with hopefuly a unique comic and drawing style!

 

Ok. so what am I contributing to here?

So far, I have managed to fund printing for Chapters one and two on my own! Chapter three, however, is very big and long, and i won't have he money to print it myself - this is where you come in!

Essentially this IndieGoGo project is a pre-order for Chapter three; so anyone who contributes the main amount of £10 gets the book (and a few extras!)

The Book is a4 size (big) Full colour (colourful) and a whopping 84 pages :) this is also a test, and if this campaign goes well, I will use it in future to print more Blake Sinclair books =) 

The full amount I intend to raise pays for 100 copies of the book - wonderfuly, if the full amount doesn't get raised you all get refunded- so it's pretty much a win/win situation for everyone :D!

 

That's it;

if you do support this project-

- thank you for supporting girly, emotional, character driven comics (that are not the most popular thing in the world.)

i hope doing these and other future projects promotes to people the impact that COMICS can have on people.

thank you :) peace out!x

what is the summer of Blake Sinclair?
The Summer of Blake Sinclair is an online slice of life/social sattire comic. So far the comic is 10 chapters long! remember that you can read it online for free, here; http://blake-sinclair.smackjeeves.com
it is set in the summer between University terms and follows the life of a student and his friends.
the comic was based closely on my expriences at university, and is ultimately my observations on the problems faced when dealing with Life Before, after and During University Education - and mostly explores the 'Hipster Culture'.
 the main character of the story (Blake), deals with identity, 'fake' 'truth' the blur, and what it means to be Hipster and to be part of the Generation Y culture.

story:
Summary:

My name is Mike.  I am an Indie Comics Creator creating comics/stories under the banner of Dork Arts Comics.  What started out as a small thing I did to pass down time evolved into something quite fulfilling for me and has grown in an endeavor that I can use to tell creative, fun and real stories about topics that are of interest to me. 

This campaign marks the beginning of what I am calling "Phase 2" of my indie comics endeavor.  I had completed a comic prior to this which was done to see if I could complete a full comic on my own.  Well that was checked off the list and in this phase I am hoping to access an audience I have cultivated to get this 2nd book made and distributed for ocular consumption.  

Those people taking the time to help contribute to this project will be helping me to achieve not only a small personal goal, but also help build towards a larger plan for future projects under the banner of Dork Arts Comics (In addition to making a humble comic nerd's heart ever so happy).  All contributions will be going towards to costs of printing and shipping of the books that have been completed as well as acquire the other items listed for perks and rewards.

What I Need & What You Get

I am asking for a total of $1,800.   These funds go towards the cost of having the books printed and shipped to me (and then to you).  

In addition to the the books being printed, I am offering sketch cover copies of both books.  Shwag like T-shirts and hoodies with the Dork Arts Comics logo on them and also original art pieces for backers.  

In the even I do not reach the intended goal, the funds raised will go towards getting those who did back the projects as much as I can (books, merch, etc). 

Risks & Challenges

In my opinion there is little risk/challenge to backing this project.   As stated, the books are completed and ready to be printed.  I have access to the merch offered and am able to get that for you quickly.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is able to contribute monetarily to projects like this.  Any little act can help.  

In the event that you fit this description, please just share the link to this campaign, give me a shout out on Instagram (DorkArtsStudio), come by check out my work, say hey, it's all good.  Thank you for taking the time to read this, I hope to get you a copy of one of my books.

story:
I am looking to fund the manufacturing of a large number of factory made vinyl Trump Troll dolls. The sculpture seems to have struck a very popular chord with my family and friends on Facebook.

 I want to make this figure widely available to everyone around the world that has taken a liking to my caricature sculpture and to do that I need your help to cover the costs of making the production molds and castings as well as the freight costs from the toy factory. 

I will cast and finish the resins figures as soon as the goal is met and have them on the way to those at that support level. The vinyl figures will be turned around as soon as I can get the factory on board and fulfilling the orders. The art is ready to go and it's a matter of production of the pieces now. 

Thank you very much for your help in making this happen!!!

Risks and challenges

The first challenge is finding a quality factory to make these figures. 
Thankfully I have been in the collectible industry for decades and have made friends with all areas of production so it is a matter of narrowing down the companies that can produce these to our satisfaction and price point. 
This will take some time to get samples and make changes if necessary. Please know I will do this as quickly as possible.

I want to be sure everyone has their reward in a timely manner. 
I will send out a survey after the fundraising drive is over and ask for your mailing address. Then as soon as the figures are available for shipping I will have them on the way to you!

story:
THE CHRISTMAS ODYSSEY CONTINUES!

Last Fall, the first issue of BRIC-A-BRAC successfully funded on Indiegogo. 

We met our main characters Garret and Marie as they embarked on their journey to find Father Christmas and save Planet Christmas from impending doom. That doom, almost single-handedly, was brought by General Almond and his army of Nutcrackers who were determined to take over the Planet and steal its resources. 

Issue Two continues this epic story while adding more characters and obstacles! You will meet new characters like the ominous Jack Frost, the evil Caesar Dimitrius, and the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future among others!

Issue Two will be a 30-page comic book written by Ryan Haack, featuring interior art by Rafael Sam. The comic book will also include a five-page back-up story with art by Tom Barton. 

WRITER/CREATOR - RYAN HAACK

My name is RYAN HAACK and I'm the creator and writer of BRIC-A-BRAC! Since I was a little kid, I was fascinated by Christmas and all the lore surrounding it! I loved the imagery, the decorations, the holiday specials, and I still do to this day! BRIC-A-BRAC is my attempt at creating a story that can show adults and children how valuable and important Christmas is as a concept! It's an incredibly useful holiday with ideals and values which we can implement every single day of our lives! I am so passionate about this story and had an absolute BLAST writing in the dramatic, fun, and always exciting world that is BRIC-A-BRAC! I am the host of the FAR-FETCHED STORYTELLING PODCAST and the creator of the web-comic the UNSPEAKABLE TEXT, too! 

 

INTERIOR ARTIST/CHARACTER DESIGNER - RAFAEL SAM

Born in São Paulo, and raised in Recife (PE), Rafael Sam has worked as a freelance illustrator and comic artist for 9 years. He has worked in the area of textbooks and also comic books, in cartoon style, concept art, and has made scenes for animations. Some time ago, he worked for DreamWorks Animation's comics division, where he made 3 editions of the Madagascar title. He recently worked on the catharsis-funded Black Desert author project where he made the official launch at ccxp 2018. His Instagram is @rafael1234hc. ​

 

COVER ARTIST/BACK-UP STORY ARTIST - TOM BARTON

Tom’s been working as an illustrator for the last 5 years. He’s done several comics, including a short webcomic series for League of Legends called “Olaf Vs Everything”. His biggest influences are the likes of Joe Madureira, Chris Bachalo, and Ed McGuinness. When he’s not working on comics, he’s coming up with character designs, concept art, and writing his own stories. His Instagram is @tomo_tron. 

As mentioned before, this will be a 25+ page comic book. It will be identical in design to the last comic we produced for BRIC-A-BRAC #1. Because they are so similar, it was very easy for me to calculate shipping costs and how much I will need to deliver the best product possible. Here's some breakdowns for those interested: 

PRODUCTION OF COMIC (ART/LETTERING) : $5,000

PRINTING (ISSUE 2 and REPRINTS of ISSUE 1): $1,000

SHIPPING (NATION-WIDE AND INTERNATIONAL) : $2,500

And YES, this book will be shipped and delivered both nationally (U.S.) and internationally before Christmas. In fact, my goal is to finish the production of the book before Thanksgiving so I won't have to deal with the horrors of shipping in December. Rafael and I met our expected deadline last time, and  we will be able to do it again BEFORE THE HOLIDAY SEASON! 

PLEASE HELP US MAKE THIS COMIC BOOK A REALITY!

story:
Red Talon: The Series is a full-color standard sized comic spanning a 5 issue mini series. This will be the release of issue 2. 

 

Funding Our Third Issue!

 

Who will like this series?

Red Talon is an action/adventure/superhero story featuring Red Talon the last of the Order of Talon, an ancient Ninja Crossbreed clan set to protect the innocent. His mission is to bring down DARK the evil organization that killed his parents and tries to control and weaponize Crossbreed's across the globe among even more sinister evil goals. 

  • Superheroes
  • Conspiracy Theories/Occult 
  • Good vs Evil
  • Ninja warriors/weapons
  • High DBZ-like brutal action
  • Kid friendly for whole family 
  • Comics with people born with powers like X-Men etc. 

The Story So Far...

A brief look at what Red Talon: The Series is all about...

 

Not the Typical Superheroes...

This story is set in the shared universe of Star Cross Comics which features such titles as G.O.D., Tribulation Task Force, Phantom Lion, Ebon Guard & Corndog.  It features super-powered beings known as Crossbreed's (featured in multiple Star Cross stories). Red Talon is one of the baddest ninja superheroes you will ever see!

Red Talon and his lone Master: Mayoki the Wulf are tasked with facing down DARK and uncovering the truth on why Talon's parents were murdered. DARK seems to have their hands in everything and the odds are stacked against Talon but with the help of other super-powered Crossbreed's his mission can prevail

Issue 1-2 Recap (Spoilers)

 

 

The Goal:

Star Cross Comics brings you the exciting continuation of writer Ken Keller's Superhero Ninja Series Red Talon: # 2  This exciting and fast paced 24 page comic continues where issue 1 left off with Talon invading a base of the evil corporation DARK who killed his parents. Seeing a captured female Crossbreed: Night Eye on the security camera's, Talon swoops in to save her and action & much more ensues. With new exciting character's being seen for the first time: Telepore, Scorcher & Icetine. 

Red Talon 3 Script is done and its AWESOME! Fund this campaign and all proceeds will go to the art/colors/lettering of Red Talon 3!

"Red Talon 2" features some amazing work from the creative team of Keller and Jaxon & Dawson. The art is cutting edge split between Jaxon & Dawson. There are new threats, Talon's first defeat, and the beginning of the formation of his allies. Don't miss it! 

 

Like, Share, and Pledge!

 

 

Stretch Goals:

$500 - Digital copy of Red Talon 1 for all backers  - 

35 Backers - All physical backers get a special edition trading card  -  

$1300 - All backers will get a Red Talon coloring book.  Digital or Physical  -  

$1700 - Red Talon poster for all Backers 

Creative Team

Writer - Ken R Keller

Co-Creator Ken K Keller 

Layout Pencils - David Jaxon, Brian Dawson

Pencils/Inks - David Jaxon, Brian Dawson

Colors - Joe Spicer

Letters - Luke Stone

Editor - Joe Spicer, all of Star Cross

Printer- Pam Keller & American Postcard Printers 

 

About the Creator:

Ken R Keller was born in 1994. He grew up loving comic books, Star Wars, Cartoons and some Anime. Some of his favorite inspirations were: X-Men, Batman, Avenger's, DBZ, Ninja Turtles, Watchmen & more. Ken has always had a passion for writing; writing poems in elementary school, stories, and his own hand drawn comics for years of some of his favorites. 

Red Talon was a dream created many years ago, around 2003-2005 . At first he was called Black Talon and he was actually created by Ken R Keller (III's) father, Ken K Keller (II). I am Ken R Keller and the writer, story-teller and co-creator of the Red Talon universe along with my father. We created our own studio Flat World Comics all the way back then but never made it a reality. 

I then spent many of my teenage years trying to convert our comic book idea into a teen novel; in fact I wrote the novel twice. I would spend hours roleplaying online, writing fan fictions, working on the novel and honing my writing. In the end when I was 23 (2017) I decided that the story would be best seen as it was always intended: as a action packed comic book with an original story.

In 2018 my family and I self produced and published Red Talon 1 through Flat World Comics. The first issue was put in Emerald City Comic's in St Pete Florida; being the very first comic shop to host RT.  Red Talon issue 1 and quickly caught the eye of Publisher Star Cross Comics ran by Joe Spicer. Now the Red Talon's universe has collided with Star Cross for an even wider and more thrilling universe: think Christian Marvel or DC in the making. You can help us create this dream and make sure the Red Talon brand continues for many years to come!

Now Red Talon 2 had a successful launch on Kickstarter but we wanted to bring it over to Indie GoGo! We won't let COVID-19 stop us but thoughts and prayers to all affected. Ken Keller is also working on a expanded origins Red Talon novel & another novel set in the Red Talon universe called the Raven Wolf these will be published through Flat World Comics but still tie in with Star Cross universe. 

Personal Life:

At 26 now Ken Keller still plans to finish his degree in English writings. He works at a company called RGIS, manages and writes for Red Talon and other Star Cross stories and manages and created his own music label. He is an artist and his passion lays in his comics, music and art.

 

Risks and challenges

We all know the risk of supporting a "Facebook publisher" Will you get your comic? Will it show up on time? Star Cross Comics publishes with confidence! They have been producing comics for 20 years. The also have a good track record of completing orders. You can be confident that you will receive your book and in a timely manner as the majority of production is complete and the files will be going to print before this campaign closes. This is also the 2nd book in a series that has been successfully funded 2 times prior. Star Cross Comics is also proud of its quality control measures. They have been very selective of the partners they keep due to quality control and branding. You will get a retail quality book packaged nicely to your door!

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • If you can't back, share the link and please spread the word!

story:
Summary

Funding for a 100 page original graphic novel in hardcover . Black and white interior,  with color cover.

Hey guys, my name’s Adam Archer, I’ve been in comics since 2000. I started working in-studio then as a colorist for Wildstorm/DC Comics in La Jolla, CA. I left the studio in 2007 once I was able to line up enough freelance work and have been writing and drawing full time since then. 

 

Some of the series I’ve drawn include, Friday the 13th, Gotham Academy, Scribblenauts, Ninja Turtles, Spooks, Batman Beyond, and Ratchet and Clank. My Main employers over the years have been DC, Marvel, Warner Brothers, and Cepia Toys. 

 

Over the last decade I’ve been trying to transition from drawing for other people, to writing and drawing for myself. This is my first indiegogo campaign, and hopefully a big step toward making that happen. 

I have over twenty creator-owned illustrated novels on Amazon now, but this is the first graphic novel I’ve done for myself in 7 years. 

 

If this gets funded, I’ll be able to finish the project in 6 weeks instead of 6 months (by cutting out most other freelancing) and for the first time in my life, have one of my books in a beautiful hardcover format.

 

At the time of this post, 90% of the book is drawn, I have almost half of it inked, and I already started lettering. 

 

First, some sample pages...

 

 

Clem sprang into my mind in June of this year, and it's been a joy getting the fellah out. 

 

 

 

What's Needed & What You Get

 

Transparency 

 

My cost of printing for a small print run is about $5000. Shipping the books to my door is just under $500.

 

Taking into account the cost of boxes ($450), other shipping needs, and the fees for a campaign, I’ve tried to keep the price as low as I could without losing money. 

 

Perks

 

With any luck, if the campaign brings in more than my base costs, I can upgrade a few things on the book itself. 

 

1. Slightly thicker cover stock.

 

2. Instead of blank endsheets (the first and last pages in a hardcover book) I can have illustrations on them. 

 

3. And possibly 4 color printing of the black ink line work (rather than standard Black only printing) which can give richer and deeper black tones. (Still a black and white book, just higher quality blacks.) 

 

The Impact

 

The future is buying art directly from the artist with as few middlemen in between as possible. 

 

This allows us to express our voices as they are, rather than have them filtered or changed by publishers (art by committee). 

 

It gives creators a better shot at make a living (doing what they love, rather than work for hire) with hopefully stronger wages, as none of the profits are wasted or eaten up by the companies. I’m excited to see if crowd funding will help me do this. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The only risks in this campaign are for me, (any unforeseen costs I accrue by the end), not the customer. 

 

This book will be done, regardless. 

 

I’ve done thousands of pages so far in my career. My hope with this campaign, again, is to be able to prioritize this book, and have it hop into the world in a quality hardcover edition. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, or if you live overseas, there are other ways you can help. Sharing this campaign on social media, or through the link here on indiegogo means a ton. 

 

Thanks so much for reading guys and checking out what I’m up to. 

 

Have a great day!

Adam
story_txt:
Summary
Funding for a 100 page original graphic novel in hardcover . Black and white interior,  with color cover.
Hey guys, my name’s Adam Archer, I’ve been in comics since 2000. I started working in-studio then as a colorist for Wildstorm/DC Comics in La Jolla, CA. I left the studio in 2007 once I was able to line up enough freelance work and have been writing and drawing full time since then. 
 
Some of the series I’ve drawn include, Friday the 13th, Gotham Academy, Scribblenauts, Ninja Turtles, Spooks, Batman Beyond, and Ratchet and Clank. My Main employers over the years have been DC, Marvel, Warner Brothers, and Cepia Toys. 
 
Over the last decade I’ve been trying to transition from drawing for other people, to writing and drawing for myself. This is my first indiegogo campaign, and hopefully a big step toward making that happen.

Adam

story:
The Pitch

I am Matthew Henry Ford.

I've been running Dustbunny Pictures for about 10 years now, as a hub for my art and animation. At college, I studied Animation, and during that time I took a greater interest in the art of visual storytelling, and found my scripts and storyboards taking on a much more specific form: Comics.

I've developed and written 5, (that's right FIVE) unique storylines, roughed and revised them a few times over, honing them into epic fables as I went along, and offered them up as free-to-read titles online:

Hoodrat,

Captain Kelly,

Maggie Matilla,

Popoki's Island, 

and Chronicles of the IGP. 

I want to tell these stories, if nothing else, and have a chance to share them with others. And I'm moving into a new phase in their production.  All 5 are getting a "reboot", and a devoted domain/website, with new pages added on a weekly rotation schedule.

Maggie is the most current.  IGP & Kelly will be getting an updated revision in art style, and current script additions to match, and Hoodrat & Popoki will finally get a full start into the series, not just scripts/concepts only.

The Costs

The short of it is, that in order to step up production, I need a new tablet, a Wacom Cintiq (about $1000-2000), and a few hundred extra for website costs, modification and development, (and to cover the indiegogo fees).

The Rewards are Art. Unique, one-of-a-kind, all your own, pieces of your own choosing, either the original, or a high quality color glossy print (framed if you so choose) with the drawing, or digital file (psd), or all three, however you choose, it's yours and yours alone, whatever you wish, I eandeavor to put down onto paper for you.

This is much the same way I would usually charge for commissioned work, but stepping up the timetable and putting it a "safer" public forum, like crowdfunding with terms offered.

I'm hoping to reach the goal, but if not it still puts me in a slightly better position to start the "reboot", albeit, at a much slower rate getting the pages online. A page a week from each series, on a rotation.  

If I reach the goal, that figure could double or triple, maybe put me on the path to publication or even print, or animated shorts.

The Impact

A bit more detailed blurb on each series is available in the gallery. With some art, etc. But to really, finally get invested in these stories, writing them all the way to their conclusions, would be an immensely satisfying goal, for both me and the reader.

As a show of good faith, if you're interested, you can also see/read a few of the prototype/working models of the comic series on my site.

Read some here, get a feel:

http://www.dustbunnypictures.com/gallery/comics...

The Art Piece Requests donators recieve will be done in order of donations/requests recieved, and I will try my best to keep you up to date and keep you well informed, as to your piece's completion.

Help Me, Please.

Spread the word. Share on facebook, tumblr, deviantart, twitter, reddit, whichever social media outlet you choose. Paper and word of mouth works just as well, tell your friends.

Here's hoping.  Let's do this! :)

story:
What is Phoenix Comics & Games?

Phoenix Comics and Games is going to be the premier comic book store in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Seattle, Washington.  As both a life-long comic book geek and gamer, my goal is to create a space that you, faithful readers, card floppers, dice chuckers and board gamers can come to enjoy.  I want someplace where it's okay to drop by, grab a book off the shelf and sit down and peruse it without fear of being glared at.

To that end, we're putting in a conference table for daytime gaming and reading, mobile displays that let us change from primarily a selling venue during the day to a gaming venue at night!  We've got a great design for some custom acrylics that really make the comics and graphic novels pop off the shelves.  To finish it out, we also want to recruit some local artistic talent to doodle on the walls.  And of course, we want this to be your personalized Comic Store.

But to do all that we need your help!

Personalized?  What do you mean by that?

It's pretty simple really - we want to know what you want us to carry.  By donating as little as $10, you get a chance to make your thoughts known.  Should we carry War Machine?  Warhammer 40K?  Tell us that!  

Every perk at all levels of funding comes with a vote on a survey after the funding period has ended.  The more votes something gets, the more of a slice of the pie that it will occupy in my initial inventory purchase.  But just to give you all a brief listing of what I already know I'm going to carry:

  • Marvel, DC, Image, and Dark Horse Comics
  • Graphic Novels of all of the above named publishers
  • Magic: The Gathering (just packs and decks, no singles)
  • Dungeons & Dragons
  • Pathfinder
  • Role Playing Games
  • Reaper Miniatures
  • Board Games

So, if you don't see something on the list, here's your chance to add it in!  Or heck, see something on there that isn't very specific?  Help me flesh out the idea!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Ultimately what we need is money for the fixtures, the table, and the artists to decorate the space we're going to secure.  Once we've got those, we need to start in on the initial inventory.  The more money up front we have for that, the less we have to shmooze with banks.   Which is no fun at all, trust me.

So, that said, I do want to give back to the community, especially if we exceed the goal I have set up for the campaign.  In the event that we exceed the goal, the money raised will go to providing additional perks (see below) for all backers.  In the jaw-dropping event that we drastically exceed all of the stretch goals set forth, well...I'll have to get creative and think of new ways to reward all of you wonderful people out there!  

 

Stretch Goals

$25,000 - Success!  Everyone gets all of the perks that they backed! Huzzah!

$30,000 - [Not Yet Unlocked But Very Cool Upgrade]

$35,000 - [Not Yet Unlocked But Very Cool Upgrade - Party Time!]

$40,000 - [Seriously Cool Redacted Upgrade]

$45,000 - [Seriously Cool Redacted Upagrade - Party Time x2!]

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I understand that during these hard economic times not everyone can support these types of projects.  If you like this, blog about it.  Tell a friend.  Like it on facebook or tweet about it on twitter.  Every little bit of word of mouth helps.  

And thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for doing so.
