story:
!!!DISCLAIMER!!!! This project is unofficial and is in NO way affiliated with the official Fallout franchise or Bethesda. It is a completely unauthorized fan comic. The official Fallout franchise and it's owners in no way endorses, is responsible for, or affiliated in anyway to this project.

 

TLDR: Campaigning to gather funds to produce part 2 of my Fallout comic (based on fallout 1), will be creating and shipping physical copies of part one as a reward.

 

The FALLOUT Survival Guide is an unofficial, free to read comic online that faithfully retraces the steps of the first Fallout video game. This is a fan comic, however, it is not a fan fiction. I have poured through the lore and have desperately tried to piece the canonical events to the best of my ability. I hope to be so accurate that this book could double as a strategy guide.

 

STRETCH GOALS!

  • $10,000 -  A wasteland mini map will be added to every order.

(I'll update more stretch goals soon)

 

The comic will have a vintage / beat up vibe to it, complete with bends and stains.

I have all 16 pages for issue one done already, however I do plan on going back and reworking the colors before publishing, I've experimented along the way and want to just go back and hone the style a little more.

mock of cover art

 

These were just 3 sample pages from the comic, but, if you don't mind spoilers, you can read all of part one for free online by

clicking this link!

 

What exactly is this Fallout project?:

The TLDR is that it’s a comic.

Right now I am working on Book 1, which is a painfully faithful adaptation of the Fallout 1 game. For those who have only played the later games, Fallout 1 is a much darker story. It’s more violent, sexual, and just all around more gritty and mature.

Book 1 consists of 6 chapters. Each chapter is about 4 parts long and each part is comprised of about 16 pages. Give or take a few dozen, the completed main story is going to be about 380 pages long.

Additionally, each part will have cover art, and each chapter will also have a self contained side story. The side story will feature the main characters, but not really follow the main story as they are based on side quests and random encounters. These side stories will vary greatly in lengths anywhere from 1 to about 10 pages long. (note, these will be more clearly defined later as right now I have been focusing mainly on the main story structure)

So all together the first book will be roughly 400+ pages long, and will take a while! About 2 years if I’m able to keep it going. If I can gather enough support and complete book 1, then I’ll start working on Book 2 which will be an adaptation of Fallout 2. And I’ll just keep going as long as I can get support. I NEED to make Book 2, but the more I think of it, Book 3 and New Vegas would be awesome too!

 

Who is working on it and why? 

Right now it’s just me and I have hired a talented artist to draw for me, but, depending on how much support I can gather, I plan on hiring many more.

I am writing the comic, and creating layouts, doing clean up, lettering and color. I give my mocks to Dee and he gives me back some line work.

 

Here’s my plan.

Dee will be the main story line artist.

But for the side quests I plan to commission other, lesser known, but extremely talented artists.

And the covers will be a mix, sometimes me, sometimes Dee, sometimes other artists.

Dee will have first dibs on the main quest, but if he ever doesn’t want to do it anymore I’ll just pick up a new artist and keep moving forward. Although I hope he stays a while. It’s going to be so awesome watching him grow!

This is the best part of this project IMO. I know so many extremely talented, underrated artists. I really do love these peoples work, and would love to shine a spotlight on it. A collective of all these really original art styles. Anyway, back to the details.

Where will the money be going?

The bulk of the money will be going towards reward fulfillment. The rest of the money will go to funding part 2.

Funding goal is $5000

  • $2300 Cost to print 1000 copies of the comic
  • $2000 Production costs for part 2
  • $700 Rewards, packaging, and adjusted shipping

This is the bare bones cost to get everything printed and shipped out.

 

REWARDS!

DEPENDING ON YOUR PERK TIER:

All tiers will get a copy of The FALLOUT Survival Guide issue #1. Additional perks include:

• $15 - Copy of The FALLOUT Survival Guide issue #1 + Postcard

• $30 - SIGNED copy of tFSG #1 + Postcard + Fold-out 11"x17" Poster

• $70 - SIGNED copy of tFSG #1 + Poster + Postcard +  5"x7" Hand drawn sketch

• $100 - All other rewards + Get your name printed in the back of the comic!

 

The poster will be a clean version of the cover art with a few alterations (smaller logo, no bar code or issue number). I will update indigo with an image of the postcard as soon as I finalize it :)

 

 

Risks & Challenges

There are plenty of challenges that go along with a project like this; creating a comic book isn't simple and a lot goes into them.

The first and biggest challenge is simply producing the pages (if only in digital form). I have to adapt the script, design the mock ups and page layout, coordinate with my artist/s, get the pages draw and sent to me, cleaned up, lettered, colored... it's a long process, HOWEVER, this is why I didn't ask for funding for part one, to help insure I was able to provide pages (on a set scheduled) and keep the promises I make.

With the exception of only one delay (it was two days late) I have kept my promise and uploaded on scheduled for the past 3 months :) and I have only refined my process and things run more smoothly everyday.

Of course there is a whole other set of challenges that go along with producing the physical copies for rewards and shipping them, but I have been creating and shipping products for years now through my online store, so very familiar with the process and don't expect to be blindsided from an unforeseen detail, and am confident I will be able to resolve it if I am.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can help without being a contributor is by being a fan, reading the comic (online for free) and just sharing and talking about it. Sharing and talking about something you love helps out way more than you realize sometimes.

I have to adapt the script, design the mock ups and page layout, coordinate with my artist/s, get the pages draw and sent to me, cleaned up, lettered, colored... it's a long process, HOWEVER, this is why I didn't ask for funding for part one, to help insure I was able to provide pages (on a set scheduled) and keep the promises I make.
With the exception of only one delay (it was two days late) I have kept my promise and uploaded on scheduled for the past 3 months :) and I have only refined my process and things run more smoothly everyday.
Of course there is a whole other set of challenges that go along with producing the physical copies for rewards and shipping them, but I have been creating and shipping products for years now through my online store, so very familiar with the process and don't expect to be blindsided from an unforeseen detail, and am confident I will be able to resolve it if I am.
 
Other Ways You Can HelpThe best way you can help without being a contributor is by being a fan, reading the comic (online for free) and just sharing and talking about it. Sharing and talking about something you love helps out way more than you realize sometimes.

story:
What is 'New Comic Star'?

New Comic Star is a monthly comic book anthology, distributed digitally via iPad, bringing 15 quality comics direct to you every 30 days.

New Comic Star is not aiming to bring a single genre or style to you month after month, but rather a wide selection of what the newcomers and old hands of the comic world are producing. We want to make sure that our readers are getting the best, most varied and most entertaining graphic tales every issue. 

And the way we'll do it is simple. As well as running comics as monthly series we will also publish longer, one-off stories on a regular basis and through a voting platform, built into the NCS app, the readers can let us know what they like and what they want more of.

For the readers, New Comic Star is a monthly collection of new and exciting comic works, guaranteed to entertain and entice.

For comic creators, New Comic Star is a publisher commited to new ideas, new universes and new stories.

Whoever you are, New Comic Star is for you.

 

What does your contribution do?

Basically, every dollar from the Indiegogo funding drive goes towards not just getting the first issue out, but laying a framework for New Comic Star's continued publication and success. This is not just a campaign to pump out a single issue of a comic, this is the foundation of a publisher that will digitally distribute comics from authors both new and old into the forseeable future.

For the organisation, the money you contribute goes to meeting with:

  • Contract lawyers
  • Accountants
  • Taxation specialists
That ensure that New Comic Star can protect the rights of their published writers and artists and get them paid on time, every time. It also pays for up-front costs that pre-empt the first issue like:
  • Website design and hosting
  • App creation
  • Advertising
For the readers, the money you contribute means:
  • A top notch, fully functional website for readers and subcscribers available from day one
  • Creation of forums, competitions and other member content to reward those readers who vote and contribute to the continued success of New Comic Star launching simultaneously with the first issue
New Comic Star will self-sustain on revenue from advertising, sales and subscriptions; but every dollar contributed to this Indiegogo campaign ensures that NCS is the top-quality periodical that we envision from the beginning, rather than down the line. 
 
Please note: All contributions above $100 will net you an invitation to new Comic Star launch party, which will be held in Sydney and will be a great chance to rub shoulders with everyone contributing to the first issue (and canapes).
 
 

Who is New Comic Star for?

Everyone! Well... Everyone who likes comic books (so, everyone cool).

Basically:

If you like the sound of what we're selling and you can't wait for an issue of New Comic Star in your hot little hand, CONTRIBUTE!

If you're a comic book artist or writer who knows how valuable it is to have a place to get published, get promoted and get paid, CONTRIBUTE!

If we hit our goal then it means that New Comic Star will launch as a well advertised, well supported comic periodical with a solid web back-end. It ensures that the contracts and payrolls that get our writers and artists paid properly and legitimately will be in order.

If we exceed our goal it means that New Comic Star can increase the budget for advertising and promotion, develop for Android and/or Kindle distribution and even produce a limited run of print editions beyond the special first prints that we have as rewards. Every dollar means a better New Comic Star.

 

 

Wallet's empty, but you still want to help?

Well, that's okay, if you're a little strapped for cash but you still want to help out then here's what you can do:

Let everyone know about New Comic Star! Not just people who would contribute monetarily, but artists and writers who would want to submit their work to us! Direct them here or straight to our website and tell them what we're all about. 

Check us out on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/newcomicstar

or Twitter at http://www.twitter.com/newcomicstar

and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

 

Thank you everyone for your support!

At this point, you can look forward to reading the first issue of New Comic Star on July 23rd, 2012. (Subject to change)

 

Interested in being published in New Comic Star? Want to know more?

Head to http://www.newcomicstar.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello there! I'm The Elegant Cat, a young comic artist who just finished a personal challenge that I like to call "100% comics". During this challenge I had to do 100 comics in 100 days...for no real reason whatsoever. I did it for personal improvement and to prove myself that I am able to do such a thing. So, I chose an idea, a site, and I started posting my mini-series "Dev & the Fanbase" on memecenter.com. 
It's been a while since a finished the challenge (successfully) and I can't even say how many things I learned as an author and as a person... I learned on my skin that hard work really pays. So I decided to start an indiegogo campaign to collect all of the episodes...in USB keys! And now I really want to talk about this...because it's really not about my little comic series, but ut's about showing the industry and the authors another way to publish a comic. I thought that since we’re talking about web comics here, a paper version would have been unfitting. I really hate when a web designed comics has to change in the layout and the composition in order to be published.
On the other hand i understand the need of the costumer to have a physical proof of his investment...that's why I chose USB keys for this because, they can be fancy and professional! They can also be packaged in nice alluminium boxes with the logo on top and stuff like that and that's what I'm trying to do here.
If I reach my goal I'm planning to order a decent amount of these keys on flashbay.com
and start spreading this new idea of publishing comics through authors and editors.
The industry can be changed, people! 


What We Need & What You Get

Now, let me just say that I do not plan to have more money than I need for this...and I want to be 100% honest because I really, really believe in this project and I want you to believe me...If I don't get the founds, fine. You will get your money back and in some cases (view perks) you will still get your product because I can afford to get 50 keys on my own...but I want this to be a thing.


250 USB keys + packages at flashbay.com = 1300 euros more or less, so, considering possible nonsenses from the site, fees to pay and margin of error, I will go safe and I will ask you guys 1500 euros to get this started.

For everyone of you that manages to offer 4.90 or more there's one of the packaged keys with the pdf file of the whole series and more (again, view perks).

I don't have much to offer aside my own art but I managed to procure myself a stock of 50 t-shirts with the logo of the series and there's one with your name on if you donate 24.90 euros! Other than that I can offer personal comics, previews of my upcoming experimental graphic novel "Underground Cult", wallpapers, custoized avatar pics and things like that.

Please ,notice that all of the delivery costs is on charge of the receiver.

The Impact

As I said before, I'm not making this for my comic (well, not only) but to prove a point.
I want to prove that web comics can be published in new and unique ways, ways that actually respect the original format of the work.
If we can manage to make this a thing I strongly believe we can make this an example and an option for all the authors on the internet. USB keys are inexpensive, way cheaper than  a traditional print. Just imagine the things that such a thing could do for both the authors and the industry!



I am asking you for 1500 euros but if I manage to have more I could finally afford my own website and maybe starting a production. I could spend more time experimenting on web comics and make more "100% comics" challenge. It would be a great thing for me to make this kind of things for a living...and now I'm flying high with my imagination .
Let's keep it real for now. 1500 euros. 250 keys. Seems reasonable, isn't it?

Other Ways You Can Help

I really hope I get you excited at this point and if you can't help with money no problem.
You can help me just following my work on my tumblr page at http://www.tumblr.com/blog/thecatscomics or sharing my "Dev & the Fanbase" episodes on Facebook or twitter. You can find the whole series here http://www.memecenter.com/theelegantcat.
Naturally, remember to link this campaign to your friends on the internet.

story:
“The Old West had black heroes who have been forgotten or ignored, and this was my chance to blend that fact with pulp, western, and science fiction storytelling. And it was a chance to work with one of my heroes, Sam Glanzman.”

-Joe R. Lansdale

WELCOME TO THE RED RANGE

INDIEGOGO INDEMAND PAGE!

To best understand what RED RANGE is all about, one should read this review, published within the pages of LOCUS magazine in 1999:

"Joe R. Lansdale's certainly a modern legend himself, having been around for some time now. But comics artist Sam Glanzman's got an even more legendary historical grounding, having been professionally drawing for six decades or so. These two worthies have collaborated on Lansdale's graphic novel, RED RANGE. The first page of RED RANGE itself begins full tilt with graphic ultraviolence as Lansdale and Glanzman plunge us into a 19th century Klan lynching of a black Texas family. Abruptly in the midst of the atrocity, the Kluxers are interrupted by a mysterious rider who's a deadly shot with both his pistols and long-range Sharps buffalo rifle. It's the feared and hated (by the KKK, at least) Red Mask, a tough, lethal, black man who wisely keeps his identity concealed. Writer Lansdale's unerring ear for exotic period and regional dialog remains constant. His penchant for grim humor appears throughout. His hardcore, hard-nosed sense of social conscience remains intact."

RED RANGE was originally published in 1999 by Mojo Press. Unfortunately, Mojo went out of business that same year, and the book has been out of print ever since.

For the last two years, I have been busy acquiring, editing and (working closely with production and marketing) bringing over 24 graphic novel reprint collections to market through another American publisher.  One of those collections was even nominated for an Eisner award, THE PUMA BLUES by Stephen Murphy and Michael Zulli.

Recently, I decided to leave my position at that publisher, and launch my own publishing imprint...IT'S ALIVE!

In the past, I have worked very closely with both Sam Glanzman and Joe R. Lansdale to put some of their more important out of print works back on the shelves.  For Glanzman, I put together the A SAILOR'S STORY collection, the U.S.S. STEVENS collection, and the ATTU collection.  For Lansdale, I resurrected his first award-winning short story collection, BY BIZARRE HANDS.

(Check out this excellent review the A SAILOR'S STORY collection received in The New York Times: http://artsbeat.blogs.nytimes.com/2015/04/28/war-stories-both-quiet-and-loud/ )

So, it only makes sense that I would launch my new imprint with a graphic novel by both Joe R. Lansdale, and Sam Glanzman!

I am asking for $15,000 to produce a 96 page trade paperback graphic novel.  A large chuck of this money goes towards an advance for the creators.  The next biggest chuck goes towards the printing of the book (the book will have a matte cover, and thick 70lb glossy interior stock).  Another large chunk goes to the colorist, who will be coloring every single page of the story (the original was published in black and white).  I was also lucky enough to hire comic book legend Stephen R. Bissette to write a well-research, historical afterword for this collection (go find a copy of THE PUMA BLUES collection, read his afterword, and you will understand the value he brings to any publication).  Since we are unable to work from the original art, I will need to have the original book scanned in page by page and all the artwork touched up by a professional pre-press technician, who will also be assisting with the overall design of the book (Yep, that costs money too!).  I am also spending a certain amount on the promotion of this Kickstarter campaign.  In the end, I am confident that for the amount in question, we will be able to produce a new and highly improved edition of this incredible story, for your reading pleasure!

Of course, if we are lucky enough to exceed this amount, we have some stretch goals in mind, such as adding a hard cover.  But we will get to all that if, after launching the campaign, the demand proves to be higher than expected.  For now, we are simply focused on producing the best book possible for the amount posted.

Thank you so much for checking out this RED RANGE campaign.  For this book to be published, and for my new imprint to continue it's vital mission of saving lost and forgotten comic books and graphic novels, I truly need your support!  Please consider pledging, and you can also help us tremendously by telling everyone you know about the exciting stuff we are hoping to accomplish.  Let's work together to keep the history of comics ALIVE!

story:
So – a bit more detail:

Paul Kerensa is a legend. A stand-up comic, a writer and a thoroughly decent human being. He’s not the kind of guy to rant, but I recently saw a photo on his Facebook page from hospital. He’d been struck with ‘Diverticulitis’ on the one week where he had a really busy week of work scheduled. He sadly had to cancel it and while now on the road to recovery, he’s still a bit screwed.

In his uncharacteristic ward rant, he said:

“I'm in hospital. And I'm angry. Angry at myself. At my body for letting me down. The one week I have £3k+ worth of work, now had to cancel it to be here. This work week was meant to cover the typically quiet August, or help fund the dreaded Jan '18 tax bill. Instead I'm on a hospital ward. It always happens in lucrative weeks - never first week of January or any time in August. I'm going to quit this business of show. Get a job that pays sick leave. Fed up of working my backside off for free, for work to finally come in that I then have to cancel. Onstage I make light of my weird medical condition. Make it sound optimistic and positive and how we should all have been born with bladders on the outside, it would've been fun! But here I am and there goes the work and I hate my guts”

With Paul’s pockets suddenly empting, the irony is that this intestinal inflammation causes massive pain due to forming pockets full of crap.

In an industry where the comedy gigs are quiet, when more is being asked of writers for less, let’s try and help our pal Paul keep his chin up, and quit contemplate quitting this business of show.

So give what you can folks, and give generously! It’s ambitious, but it’d be amazing to make up this lost £3k if we can… Plus, any excess fundraising will be donated by Paul to a charity of his choice.

x

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

I am an artist who wen to school for computer graphics to make animated films and video games. As a side project using my traditional drawing skills I've created a graphic novel series about a historical figure turned super hero.

Supporting this campaign would help to promote this series and push it towards completion. It is a story I am very excited to illustrate and get into. The tale follows the life of the philosopher Nietzsche and uses his ideas to create a fantasy world of good versus evil. Other historical figures include his friends and family, such as the famous composer, turned arch nemesis, Richard Wagner. The struggles, soaring highs and abysmal lows Nietzsche went through for his work translate well to an epic graphic novel.

 

When finished, there will be 9 volumes in all. Each book would be roughly 30-50 pages and correspond to the books Nietzsche wrote at those times in his life. The first volume, The Birth of Tragedy covers his early life up until his first book of the same name, and the rest of his life is documented all the way up to his untimely death. The completed issue is called Twilight of the Idols Part 1 and it is somewhere in the middle of his journey showing what the Ubermensch series has to offer. 

I am asking for $500 to get this series off the ground. Most of the money will go towards printing and sending out copies of Twilight of the Idols Part 1. Hopefully this campaign will get Ubermensch exposure through this issue and any other merchandise I am offering. My main goal is generating interest and getting people as excited as I am about this comic.

 

Risks & Challenges

The first issue, Twilight of the Idols Part 1, is complete. I have already figured out what I need to do for my series and the only thing left to do is make more! The broad strokes for the series have been made, but a lot of the writing needs to be completed. With enough support I hope to get other people involved to help me work on this project to make the process move faster. Another artist or even a writer would make things a lot easier. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The smallest contribution I'm asking for is $1. Other ways to help would be by sharing my comic and getting the word out. There are a few places to go to help promote Ubermensch including Indiegogo's share tools. Check out these other pages too!

https://www.facebook.com/UbermenschComic/

http://www.webtoons.com/en/challenge/ubermensch...

The perk for the comic issue will be delivered in the mail and all other other perks will be handled with digital giftcards.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
I am an artist who wen to school for computer graphics to make animated films and video games. As a side project using my traditional drawing skills I've created a graphic novel series about a historical figure turned super hero.
Supporting this campaign would help to promote this series and push it towards completion. It is a story I am very excited to illustrate and get into. The tale follows the life of the philosopher Nietzsche and uses his ideas to create a fantasy world of good versus evil. Other historical figures include his friends and family, such as the famous composer, turned arch nemesis, Richard Wagner. The struggles, soaring highs and abysmal lows Nietzsche went through for his work translate well to an epic graphic novel.
 
When finished, there will be 9 volumes in all. Each book would be roughly 30-50 pages and correspond to the books Nietzsche wrote at those times in his life. The first volume, The Birth of Tragedy covers his early life up until his first book of the same name, and the rest of his life is documented all the way up to his untimely death. The completed issue is called Twilight of the Idols Part 1 and it is somewhere in the middle of his journey showing what the Ubermensch series has to offer. 
I am asking for $500 to get this series off the ground. Most of the money will go towards printing and sending out copies of Twilight of the Idols Part 1. Hopefully this campaign will get Ubermensch exposure through this issue and any other merchandise I am offering. My main goal is generating interest and getting people as excited as I am about this comic.

 
Risks & Challenges
The first issue, Twilight of the Idols Part 1, is complete. I have already figured out what I need to do for my series and the only thing left to do is make more! The broad strokes for the series have been made, but a lot of the writing needs to be completed. With enough support I hope to get other people involved to help me work on this project to make the process move faster. Another artist or even a writer would make things a lot easier. 

Other Ways You Can Help
The smallest contribution I'm asking for is $1. Other ways to help would be by sharing my comic and getting the word out. There are a few places to go to help promote Ubermensch including Indiegogo's share tools. Check out these other pages too!
https://www.facebook.com/UbermenschComic/http://www.webtoons.com/en/challenge/ubermensch...The perk for the comic issue will be delivered in the mail and all other other perks will be handled with digital giftcards.

story:
Un'emozionante avventura a fumetti di 80 pagine a colori  in un mondo che unisce la magia dei film di Hayao Miyazaki e il ritmo incalzante delle grandi epopee! Scopri i segreti di Mondoplastica, tra pirati, spie e avventurieri!


MONDOPLASTICA è il quinto progetto, dopo i successi di "Rim City", "Quebrada - Seconda caduta", "Zeroi" e "The Shadow Planet", dell'etichetta indipendente RADIUM. Firmano questa storia di fantascienza post-apocalittica l'acclamato sceneggiatore Andrea "Casty" Castellan e il visionario disegnatore Ryan Lovelock con una splendida copertina a opera del maestro Corrado Mastantuono! 

Ecco a voi prima incredibile tavola di Ryan Lovelock, con gli splendidi colori di Francesca Mengozzi e Giovanni Marcora!

La folgorante copertina del Maestro Corrado Mastantuono per il vostro volume cartonato di "Mondoplastica"!

Anno 2105.
Nel momento in cui la faunotecnologia raggiunge il suo apice, la Terra precipita nella catastrofe: il batterio artificiale mondoplastica, con cui sono costruiti il 90 per cento degli edifici e delle architetture del pianeta, muta e diviene incontrollabile.


Anno 2107.
Nel giro di due anni, la superficie terrestre è quasi totalmente ricoperta dal magma mondoplastica.

Anno 2117.
La mondoplastica solidifica, raggiungendo in alcuni punti lo spessore di centinaia di metri.
La risorsa più preziosa del pianeta diviene la terra.

Anno 2300.
Partendo da un piccolo villaggio due ragazzi, Uan e Zefir, si ritrovano ad aiutare la principessa loro coetanea Sel che è braccata dagli uomini dei due Re, i dispotici dittatori di questo mondo spettrale.
Sel ha delle visioni riguardo un importante segreto risalente al "remoto passato", ovvero ai tempi in cui ciò che oggi si chiama magia era definito semplicemente "tecnologia".
Ma non solo i due Re ambiscono a scoprire il segreto: i giovani dovranno sfuggire anche a pirati, spie e avventurieri, oltre che all'enigmatico Re Nero che vive nell'Oltremondo!

Gli autori

Casty
Andrea Castellan, conosciuto con lo pseudonimo di Casty (Gorizia, 23 aprile 1967) è un fumettista italiano. Casty svolge l'attività di sceneggiatore, disegnatore e illustratore per serie quali Lupo Alberto, Cattivik e Topolino.
Su Topolino esordisce come sceneggiatore nel 2003. Il suo esordio come disegnatore avviene due anni più tardi, dapprima come copertinista (Topolino n. 2597) e poi con la storia natalizia "Topolino e le macchine ribelli" (Topolino n. 2613).
Nel 2006 ha vinto il Premio Fumo di China come miglior sceneggiatore umoristico italiano, nel 2011 il premio Bottaro - I Mestieri del Fumetto e nel 2016 il Premio Anafi come miglior autore completo. Come egli stesso dichiara, e come è spesso facile evincere leggendo le sue storie, i suoi punti di riferimento sono due tra i più grandi maestri Disney: Romano Scarpa e Floyd Gottfredson. Tra le sue storie più apprezzate dal pubblico internazionale ricordiamo quelle che vedono protagonista Macchia Nera e quelle con i tre nuovi personaggi da lui stesso creati: l'archeologa Eurasia Tost, la biologa Estrella Marina e il "magnifico" villain Doppioscherzo.
Diplomato alla scuola d'arte di Udine nel 1986, Casty si occupa anche di grafica pubblicitaria, illustrazioni e progetti creativi per i bambini; è inoltre autore di storie per cartoni animati.

Ryan Lovelock
Nato nel 1988, si diploma all’Istituto D’arte A. Venturi di Modena.
Frequenta l’Accademia di Belle Arti di Bologna (Fumetto e Illustrazione) e la Scuola Internazionale di Comics di Reggio Emilia, esordendo in seguito sulle riviste a fumetti autoprodotte “Burp! Deliri Grafico Intestinali” (2009) e “Sonnambulo” (2011).
Lavora come fumettista per il mercato francese sulla serie Block 109 (“S.H.A.R.K” e “Maruta” Ed. Akileos) e italiano (“Battaglia: La lunga notte della Repubblica” Editoriale Cosmo), come illustrare sulla serie di libri game “Freeway Warrior” di Joe Dever e collabora con vari studi e come storyboard/concept artist per animazione, videogiochi e pubblicità. Vive e lavora a Londra come Art Director per lo studio Nucco Brain.
Potete ammirare il lavoro di Ryan sul suo sito ryanlovelockart.com

Spese di spedizione

La spedizione dei perk è inclusa nel prezzo del perk SOLO per la consegna presso uno dei PICK POINT RADIUM.
L'elenco completo e aggiornato dei PICK POINT è visibile anche alla relativa pagina del sito (che puoi vedere cliccando qui!)

Per chi desiderasse ricevere il proprio perk direttamente a casa è necessario integrare con 5 € di contributo per le spese di spedizione o mediante donazione libera o direttamente come extra rispetto al prezzo del perk selezionato. 
Per i residenti in Sicilia e Sardegna sarà necessaria un'ulteriore integrazione di 4 €
 

Quando sopra vale esclusivamente per le spedizioni su territorio italiano. Per le spedizione in territorio UE o EXTRA UE vi chiediamo di contattarci all'indirizzo info@progettoradium.it per concordare la spedizione più efficace ed economica.

Al termine della campagna verrà data comunicazione ai funders delle modalità per confermare in via definitiva (sul sito www.progettoradium.it)  il proprio indirizzo di spedizione. Le spedizioni dei materiali avverranno solo per chi effettuerà entro i termini indicati la conferma dell'indirizzo. Suggeriamo di indicare indirizzi di spedizione dove sia garantita la presenza negli orari di ufficio per evitare giacenze, rientri e conseguenti spedizioni che, qualora dovessero verificarsi, saranno a carico del destinatario.

A cosa ci servono questi 35.000 €?

22.000 € copriranno i compensi per sceneggiatura, disegno, colore, design delle cover, lettering e editing.

8.000 € copriranno le spese di realizzazione delle ricompense e di stampa dei volumi.

5.000 € copriranno le varie quote trattenute da Indiegogo e Paypal e per gli adempimenti fiscali.

story:
About the project

Story

"Where on Earth?!" is set in a post-apocalyptic earth, where our main character, Elliot, lives in a city built underground with no sight of nature, in order to protect their society from the outside world.
500 years ago, humans used all natural resources to the point of making the planet Earth almost collapse entirely. There were earthquakes, Vulcano explosions, typhoons, almost every natural disaster that occurred during 3 years. During those 3 years, a few people from each country managed to survive and step by step, they started to build "cities" with no contact with the outside world - they thought that, because of all the catastrophes that happened, the air wasn't breathable anymore. 

This event was denominated as "The Mankind's Disgrace. All pre-existed civilizations were torn apart and new ones were born. The city where Elliot was born, Murkshore, never maintained contact with other surviving societies and, during 500 years, created all sorts of technology to replace the natural resources -  everything is fabricated by machinery, from water to food.

Elliot was born to a wealthy family, living with his mother and sister.
One day, as he was returning from work, he was caught up in a crime he didn't commit. As a result, the government sent him to the outside world with the intent of punishing him. 
Being fond of the comfort of the home he has known for 24 years, Elliot now has to learn how to survive in a different place while trying to find his way home.
During this journey, he ends up meeting other people living in peace with nature, especially a boy named Aydin. Upon this meeting, a connection between the two starts to unfold and Elliot is exposed to having to deal with his sexuality and learning about his feelings.

The project

This project started as an idea for a one page comic for a university assignment and since then I decided to keep developing the story and turn it into a webcomic.
I've always liked to read comics since I was a child but when I found the world of webcomics and its specified platforms, I've been really interested in creating my own series. The accessibility of reading a comic just by scrolling on your phone is so appealing to me and the way the panels are displayed, in contrast with the traditional comic panel display, helps me keep focus while reading. I'm also someone who's always creating new characters in my head but not doing anything with them, no world to live in and no personality, so I grabbed this opportunity to insert my characters in a world entirely built by me.
 
As a queer person myself, I like to touch LGBTQ+ themes on my artwork and "Where on Earth?!" is no different. Boy's Love, men loving men romance media, always interested me and helped me through my teenage years on figuring out about other sexualities and my own. With my background in mind, I wanted to create a story appealing to me, something that would make me happy to keep working on. 

This webcomic is made for young adults and up as it touches sensitive topics such as sexual encounters, murder, etc.

You can read the first chapter for FREE here.

What We Need & What You Get

By helping fund this campaign you'll be directly helping me focus all my time and work on publishing my comic, as I can't work on a regular job and on my comic at the same time and I work all by myself. 

The comic is free to read and only the future sexual scenes will be paid to read.

Most of the money asked is for my living expenses for at least one month as well as to pay for the perks funders will receive depending on the tier they choose.

______________________________________________________________________________________

You can just fund this project without wanting anything in return but if you would like something more than just reading my webcomic for free, for each tier you will get a set of merchandise!

By funding 4 euros, you'll receive:

  • Personal "Thank you" email

  • HD digital version of the cover art

By funding 10 euros, you'll receive: 

  • Personal "Thank you" email
  • HD digital version of the cover art
  • A3 size print of the cover art shipped to your house

By funding 15 euros, you'll receive: 

  • Personal "Thank you" email
  • HD digital version of the cover art
  • A3 size print of the cover art shipped to your house
  • 2 heart-shaped buttons of the two main characters 

By funding 25 euros, you'll receive: 

  • Personal "Thank you" email
  • HD digital version of the cover art
  • A3 size print of the cover art shipped to your house
  • 2 heart-shaped buttons of the two main characters 
  • One charm
  • Funder title and thank you at the end of every chapter 

 

My name is Mafalda Raposo, mostly know online by Mirtilo, and I'm a Portuguese art student, currently doing a Bachelor's degree in Animation and Illustration in England.

I've always had an interest in drawing since I was a child, all I did to pass the time was draw and paint, but I started my art journey when I decided to go back 2 years to start high school all over again just so I could attend an art school. I also went to a lot of art-related workshops as a way to improve my skills even more.
My art inspiration mostly comes from Japanese animation and comic books. I had my first contact with anime when I was really young, maybe 6 to 8 years old, when I would watch these famous anime series on TV, like Sailor Moon and Dragon Ball, but to me, at that time, they were just like any other cartoon, I didn't know there was a difference. Around 11 years old was when I discovered that the series I was really into was called anime and there were a whole lot more series and different genres - that's when I got to explore the world of Japanese animation. 
 
By being interest in anime, came the knowledge about manga as well. Even though during my teenage years I prefered watching animated series to reading comic books, now that I'm a young adult that changed. I still have a lot of love for animation but, as I kept reading more and more comics and by studying illustration and animation I found that my true passion is drawing illustrations and subsequently making comics.  
I've always had these complex stories in my head, with characters with their own personality traits and a whole world built up, but I never had the chance, or motivation really, to put that into paper. I would only draw the characters from my stories but never doing anything more with them- they would just be there, standing, with no purpose. But then the opportunity of creating a funding campaign and working with whatever theme I wanted as a result of another university assignment, making a webcomic came to mind. I already had this story planned out in my head and had the idea of eventually turning it into a series, but I only thought about doing that in the future. 
The reason why I decided to put this story into a comic published online was because of my own preference. I read a lot of webcomics on different platforms, paid and free, and I find it the most appealing, not only can I read it everywhere and whenever I want, I don't need to carry a physical version around.
In the age of technology, reading on our mobile phones is something we are constantly doing, so creating a story of easy access was my main goal. 
In the end, by talking to my tutors, we agreed on producing the plot I had already planned and so "Where on Earth?!" started its creation. 
  

Risks & Challenges

The only risk and challenge is if I injure myself and can't keep posting comic's updates as i do all the work by myself, but hopefully, that will not happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's totally fine! Just by reading my webcomic and sharing it on social media already helps me a lot.

You can share this campaign using Indiegogo share tools or by just simply copying the URL and posting it to your social media accounts.

You can also follow me for more updates and ways to help me:

  • Instagram
  • Twitter

I read a lot of webcomics on different platforms, paid and free, and I find it the most appealing, not only can I read it everywhere and whenever I want, I don't need to carry a physical version around.In the age of technology, reading on our mobile phones is something we are constantly doing, so creating a story of easy access was my main goal. In the end, by talking to my tutors, we agreed on producing the plot I had already planned and so "Where on Earth?!" started its creation.   
Risks & Challenges
The only risk and challenge is if I injure myself and can't keep posting comic's updates as i do all the work by myself, but hopefully, that will not happen.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that's totally fine! Just by reading my webcomic and sharing it on social media already helps me a lot.
You can share this campaign using Indiegogo share tools or by just simply copying the URL and posting it to your social media accounts.
You can also follow me for more updates and ways to help me:

Instagram
Twitter

story:
Welcome to Zine Comics and our comic, Forerunners!

About the comic

Forerunners came from asking the question, what if super villains were to gain super powers before super heroes?  How would the world react?  Would it even survive?  In the first issue, a news reporter goes to cover a story about a science experiment on editing DNA.  During the experiment, the test subject gains unexpected abilities and begins eliminating any witness to her transformation.  It's up to our reporter to escape the massacre in order to warn everyone, but was her transformation just a fluke or a calculated test run?  Read and find out!     

Hello from Zine Comics

My name is Ezekiel Buchanan and I created Zine Comics to get back to the when comics were entertaining.  I've always been interested in telling stories, so I created this company to combine my passion for storytelling and my love for comics to bring you stories that you will enjoy!

Down below you can see a sample of a few pages from the book.  And the best part of this campaign is that I accidentally did all the work up front, so all I need is to go to print.  Yes, you read that right. 

The book is done, finished. 

Once this book is fully backed, then all you have to wait for is the printing press to get it to me, before I get it to you.  No waiting around a year just to see your book here at Zine Comics! 

Comic book preview

Credits

Written and lettered by Ezekiel Buchanan

Illustrated by Christopher Bradberry

Coloring by Guillermo Suarez

About the company

You've heard these values thrown around comicsgate a lot, but I think people have forgotten the core values that started this movement.  I just wanted to let you know that I haven't.  That's why this company was created.  This is our company values:

  1. The customer is first and foremost.  You are the fans.  It's up to you if the comic universe begins or not, that's why you are our priority.  We wanted to create something you enjoy and will want to keep participating in, in future campaigns.  It's also why we finished the book first.  So you don't have to wait around forever to get your copy.
  2. Politics are a not allowed.  Personal politics aren't allowed in our books.  We don't care if you are left or right.  We care that you find our story entertaining.
  3. We bring you the best quality.  We know how frustrating it can be when you buy a comic that looks like someone slopped it out just to get it on the stands.  We took our time and now it's fully ready to be sent to you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $8,000.  The reason for this is to pay the artist and for paying for printing costs. 
  • We are keeping our perks simple since we are just starting out.  If all goes well then on our next campaign we can add some more perks.  Our perks include a book mark and a poster by the great artist Preston Asevedo.
  • If we don't reach our goal, then the funds go back to you!

Risks & Challenges

  • This is the first campaign we have ever done.  Therefore we are going to have to learn as we go along.  But given time, any obstacle that is put in front of us we will overcome in order to get our comic to you.
  • One thing you don't have to worry as a reader is when will the comic be ready for print.  Our comic is primed and ready and is only waiting for us to hit our goal before we send it to the printing press. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you aren't able to contribute that's okay.  If you would still like to help us then post about us on your favorite social media platform to raise awareness of our comic.  It would be a great help!

story:
Have you ever seen this before?

( larger version here )

4 meters / 13ft  long

300 hours of drawing

fully handmade with Indian ink

thousands of characters

I'm a kind of psychopath


(FrenchArtDay exhibition - Copenhagen 2013)


Let's print it for cheap and get a copy

This drawing is so big that any print in little quantity is incredibly expensive. But when it comes to hundreds of copies, it becomes possible to get it printed at a very reasonable price.

What we need & what you get

Here's the magic equation: if 100 people or more like this drawing and give the funds, they get a copy! No bullshit, no blabla. 


About the funds

All the funds will be invested to print the drawing and pay the indiegogo fees. Additional funds would pay the promotion.

If a miracle happens and the funds come up to 200%, I would be able to print at a cheap price this other drawing (and you could get a cheap copy - I'll keep you informed!):

About the drawing

A couple of years ago, I decided to quit my well-paid and boring engineering job to become a full-time drawer.

Unexpectedly, an ex-colleague who liked my work decided to commission one of these strange crazy drawings that I usually did on small format: he wanted a large one! After non-stop months of drawing, I could finish it I made an exhibition.

It became very popular and many people asked me to buy a copy. Unfortunately, a 4m x 0.6m print is very expensive. This is a very unconventional format, did you know?

That's how I came to crowdfunding to have a fair deal with anybody interested in getting that drawing at a decent price! I believe art has to be popular and accessible.

I hope you'll like this uncommon drawing... I'll do my best to reply to any question. Thanks for all and don't hesitate to share if you like!

More about my work on my website www.olivox.com .

story:
“Heart of Stone” is a fantasy adventure for all ages, written and illustrated by me, Jose Gimeno. A 19 X 27 cm hardcover book, 108 pages of a magical journey into the secrets of a forgotten city. Available in two language versions: Spanish and English.

“Corazón de Piedra” es una aventura fantástica para todas las edades, escrita e ilustrada por mí, Jose Gimeno. Un libro de 19 x 27 cm con tapa dura, 108 páginas de un mágico viaje al interior de una ciudad olvidada. Disponible en dos lenguas: Español e inglés.


SYNOPSIS   SINOPSIS

That morning, everything started to go wrong. First, the sun stopped its journey in the sky. After that, her mother and all the people in her neighborhood froze. Maya felt really lonely that strange spring morning. Luckily, she had Mauricio, the cat. For some unknown reason, she and Mauricio had escaped the paralysis that gripped everyone around her. To make matters worse, out of the clouds came a fearsome flying shadow, threatening them from the sky, and had no choice but to hide in the dark metropolis. Her mother had warned her against that abandoned town full of secrets. But that morning... Maya had no choice but to venture into the depths of the city, as far as the very heart of the city!

Aquella mañana, todo empezó a salir mal. Primero, el sol detuvo su recorrido en el cielo. Después, su madre y toda la gente de su barrio se quedaron petrificados. Maya se sintió muy sola aquella extraña mañana de primavera. Menos mal que estaba Mauricio, el gato. Por alguna razón desconocida, Mauricio y ella habían escapado a la parálisis que atenazaba a todo el mundo a su alrededor. Para colmo de males, de entre las nubes surgió una temible sombra voladora, amenazándoles desde el cielo, y no tuvieron más remedio que esconderse en la metrópolis oscura. Su madre le había prevenido contra aquella ciudad abandonada y llena de secretos. Pero esa mañana… Maya se adentró hasta lo más profundo de la urbe, ¡hasta el mismo corazón de la ciudad!


MOTIVATION   MOTIVACIÓN

I have been working like an illustrator and comic book artist for years. I have worked for several major publishers in Spain: "Norma Comics", "Dude Comics" and "Toutain". I have ended up in self publishing because this way, I get absolute freedom to do my work the way I want. I have published an ebook version of “Heart of Stone” available for portable devices. But I think this story could be transferred to paper, as a stunning picture book, so that it can be enjoyed by many more readers who don't like reading in digital format.  However, as the traditional publishing world won't give this book a chance, I've decided to try a crowdfunding campaign. I hope you, future reader, are as interested as I am, to see that this book becomes a reality, thanks to your support and cooperation, and it will be a pleasure to work so it can be in your hands soon.

He trabajado como dibujante de cómics e ilustrador durante años. Publiqué con “Norma Cómics”, “Dude Cómics” y “Toutain Editor”, pero he acabado editándome a mí mismo porque, de esta manera, tengo absoluta libertad para hacer las cosas a mi gusto. He publicado una versión ebook de “Corazón de Piedra”, disponible para dispositivos portátiles. Pero creo que esta historia puede ser transferida al papel, convertida en un estupendo libro ilustrado. De esta manera, podría ser disfrutado por muchos lectores que prefieren el papel al formato digital. Sin embargo, como las editoriales tradicionales no están dispuestas a darle una oportunidad a este libro, he decidido intentarlo a través de una campaña de crowdfunding. Espero que tú, futuro lector, estés tan interesado como yo en hacer que este proyecto llegue a ser una realidad, gracias a tu ayuda y colaboración, y será un placer trabajar para que el libro pueda estar pronto en tus manos.


AN EXTRAORDINARY JOURNEY   UN VIAJE EXTRAORDINARIO

"Heart of Stone" is a fairy tale, whose greatest inspiration is "Alice in Wonderland" by Lewis Carroll. The protagonist is Maya, a girl who, due to a series of extraordinary events, is forced to go through a strange city full of fascinating characters. Maya will have to find the heart of the city, a forgotten entity that governs the metropolis, to save her mother and neighbors of a strange disease that have petrified them.

Mauricio, Maya’s cat, helps her in her journey, while suffering an amazing transformation as they travel through the streets of this fantastic world. He will be the support the girl needs in the most difficult moments of her adventure. Their lives will change at the end of this initiatory journey.

In their quest, they will receive help from city residents, who live in a world dominated by the laws of dream and imagination: Little cowboys traveling mounted on slippers over wheels, monkey stewards subjected under the thumb of a tyrant, architects trapped on the walls of their own buildings, heroes devoured by their own success, musicians with the power to transform matter around ...

The reader will undertake their own journey through this world, lost between fantasy and reality.

“Corazón de Piedra” es un cuento cuya mayor inspiración es “Alicia en el País de las Maravillas”, de Lewis Carroll. La protagonista es Maya, una niña que, debido a una serie de acontecimientos extraordinarios, se ve obligada a adentrarse en una extraña ciudad llena de personajes fascinantes. Maya tendrá que encontrar el Corazón de la Ciudad, una entidad olvidada que gobierna la metrópolis, para salvar a su madre y a sus vecinos de una extraña enfermedad que los ha petrificado.

Mauricio, el gato de Maya, le ayuda en su viaje, mientras sufre una curiosa transformación durante su viaje por las calles de este mundo fantástico. Ayudará a la niña en los momentos más difíciles de su aventura. Sus vidas cambiarán al final de este viaje iniciático.

En su búsqueda, recibirán ayuda de los habitantes de la ciudad, que viven en un mundo dominado por las leyes del sueño y la imaginación: Pequeños cowboys que viajan montados en zapatillas rodantes, monos mayordomos sometidos bajo el pulgar de un tirano, arquitectos atrapados en los muros de sus propios edificios, héroes devorados por su propio éxito, músicos con el poder de transformar la materia a su alrededor…

El lector emprenderá su propio viaje a través de este mundo, perdido entre la realidad y la fantasía.




You can read two chapters of the book and find more information on the following site:
Puedes leer dos capítulos del libro y encontrar más información en los siguientes links:
  • English: http://www.enunlugarajeno.com/crowdfunding-en.html
  • Español: http://www.enunlugarajeno.com/crowdfunding.html

MY GOAL   MI OBJETIVO

My goal is to produce an English and Spanish printed edition of the “Heart of Stone” ebook. The book will be printed in high quality. Hardcover with dust jacket. Coated  170 g paper. The artwork will be printed in 4/4 inks, quatricomy with glossy varnish for the best result. Because of this, the price of printing for 600 copies reached 7500 euros. The cost of shipping to Europe and the rest of the world, has been estimated at 5800 euros. Thus, this budget is made to cover all the print costs, postage and Indiegogo fees. The budget also covers the costs of paypal and the necessary taxes. To thank you for your support I have a nice set of rewards.

First of all, the central reward of this campaign is the printed book. I'd love to see it all over the world and I've tried to make things as simple as possible. Therefore I have incorporated a flat shipping fee into the price of the book. That way, no matter where you are in the world, you don't have to worry about additional shipping costs. 

I tried to make the price of the book as tight as possible. As you can see, it is even cheaper than the ones with similar characteristics that you would find in bookshops. With the added extras I have included exclusively for this edition, plus the convenience of receiving it at your home.

Mi objetivo es producir una edición impresa de “Corazón de Piedra” en inglés y español. El libro se imprimirá en alta calidad. Tapa dura con sobrecubierta. Papel cuché de 170 gr. Las ilustraciones se imprimirán en quatricomía, 4/4 tintas con una capa de barniz para un resultado óptimo. Debido a esto, el precio de la edición de 600 copias del libro alcanzará los 7500 euros. Los gastos de envío a Europa y al resto del mundo rondarán los 5800 euros. Así pues, el presupuesto se ha establecido para cubrir los gastos de impresión, los envíos y los gastos de Indiegogo. También cubrirá los costes de Paypal y de los impuestos necesarios. Para agradecerte por tu apoyo, he preparado un buen número de recompensas.

Primero, la recompensa principal de esta campaña es el libro impreso. Me gustaría verlo llegar a todas partes del mundo y he intentado que sea lo más sencillo posible. Así que he incorporado una tarifa plana de envío dentro del precio del libro. De esta manera, no importa dónde en que lugar del mundo te encuentres, no tendrás que preocuparte de gastos de envío adicionales.

He intentado que el precio del libro sea lo más ajustado posible. Como puedes ver, el precio es incluso más barato de lo que se puede encontrar en librerías para un libro de estas características. Con el añadido de los extras y la comodidad de recibirlo en tu casa.


REWARDS  RECOMPENSAS

The book is 19 x 27 cm, hardcover with dust jacket, 108 pages, and contains the whole “Heart of Stone” story with more than 30 illustrations inside.

Un libro de 19 x 27 cm, con tapa dura y sobrecubierta, 108 páginas, que contiene la historia de "Corazón de Piedra" con más de 30 ilustraciones en su interior.


If you so wish, you can also get a small sketch with a personal acknowledgment hand signed, giving even more value to the book.

Si lo deseas, puedes conseguir el libro con un pequeño dibujo y mi agradecimiento personalizado, realizado a mano, dando más valor al libro.


All books come with a bookmark for free.

Todos los libros vienen con un marca páginas de regalo.

You are wishing to take my art everywhere, you can also choose one of the shirts specially designed for this campaign.

Si deseas llevar mi arte a donde sea que vayas, puedes escoger una de las camisetas diseñadas especialmente para esta campaña.


You can get back home with an exclusive piece of the world of "Heart of Stone" in your hands. You can add to your order an original and exclusive 15 x 20 cm pencil drawing, made on special paper for charcoal. A special design that will not be repeat ever.

Puedes llevarte a casa una pieza en exclusiva del mundo de "Corazón de Piedra". Puedes escoger añadir a tu pedido un dibujo original de 15 x 20 hecho a lápiz. Un diseño especial que no se repetirá jamás.


COMMUNICATION AND SHIPPING   COMUNICACIÓN Y ENVÍO

I need about two months for test printing and to have the books finally printed. Time also needed to have the rewards prepared. I need another month to personalize your books with the dedication and small scketch. Thus, the books will be available for shipping on September 30th.

I’m going to be very transparent about the progress of the project. You, future reader, can expect regular updates from me all during the whole process, and you can always find me via email and in the social networks. Knowing how important it’s for you to solve any doubts that arise during the wait, I promise to answer all questions within 24 hours.

Necesito unos dos meses para las pruebas de imprenta y disponer de los libros ya impresos. Este tiempo también es necesario para tener las recompensas preparadas. Necesito un mes más para personalizar vuestros libros con un dibujo y la dedicatoria. Así que el libro estará disponible para su envío el 30 de septiembre.

Voy a ser muy transparente con el progreso del proyecto. Tú, futuro lector, recibirás actualizaciones constantes durante todo el proceso, y podrás contactarme siempre mediante e-mail o en las redes sociales. Sabiendo lo importante que es para ti solucionar cualquier duda que surja durante la espera, me comprometo a responder cualquier pregunta en 24 horas.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES   RIESGOS Y RETOS

The production and printing of the books will be done in Spain, by one of the biggest printing houses in my country, with a huge experience in this field. And the same thing for the rewards. So we should not expect to have problems on that side. But, as I said, I will keep you informed at all times of any changes or delays that may occur.

When you make your contribution to the campaign, you are not charged any money; you will only need to enter your information. A few days after the end of the campaign, and only if it has been successful, you will be charged the amount pledged. But if we do not reach this minimum amount, the donations will not be charged, and the campaign will be canceled.

Payments are being made via Paypal. it’s perfectly secure and, if you don’t have an account, creating one takes only a few minutes. Anyway, when you go to Paypal, you can choose to pay by credit card, if you prefer.

La producción e impresión del libro se hará en España, por una de las mejores imprentas de mi país, con una amplia experiencia en este campo. Lo mismo ocurre con las recompensas. Así que no deberíamos esperar problemas por ese lado. Aunque, como ya he dicho, os mantendré informados en todo momento de cualquier cambio o retraso que se pudiera producir.

Cuando realices tu contribución a la campaña, no se te cobrará nada; solo tendrás que introducir tus datos. Unos pocos días después de que finalice la campaña, y solo si ha finalizado con éxito, se te cobrará la cantidad donada. Pero si no alcanzamos el objetivo mínimo requerido, las donaciones no se cobrarán y la campaña se cancelará.

Los pagos se realizarán mediante Paypal. Es muy seguro y, si no tienes una cuenta, crear una lleva solo unos pocos minutos. De todas maneras, si lo prefieres, también podrás pagar con tarjeta.


YOU WANT TO HELP   SI QUIERES AYUDAR

Maybe you can’t contribute, but you would like to help see this book published. I would like to ask you, help me to spread the project and give it the widest possible publicity. Please share this campaign  through your email contacts and your social networks, to bring this project to fruition.

Thank you so much for your interest in this campaign and I look forward to your support!
Quizás no puedas contribuir a esta campaña, pero te gustaría ayudar a conseguir que este libro sea publicado. Me gustaría pedirte un favor, que me ayudes a difundir este proyecto y darle toda la publicidad posible. Por favor, comparte esta campaña a través del e-mail y de las redes sociales, para hacer que este proyecto se haga realidad.
¡Muchas gracias por tu interés en esta campaña y espero contar con tu ayuda!

acabado editándome a mí mismo porque, de esta manera, tengo absoluta 
libertad para hacer las cosas a mi gusto. He publicado una versión ebook
 de “Corazón de Piedra”, disponible para dispositivos portátiles. Pero 
creo que esta historia puede ser transferida al papel, convertida en un 
estupendo libro ilustrado. De esta manera, podría ser disfrutado por 
muchos lectores que prefieren el papel al formato digital. Sin embargo, 
como las editoriales tradicionales no están dispuestas a darle una 
oportunidad a este libro, he decidido intentarlo a través de una campaña
 de crowdfunding. Espero que tú, futuro lector, estés tan interesado 
como yo en hacer que este proyecto llegue a ser una realidad, gracias a 
tu ayuda y colaboración, y será un placer trabajar para que el libro 
pueda estar pronto en tus manos.



AN EXTRAORDINARY JOURNEY   UN VIAJE EXTRAORDINARIO

"Heart of Stone" is a fairy tale, whose greatest inspiration is "Alice in Wonderland" by Lewis Carroll. The protagonist is Maya, a girl who, due to a series of extraordinary events, is forced to go through a strange city full of fascinating characters. Maya will have to find the heart of the city, a forgotten entity that governs the metropolis, to save her mother and neighbors of a strange disease that have petrified them.


Mauricio, Maya’s cat, helps her in her journey, while suffering an amazing transformation as they travel through the streets of this fantastic world. He will be the support the girl needs in the most difficult moments of her adventure. Their lives will change at the end of this initiatory journey.


In their quest, they will receive help from city residents, who live in a world dominated by the laws of dream and imagination: Little cowboys traveling mounted on slippers over wheels, monkey stewards subjected under the thumb of a tyrant, architects trapped on the walls of their own buildings, heroes devoured by their own success, musicians with the power to transform matter around ...
The reader will undertake their own journey through this world, lost between fantasy and reality.

“Corazón de Piedra” es un cuento cuya mayor inspiración es “Alicia en
 el País de las Maravillas”, de Lewis Carroll. La protagonista es Maya, 
una niña que, debido a una serie de acontecimientos extraordinarios, se 
ve obligada a adentrarse en una extraña ciudad llena de personajes 
fascinantes. Maya tendrá que encontrar el Corazón de la Ciudad, una 
entidad olvidada que gobierna la metrópolis, para salvar a su madre y a 
sus vecinos de una extraña enfermedad que los ha petrificado.
Mauricio,
 el gato de Maya, le ayuda en su viaje, mientras sufre una curiosa 
transformación durante su viaje por las calles de este mundo fantástico.
 Ayudará a la niña en los momentos más difíciles de su aventura. Sus 
vidas cambiarán al final de este viaje iniciático.
En su búsqueda,
 recibirán ayuda de los habitantes de la ciudad, que viven en un mundo 
dominado por las leyes del sueño y la imaginación: Pequeños cowboys que 
viajan montados en zapatillas rodantes, monos mayordomos sometidos bajo 
el pulgar de un tirano, arquitectos atrapados en los muros de sus 
propios edificios, héroes devorados por su propio éxito, músicos con el 
poder de transformar la materia a su alrededor…
El lector emprenderá su propio viaje a través de este mundo, perdido entre la realidad y la fantasía.







You can read two chapters of the book and find more information on the following site:Puedes leer dos capítulos del libro y encontrar más información en los siguientes links:

English: http://www.enunlugarajeno.com/crowdfunding-en.html

Español: http://www.enunlugarajeno.com/crowdfunding.html






MY GOAL   MI OBJETIVO


My goal is to produce an English and Spanish printed edition of the “Heart of Stone” ebook. The book will be printed in high quality. Hardcover with dust jacket. Coated  170 g paper. The artwork will be printed in 4/4 inks, quatricomy with glossy varnish for the best result. Because of this, the price of printing for 600 copies reached 7500 euros. The cost of shipping to Europe and the rest of the world, has been estimated at 5800 euros. Thus, this budget is made to cover all the print costs, postage and Indiegogo fees. The budget also covers the costs of paypal and the necessary taxes. To thank you for your support I have a nice set of rewards.
First of all, the central reward of this campaign is the printed book. I'd love to see it all over the world and I've tried to make things as simple as possible. Therefore I have incorporated a flat shipping fee into the price of the book. That way, no matter where you are in the world, you don't have to worry about additional shipping costs. 
I tried to make the price of the book as tight as possible. As you can see, it is even cheaper than the ones with similar characteristics that you would find in bookshops. With the added extras I have included exclusively for this edition, plus the convenience of receiving it at your home.

Mi objetivo es producir una edición impresa de “Corazón de Piedra” en
 inglés y español. El libro se imprimirá en alta calidad. Tapa dura con 
sobrecubierta. Papel cuché de 170 gr. Las ilustraciones se imprimirán en
 quatricomía, 4/4 tintas con una capa de barniz para un resultado 
óptimo. Debido a esto, el precio de la edición de 600 copias del libro 
alcanzará los 7500 euros. Los gastos de envío a Europa y al resto del 
mundo rondarán los 5800 euros. Así pues, el presupuesto se ha 
establecido para cubrir los gastos de impresión, los envíos y los gastos
 de Indiegogo. También cubrirá los costes de Paypal y de los impuestos 
necesarios. Para agradecerte por tu apoyo, he preparado un buen número 
de recompensas.
Primero, la recompensa principal de esta campaña 
es el libro impreso. Me gustaría verlo llegar a todas partes del mundo y
 he intentado que sea lo más sencillo posible. Así que he incorporado 
una tarifa plana de envío dentro del precio del libro. De esta manera, 
no importa dónde en que lugar del mundo te encuentres, no tendrás que 
preocuparte de gastos de envío adicionales.
He
 intentado que el precio del libro sea lo más ajustado posible. Como 
puedes ver, el precio es incluso más barato de lo que se puede encontrar en librerías para un libro de estas características.  Con el añadido de
 los extras y la comodidad de recibirlo en tu casa.

REWARDS  RECOMPENSAS


The book is 19 x 27 cm, hardcover with dust jacket, 108 pages, and contains the whole “Heart of Stone” story with more than 30 illustrations inside.
Un libro de 19 x 27 cm, con tapa dura y sobrecubierta, 108 páginas, que contiene la historia de "Corazón de Piedra" con más de 30 ilustraciones en su interior.


If you so wish, you can also get a small sketch with a personal acknowledgment hand signed, giving even more value to the book.
Si lo deseas, puedes conseguir el libro con un pequeño dibujo y mi agradecimiento personalizado, realizado a mano, dando más valor al libro.


All books come with a bookmark for free.
Todos los libros vienen con un marca páginas de regalo.



You are wishing to take my art everywhere, you can also choose one of the shirts specially designed for this campaign.
Si deseas llevar mi arte a donde sea que vayas, puedes escoger una de las camisetas diseñadas especialmente para esta campaña.



You can get back home with an exclusive piece of the world of "Heart of Stone" in your hands. You can add to your order an original and exclusive 15 x 20 cm pencil drawing, made on special paper for charcoal. A special design that will not be repeat ever.
Puedes llevarte a casa una pieza en exclusiva del mundo de "Corazón de Piedra". Puedes escoger añadir a tu pedido un dibujo original de 15 x 20 hecho a lápiz. Un diseño especial que no se repetirá jamás.







COMMUNICATION AND SHIPPING   COMUNICACIÓN Y ENVÍO
I need about two months for test printing and to have the books finally printed. Time also needed to have the rewards prepared. I need another month to personalize your books with the dedication and small scketch. Thus, the books will be available for shipping on September 30th.
I’m going to be very transparent about the progress of the project. You, future reader, can expect regular updates from me all during the whole process, and you can always find me via email and in the social networks. Knowing how important it’s for you to solve any doubts that arise during the wait, I promise to answer all questions within 24 hours.

Necesito unos dos meses para las pruebas de imprenta y disponer de 
los libros ya impresos. Este tiempo también es necesario para tener las 
recompensas preparadas. Necesito un mes más para personalizar vuestros 
libros con un dibujo y la dedicatoria. Así que el libro estará 
disponible para su envío el 30 de septiembre.
Voy a ser muy 
transparente con el progreso del proyecto. Tú, futuro lector, recibirás 
actualizaciones constantes durante todo el proceso, y podrás contactarme
 siempre mediante e-mail o en las redes sociales. Sabiendo lo importante
 que es para ti solucionar cualquier duda que surja durante la espera, 
me comprometo a responder cualquier pregunta en 24 horas.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES   RIESGOS Y RETOS

The production and printing of the books will be done in Spain, by one of the biggest printing houses in my country, with a huge experience in this field. And the same thing for the rewards. So we should not expect to have problems on that side. But, as I said, I will keep you informed at all times of any changes or delays that may occur.
When you make your contribution to the campaign, you are not charged any money; you will only need to enter your information. A few days after the end of the campaign, and only if it has been successful, you will be charged the amount pledged. But if we do not reach this minimum amount, the donations will not be charged, and the campaign will be canceled.
Payments are being made via Paypal. it’s perfectly secure and, if you don’t have an account, creating one takes only a few minutes. Anyway, when you go to Paypal, you can choose to pay by credit card, if you prefer.
La producción e impresión del libro se hará en España, por una de las mejores imprentas de mi país, con una amplia experiencia en este campo. Lo mismo ocurre con las recompensas. Así que no deberíamos esperar problemas por ese lado. Aunque, como ya he dicho, os mantendré informados en todo momento de cualquier cambio o retraso que se pudiera producir.
Cuando realices tu contribución a la campaña, no se te cobrará nada; solo tendrás que introducir tus datos. Unos pocos días después de que finalice la campaña, y solo si ha finalizado con éxito, se te cobrará la cantidad donada. Pero si no alcanzamos el objetivo mínimo requerido, las donaciones no se cobrarán y la campaña se cancelará.
Los pagos se realizarán mediante Paypal. Es muy seguro y, si no tienes una cuenta, crear una lleva solo unos pocos minutos. De todas maneras, si lo prefieres, también podrás pagar con tarjeta.

YOU WANT TO HELP   SI QUIERES AYUDAR



Maybe you can’t contribute, but you would like to help see this book published. I would like to ask you, help me to spread the project and give it the widest possible publicity. Please share this campaign  through your email contacts and your social networks, to bring this project to fruition.

Thank you so much for your interest in this campaign and I look forward to your support!
Quizás no puedas contribuir a esta campaña, pero te gustaría ayudar a conseguir que este libro sea publicado. Me gustaría pedirte un favor, que me ayudes a difundir este proyecto y darle toda la publicidad posible. Por favor, comparte esta campaña a través del e-mail y de las redes sociales, para hacer que este proyecto se haga realidad.

¡Muchas gracias por tu interés en esta campaña y espero contar con tu ayuda!

story:
GORILLA MY DREAM #2: GORILLA TAILS (Limited Edition Cover)

 

GORILLA MY DREAMS is a black and white webcomic set in Struggle-Town, where the streets are protected by KNOCKAROUND-GUY, a talking gorilla who fancies himself a superhero. GORILLA MY DREAMS is best described as: BATMAN: THE ANIMATED SERIES mashed with TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES if Saturday morning cartoons came on TV after 10pm. 

GORILLA MY DREAMS #1: MIME OF MY LIFE (36 pages Black & White); When a street mime is found dead (asphyxiated inside an actual invisible box), KNOCKAROUND-GUY soon finds himself wading through the ugly and dangerous underbelly of Struggle-Town.

After meeting MARGOT LE DIEU, the beautiful, grieving fiancé of the deceased, KNOCKAROUND-GUY’s investigations lead from The North Poles Strip Club, through a slew of colourful criminals, and finally point to crime kingpin LUCIFER BIM-BOM and his Killer Klown Syndicate.

GORILLA MY DREAMS #2: GORILLA TAILS (36 pages Black & White) explores Struggle-Town and its residents, spotlighting not only KNOCKAROUND-GUY but some of the other characters who cross paths with him; The cops, the crooks, even wannabe superheroes. 

In six short stories you'll... Gasp in terror as OFFICERS RUMPF & STUDWELL find themselves in a shoot-out with themed henchmen! Shriek in horror as STITCHIMONSTA tries to rescue a damsel in distress from a horde of zombies! Shudder in disgust at POINTY MCSPIKEFACE and MOTHERDUCKER's lives of crime!

AND SO MUCH MORE!

 

GORILLA MY DREAMS #1: MIME OF MY LIFE

Written by Big Tim Stiles

Art by Ahmed Raafat

Edited by S. Greenleaf

GORILLA MY DREAMS #1: MIME OF MY LIFE (Regular Cover)

GORILLA MY DREAMS #1: MIME OF MY LIFE (Blank Cover w/ Big Tim Sketch)

 

GORILLA MY DREAMS #2: GORILLA TAILS

Written by Big Tim Stiles

Art by Ahmed Raafat

Edited by S. Greenleaf

GORILLA MY DREAMS #2: GORILLA TAILS (Regular Cover)

GORILLA MY DREAMS #2: GORILLA TAILS (Blank Cover w/ Big Tim Sketch)

 

 

  • Digital PDFs of GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 and 2
  • Digital PDFs of GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 and 2 scripts

 

  • Print Copies of GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 and 2. You can choose which version you would prefer otherwise it will be random. (Does not include sketch on blank covers)
  • ​Digital PDFs of GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 and 2, and scripts for #1 and 2

 

  • GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 - Print Copy (Regular Cover)
  • GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 - Print Copy (Blank Cover w/ Big Tim Sketch)
  • ​GORILLA MY DREAMS #2 - Print Copy (Regular Cover)
  • GORILLA MY DREAMS #2 - Print Copy (Limited Edition Cover)
  • GORILLA MY DREAMS #2 - Print Copy (Blank Cover w/ Big Tim Sketch)
  • Digital PDFs of GORILLA MY DREAMS #1 and 2, and scripts for #1 and 2

 

GORILLA MY DREAMS #2: GORILLA TAILS includes four awesome pin-up pages!

Six-Gun Gorilla by Ahmed Raafat

Gorilla my Dreams: 2089 by Ahmed Raafat

Knockaround-Guy by Paul Gori

 

The Adequate Boys by Carlos Pedro

 

UPDATE #1: FREE SIX-GUN GORILLA MINI-PRINT!
