story:
Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour is a proposed graphic novel based on the true story of Iva Toguri, a Japanese American from Los Angeles, California who visited distant relatives in Tokyo, Japan shortly before the attack on Pearl Harbor, that saw her country not only at odds with Japan, but with her family and herself.

While trapped in Japan, Iva fought the prejudice of Japanese society and it's government, who saw her as an enemy, as she was not willing to denounce her American citizenship and become a subject of the Empire of the Sun. She took a job with Radio Tokyo working in the propaganda department...where she soon became Tokyo Rose, the Siren of the Pacific, charged with demoralizing American troops!

But, did she? 

Who was Tokyo Rose really? What did she stand for? Who did she support? Was she a traitor...or a hero? 

In this proposed 75-page hardcover graphic novel, the answers to these questions will tell the dramatic tale of a woman who fought against all odds and how she went from an American Sweetheart to a "National Traitor" by being at the wrong place at the wrong time.

This is a story that needs no flourishes, and the creative team has worked tirelessly to research and develop Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour, relying on biographies written about Iva Toguri, the "Tokyo Rose" phenomenon, and of course the devastating effects of World War II on the Asian-American communities and the world at large. 

The team is very mindful of the sensitive nature of the topic and the history, and we've worked effectively to assure that this is a book that will honor the memory of all those effected by the war, and the generations that have come since. 

In a world that is still rife with misinformation, inequality and racial/gender prejudices, the tale of Tokyo Rose has never been more relevant than it is today. This story isn't just about an Asian American woman caught up in the wrong place at the wrong time. It's the story of every American today who experiences or witnesses racial inequality, misrepresentation and gender bias. It's the story of an underdog who, despite everything working against them, struggles to survive and doesn't give up. It's the story of the best part of what is America. 

See for yourself! Below are sample pages as well as some character designs from the amazing Kate Kasenow: 

We've raised $7,500 for our project off of Kickstarter, which is going to support our amazing artist, Kate Kasenow. Now we're extending the opportunity to Indiegogo supporters, providing you with a chance to join what we are calling: The Honorable Bonhead Brigade (Iva used to call her listeners "Boneheads").

Whether you're able to support for $1 or $100 we'd love for you to share the campaign and talk about it with your friends as well. We are so grateful for your support. We cannot thank you enough for checking out our campaign. 

We have some pretty extraordinary stretch goals lined up so let's get there as soon as possible! Each stretch goal achieved expands this epic adventure and the experience the backers will have with it. 

The first stretch goal of $10,000 will see legendary letterer, Janice Chiang, one of the first female comic book letterers in the industry, who has worked on everything from Transformers to Iron Man and Ghostrider!

 

Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour is the joint effort of writer/artist team, Andre Frattino (Simon Says, A Land Remembered) and Kate Kasenow (Form of a Question, An Elegy for Amelia Johnson), who have joined forces to tell this exciting story in graphic novel form. 

Andre, hails from Florida and has spent the majority of his comic career writing and illustrating tales focused on history, legends and folklore. Fresh from his 2017 successful Kickstarter, Simon Says: Nazi Hunter (coming out through Image Comics as a full feature graphic novel in Sept. 2019) and A Land Remembered: A Graphic Novel (which just won Bronze in the Visual Arts category of the 2018 Florida Book Awards) Andre seeks to replicate that success in telling this exciting tale set on the other side of the world during World War II. 

Kate, is from Indiana, the heartland of America. Her seasoned background in comics range from working with publishers like Archaia Entertainment, BOOM! Studios and Oni Press as an illustrator, to a stint editing comics for Comixology in New York City. Recently, she's worked with comic writer and "Jeopardy" contestant, Andrew Rostan on his memoir, Form of a Question.

 

We'll be working with Atheris Publishing on the first-edition Kickstarter copies of Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour. Atheris Publishing is a division of Atheris Entertainment, which has successfully funded three board game projects themselves (Cul-De-Sac Conquest, Mutant Crops and Supernatural Socks) and consulted on another successful board game project (Ore: The Mining Game). Atheris will be assisting with the marketing and community management of this campaign. 

We hope to have the completed book in the hands of our backers by no later than July 2020, just in time to celebrate Iva's 104th Birthday! This gives us the time needed to make sure that the book is completed to the highest standards that history demands and our supporters expect...

Risks and challenges

Our team is incredibly well versed in producing products.

Andre and Kate have worked on several comic projects. Andre has graphic novels with Pineapple Press as well as Image Comics. Andre has also successfully funded and delivered a former Kickstarter project called Simon Says, which was recently picked up by Image Comics.

Additionally, Atheris Entertainment, has successfully funded and delivered three board game Kickstarter projects.

Though all projects have their risks we've done this all before and have done everything in our power to mitigate as many as possible.
story_txt: Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour is a proposed graphic novel based on the true story of Iva Toguri, a Japanese American from Los Angeles, California who visited distant relatives in Tokyo, Japan shortly before the attack on Pearl Harbor, that saw her country not only at odds with Japan, but with her family and herself.While trapped in Japan, Iva fought the prejudice of Japanese society and it's government, who saw her as an enemy, as she was not willing to denounce her American citizenship and become a subject of the Empire of the Sun. She took a job with Radio Tokyo working in the propaganda department...where she soon became Tokyo Rose, the Siren of the Pacific, charged with demoralizing American troops!But, did she? Who was Tokyo Rose really? What did she stand for? Who did she support? Was she a traitor...or a hero? In this proposed 75-page hardcover graphic novel, the answers to these questions will tell the dramatic tale of a woman who fought against all odds and how she went from an American Sweetheart to a "National Traitor" by being at the wrong place at the wrong time.This is a story that needs no flourishes, and the creative team has worked tirelessly to research and develop Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour, relying on biographies written about Iva Toguri, the "Tokyo Rose" phenomenon, and of course the devastating effects of World War II on the Asian-American communities and the world at large. The team is very mindful of the sensitive nature of the topic and the history, and we've worked effectively to assure that this is a book that will honor the memory of all those effected by the war, and the generations that have come since. In a world that is still rife with misinformation, inequality and racial/gender prejudices, the tale of Tokyo Rose has never been more relevant than it is today. This story isn't just about an Asian American woman caught up in the wrong place at the wrong time. It's the story of every American today who experiences or witnesses racial inequality, misrepresentation and gender bias. It's the story of an underdog who, despite everything working against them, struggles to survive and doesn't give up. It's the story of the best part of what is America. See for yourself! Below are sample pages as well as some character designs from the amazing Kate Kasenow: We've raised $7,500 for our project off of Kickstarter, which is going to support our amazing artist, Kate Kasenow. Now we're extending the opportunity to Indiegogo supporters, providing you with a chance to join what we are calling: The Honorable Bonhead Brigade (Iva used to call her listeners "Boneheads").Whether you're able to support for $1 or $100 we'd love for you to share the campaign and talk about it with your friends as well. We are so grateful for your support. We cannot thank you enough for checking out our campaign. We have some pretty extraordinary stretch goals lined up so let's get there as soon as possible! Each stretch goal achieved expands this epic adventure and the experience the backers will have with it. The first stretch goal of $10,000 will see legendary letterer, Janice Chiang, one of the first female comic book letterers in the industry, who has worked on everything from Transformers to Iron Man and Ghostrider! Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour is the joint effort of writer/artist team, Andre Frattino (Simon Says, A Land Remembered) and Kate Kasenow (Form of a Question, An Elegy for Amelia Johnson), who have joined forces to tell this exciting story in graphic novel form. Andre, hails from Florida and has spent the majority of his comic career writing and illustrating tales focused on history, legends and folklore. Fresh from his 2017 successful Kickstarter, Simon Says: Nazi Hunter (coming out through Image Comics as a full feature graphic novel in Sept. 2019) and A Land Remembered: A Graphic Novel (which just won Bronze in the Visual Arts category of the 2018 Florida Book Awards) Andre seeks to replicate that success in telling this exciting tale set on the other side of the world during World War II. Kate, is from Indiana, the heartland of America. Her seasoned background in comics range from working with publishers like Archaia Entertainment, BOOM! Studios and Oni Press as an illustrator, to a stint editing comics for Comixology in New York City. Recently, she's worked with comic writer and "Jeopardy" contestant, Andrew Rostan on his memoir, Form of a Question. We'll be working with Atheris Publishing on the first-edition Kickstarter copies of Tokyo Rose: Zero Hour. Atheris Publishing is a division of Atheris Entertainment, which has successfully funded three board game projects themselves (Cul-De-Sac Conquest, Mutant Crops and Supernatural Socks) and consulted on another successful board game project (Ore: The Mining Game). Atheris will be assisting with the marketing and community management of this campaign. We hope to have the completed book in the hands of our backers by no later than July 2020, just in time to celebrate Iva's 104th Birthday! This gives us the time needed to make sure that the book is completed to the highest standards that history demands and our supporters expect...Risks and challengesOur team is incredibly well versed in producing products.Andre and Kate have worked on several comic projects. Andre has graphic novels with Pineapple Press as well as Image Comics. Andre has also successfully funded and delivered a former Kickstarter project called Simon Says, which was recently picked up by Image Comics.Additionally, Atheris Entertainment, has successfully funded and delivered three board game Kickstarter projects.Though all projects have their risks we've done this all before and have done everything in our power to mitigate as many as possible.

story:
• My name is Simon Mitchell, I’m the creator of Bad Sushi Cannon.
  • I’m starting a campaign to get some help with printing costs of a trade collection of my comic book series, and to help cover some costs for hiring a professional letterer and possibly a colorist.  It would mean a lot to me and all who work on our comic to see our work reach new places!
  • This has been a work of blood sweat and tears, we two brothers toiling through good times and bad times, spanning years upon years.  If you help us reach our goal, if you take our comic and show it to the world, then our years will have been worth every endeavor!  We have put a lot of time and love toward Bad Sushi Cannon.
  • We’re asking for $7,000. Some funds will go towards printing the books and the process of bringing the comic into a polished form. Some of it will go towards our perk tiers. 
  • Supporters who wish to invest in our product can receive exclusive perks like special posters that will only be made available during this campaign, signed copies of the graphic novel, original sketches, and even original pages from the comic book in an 11 x 17 finished inked format.
  • Even if you can’t contribute to the graphic novel with a monetary donation, you would help us out a lot by getting the word out about our campaign!  We believe that our comic is unique enough, art wise and story wise, that it has such potential, that we are confident that our campaign will gain traction, but that traction can only become stronger by word of mouth from comic book fans and fans of the arts in general like you.  Keep our dreams and our work going, and we will keep the comic book alive!
  • I appreciate your time and attention here, thank you for considering us and supporting our comic!~
story_txt:
My name is Simon Mitchell, I’m the creator of Bad Sushi Cannon.
I’m starting a campaign to get some help with printing costs of a trade collection of my comic book series, and to help cover some costs for hiring a professional letterer and possibly a colorist.  It would mean a lot to me and all who work on our comic to see our work reach new places!
This has been a work of blood sweat and tears, we two brothers toiling through good times and bad times, spanning years upon years.  If you help us reach our goal, if you take our comic and show it to the world, then our years will have been worth every endeavor!  We have put a lot of time and love toward Bad Sushi Cannon.


We’re asking for $7,000. Some funds will go towards printing the books and the process of bringing the comic into a polished form. Some of it will go towards our perk tiers. 
Supporters who wish to invest in our product can receive exclusive perks like special posters that will only be made available during this campaign, signed copies of the graphic novel, original sketches, and even original pages from the comic book in an 11 x 17 finished inked format.

Even if you can’t contribute to the graphic novel with a monetary donation, you would help us out a lot by getting the word out about our campaign!  We believe that our comic is unique enough, art wise and story wise, that it has such potential, that we are confident that our campaign will gain traction, but that traction can only become stronger by word of mouth from comic book fans and fans of the arts in general like you.  Keep our dreams and our work going, and we will keep the comic book alive!
I appreciate your time and attention here, thank you for considering us and supporting our comic!~

story:
Hi everyone, this is Brendan Hykes, creator of Campaigners, back here to ask for your help again!

The response we got to the first campaign was wonderful, and thanks to everyone's contributions we were able to fund the first issue of Campaigners, now available at zeropresscomics.com! We've since been able to complete the second issue as well, also available on the website, and we're well on our way to completing the third issue.

This brings us to you, and this campaign. We need your help to finish the series. There are two more 12-page issues to go, and we're asking for contributions to make this happen.

We're hoping to raise $2500, which will cover art, lettering and production of issues 4 and 5. Anything over the initial goal we'll be sure to find uses for, promotional art, back-up stories, (color?), things that will make Campaigners even better. Things we can give back to our supporters!


For those of you new to the comic, Campaigners is a five-issue mini series set in 2076, where politics are brutal and violent, and the country has regressed socially and economically in many ways. Kydra Franks is a high school student who hates the current political system, and when she publicly denounces it, her rant goes viral and she gets caught up in the middle of a huge social movement.

You can find a FREE 5-page preview comic, as well as buy the first two issues, at zeropresscomics.com!

So please take a look at the rewards we're offering, including an exclusive Making Of book, a handwritten short story, a critique of your comic script, and even an appearance in one of the comics!

We've also just added some rewards from Editor and Trans Consultant Mey Valdivia Rude, including a shoutout on twitter, a consultation on a trans character or storyline, and a bad-art sketch!


Remember that every contribution helps, and if you can't contribute but would still like to help, please share this project around.

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

HI guys! My name is Emily Ree and I'm the creator of Anarchy Dreamers. I am an independent comic artist, writer, colorist, and educator from New York and have 4 successful crowdfunding campaigns under my belt!

Anarchy Dreamers is an urban fantasy comic about sparkly undead kids fighting society's worst Nightmares. I ran a successful campaign to print Anarchy Dreamers volume 1 last fall, a 160 paged paperback graphic novel. The campaign was very successful and the first edition of volume 1 hit the shelves in February 2017! 

As soon as distribution began, I knew that we'd run out of volume 1 faster than I originally anticipated. I figured we'd run out by the end of 2017, maybe the beginning of 2018. My intention had been to package reprinting Volume 1 and the first run of Volume 2 in one big kickstarter, most likely launching in summer 2018. 

But here we are in the summer of 2017. Less than 20 books left, with two large conventions coming up in the fall.

We gotta print more books!

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is to assist in reprinting volume 1! 

What does that mean?

  • The funds collected from this campaign will help me print more books.
  • THIS IS NOT A PREORDER FOR A BOOK! All funds are donations to help me offset the cost of the reprint.
  • Most of the money for the reprints will be coming from original book sales and Patreon. Printing books is expensive and shipping them to my house is almost as expensive as printing them! Any help I can get is wonderful and incredibly helpful!

But you will get something for your donation!

  • Anyone who donates $10 or more will get a thank you card with an Anarchy Dreamers sketch ! You can tell me what you'd like me to draw, or leave it up to me. : ) Ships anywhere in the world, stationary is guaranteed to be cute!

The Impact

With your help, I will be able to print more comics and promote Anarchy Dreamers even more than before! Without printing assistance, I won't be able to print enough books to hold us until next summer. 

Risks & Challenges

The book already exists, this is simply a reprint.

Aside from the post office losing your card, there are no other risks or challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Want to purchase one of the very last copies of Anarchy Dreamers volume 1? Check it out here! (Remember, this isn't a book preorder, it's a fundraising campaign!) 
  • Spread the word!

Thank you for your time and generosity.

story:
Hi there, welcome to the Indiegogo page for Digitopia 1 + 2 comic book, we're ready to send the book to the printer. 

We wanted to run a quick campaign for those who may have missed the Kickstarter to get themselves a copy of the book before we send the final order to the printer.

This is a really short campaign duration - so please get your copy now, we're looking to send final numbers to the printer on Dec 1st.  

What is Digitopia the comic book?

 

Digitopia is a pre-apocalyptic action adventure story of a father and daughter trying to survive in a civilisation that is imploding, where everyone from the army, society and bounty hunters are out to get them. 

 

 

We tackle some pretty hard hitting issues in these books including 

  • the rise of the hard right
  • fake wars and the brutality of the state
  • fake news and what drives media biases 

 

all encapsulated in a super high adrenaline action adventure - think 'The Matrix' meets 'The Running Man'.  

 

 

The Impact

In many ways Digitopia explores a lot of the issues that we are facing today.

 

 

See any parallels between this book and the real world?

You don't have to look to the other side of the world to see these things, this is happening in our own Western culture, these things are happening now - if we don't make a stand against this, it will only get worse.

 

But will backing a comic book make a change?

It won't solve everything, but you're sending out a signal 

  • that we want new content, 
  • we want content that speaks to our problems and 
  •  we want content that challenges the status quo not reinforces it.

 

The number of books that we ask the printer to order will be based on the number of backers we get in this campaign.

 

If these are issues that you care about and want to be part of a change then please back this project today

 

Want to see the Art Work?

Here's are the first few pages from Digitopia 1 - these are all complete!

 

If you love action adventure comics you are going to love Digitopia.  

Issue 1 is all ready, we're putting final the touches of Issue 2 this week (Nov 23rd), we're aiming to get a physical print proof to sign off the week (Nov 23rd).  When this campiagn ends, we'll be looking to send the final numbers to the printer.  

This campaign is for both

  • backers who are new to the series and 
  • backers who are already on-board with issue 1.

 

What others are saying about Digitopia

We were overwhelmed by all the critical acclaim we received for Digitopia 1.0.  

 

The Rewards

  • Paperback versions of both Digitopia 1 + 2 - starts at £8 per issue
     

 

  • Save more and get both books - £14 for both issue 1 and 2
     

 

  • Prefer Digital?  We've prepared a special Digitopia 1.0 + Digitopia 2.0 Digital Deluxe pack for you - £12.  

 

The Digital Deluxe versions will get you deeper into the story with making off articles, behind the scenes page break downs, anatomy of pages and character designs - for you to enjoy across your devices

  • Best of both worlds - paperback + digital deluxe + meticulously designed Digital Wallpapers for your phone, tablet and desktop and a pack of specially designed pack of 3 Art Cards - £25
     

 

  • Audio Commentaries that get you deeper into the story + the scripts for issue 1 and 2!  Audio Commentary pack - £35
     

 

  • Get the ultimate pack!
    All the above rewards + Video Commentary that get you deeper into the story + the scripts for issue 1 and 2 + get your books signed + 2 extra digital comic books - only £40.
     

 

On top of everything else when you back at the Video Commentary level you'll also get  two extra free digital comics added courtesy of my friends at Comix Tribe (thanks Tyler for organising this for us) and signed copies of both issue 1 and 2.  

Includes previous rewards - you'll have everything.  

 

Meet the team

 

 

Farhan Qureshi the writer, who has been writing for many years, feature film, animation and now comic books.  

About the script Farhan says that 'the script for Digitopia 2.0 is unequivocally the best writing I've ever done, then I gave it to Hass, who made the script twice as good'.  

Hassan Ostmane-Elhaou edited Digitopia 1.0 and Digitopia 2.0 - he also edits PanelxPanel.  

Together with our amazingly talented art team, Tom Hoskisson is on pencils and inks and Simon Robins, Art Director, Colourist and Letterer - the layout, inks and colours produced elevates the story to a whole new level.  

 

This isn't the first book we've made - this team will deliver!

 

With the help of nearly 200 backers, we successfully launched Issue 1 of Digitopia the comic book series back in 2018 and 2019.  

 

Following on from the Kickstarter, we launched the book on Amazon where it became an Amazon best seller - hitting the number 1 spot on Amazon in the comic's section.  

 

 

 

 

You can see the project has come together really well.  We aim to make this comic book something very special indeed.  

We believe this book touches issues and challenges we face in a fresh original way - we hope you'll be able to get involved in this really exciting project. 

Thanks for your support!

Farhan

 

Risks & Challenges

Issue 1 of the Digitopia is complete, at the time of launching this campaign issue 2 is about 95% complete (currently we're doing a spelling, punctuation and grammar check and one final touch on the colours, we'll be sending the book to the printer to do a physical proof - then we're good to go).  

I've tried to time it so that this campaign ends at the same time I approve the physical proof of issue 2. 

I want to get the orders lined up from both the original Kickstarter and this Indiegogo campaign to send to the printer at the end of the campaign.

I have checked with our printer, Comics Printing UK, they are still running at normal operations.

Postal services are still running as normal. I will keep backers up to date in case there are any changes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, you can still help:

  • Help us get the word out, tell your friends about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks so much for all your support, we can't wait to get your books to you.

Farhan

story:
Dottie's Diary

 

Dottie's Diary is inspired by the love of my life, my cute and fluffy little diva bunny! My name is Roxanne and I live in The Netherlands. Dottie's Diary is created by me but my friends, family and everybody around me inspire the topics for drawings I make.

It started with Facebook, I asked my friends to say a word and I would make a drawing about that topic. Then they started to mail me for personalised drawings and shortly after they asked me if I would maybe consider making a calender. So I thought why not give it a shot! ;)

By helping me and Dottie you will contribute to feel good adventures, a little bit of creativity to start your day with a smile! 

 

What I Want & What You Get

I want to start simple but reach a big and diverse audience.

So I'd like to start with a daycalendar for adults and a picture book for children (which is also fun to read if your an adult kid ;) ). € 2000,- is my goal and that will cover the costs of making a calendar and a picture book.

Dottie's Diary is my signature cartoon which makes it unique! Donate € 500,- and you'll get a lead character in a Dottie's Diary serie. Isn't that the most unique gift you can think off? :D

The best (not so best for me..) part is that you will receive your money back if I don't make my goal..But I have faith and Dottie think she was born to be famous, so I guess we have nothing to lose!

 

The Message

Dottie has a message that is simple but important..Like the cartoon style..

"Happiness for everybody!"

It's easy to make someone sad but it's also simple to make someone happy and that's something that people often forget. 

Dottie would like to contribute to everyone's happiness, daily!

 

Dottie's question for you:

Hi! I really want to make everybody smile, will you help me with that? I promiss that helping me will make you smile aswell. :D All you need to do is share this with the Indiegogo share tools or visit the website: www.dottiesdiary.com

story:
Overview

 

 Johnny has come far from his days as a gang banger, to the premiere hitman for the West Coast Cartel. When old employers give him new assignments in New York, Johnny discovers he is being manipulated into breaking his only rule, no women, no children. Whose hand is pulling strings, and why do they want a kid murdered?

 

What are you Backing?

 

  • Action, Martial Arts, Gun-Fu, Wrath & Revenge
  • 50 Page Graphic Novel W/ 6 additional Sketchbook pages by Ibai Canales
  • Full Color
  • Independent Creators
  • Comics w/o agendas

 

Preview

 

 

Johnny's Law: RONIN a 10-page Ashcan...


Preview

 

Trading card Artwork by Cesar Feliciano

 

Creators

 

Alejandro Garcia - Writer | Colorist | Letterer

Publisher for all Deltaverse titles. Alejandro wrote Johnny's Law in 2018, stemming from an old movie idea from 1997. He is also a first time colorist that has taken to it like a fish to water. Kristian Rossi (Artist/Colorist Void Walker - Alternacomics) says, Alejandro's "color palette is great, smooth and balanced". What an endorsement! Deltaverse has a wealth of titles to be campaigned EXCLUSIVELY on IndieGogo.

Ibai Canales - Artist

Known as the Hound of Basque, Ibai is a Spanish penciler and inker known for greats like Iron Sights, Iron Sights: 2 Psychos, SOS Vol 1 & 2, The Abductables, and Necromancer: Tombstone Blues. He has proven time and time again that his campaigns are highly anticipated and always fulfilled. His artwork is as controversial and outspoken as he is with bold lines and visceral energy.

Cesar Feliciano - Artist

Cesar is second only to Ibai as one of the fastest artists in the community. You will see his work on the prequel/ashcan, and trading cards. His style is angular, beefy, and all his own. A Marine and family man, Cesar draws his inspiration and motivation from family, service, and God. With over 27 years of experience in the art of comics, he has provided art for Chango: The Broken Veil, The Red Ten, and his upcoming graphic novel, Jinn and Tonik. 

Enrique Puig - Editor

Enrique “Spike” G. Puig is a writer, journalist, critic, translator, and former radio host from Mexico City. He specialized in TV screenplays at Mexico's writers' guild, Sogem. He has been published by Marvel, Heavy Metal Magazine, the Mexican comic book magazine Comikaze, Panini Comics Mexico, Kamite... and currently works on his self-published comic book projects and writing for Geeks + Gamers & Bleeding Fool.

We are set to deliver a three-part series over time:

  • Johnny's Law
  • Johnny's Law: Rebel
  • The Master's Law

These three pieces will form the evolution of Johnny Law the killer, and Johnny Law the man. We will see how he operates and what he must do to be the man he was meant to be. 

 

What We need & What You Get

Our goal is $5000 for a fun, action packed, full color graphic novel that we know you will enjoy. We do NOT share any of your information! We only use this for sending you promotional emails, and your books and perks. All books will be sent securely in a gemini mailer.

Stretch Goals:

$6000 - 10 Page Prequel, Johnny's Law: RONIN printed in the book Art by Cesar Feliciano

$6500 - 3 / Full Color Trading Card Set

$8000 - $1000 Bonus for Ibai Canales

$8500 - $500 Bonus for Cesar Feliciano

For those that sign up on the mailing list will get a digital copy of the Prequel and a double-sided trading card featuring work by Ibai and Cesar.

 

 

The Impact

Johnny's Law represents the start of a mass of projects from Deltaverse Comics. We will bring you diversity in the form of characters and stories, not agendas and politics. We will strive to listen and take your criticisms to heart as much as possible. This will also be another opportunity for the unsung artists to make a name for themselves and for the superstars to show love to their roots. Your support is the first step to making this happen.
 

Risks & Challenges

This is our first venture and we do not intend it to be our last. It's a fixed goal--so if we don't fund, you'll be refunded and we will launch again. This means, you won't have to worry about your contribution--we want you to come back. We won't take no for an answer, and we will fight to bring you all of our wild ideas! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes we want to be a big part of this community but we don't have the means. No problem! Just share our campaign on social media, and your various content channels. We are also open to interviews and questions. You can reach us at: deltaversecomics@gmail.com

story:
Doctor Dream issue 2 is available NOW on IndieGoGo!

Continuing the story of Sora Tengoku, we see the gifted doctor now able to help more people with their disturbing dreams and debilitating nightmares. But this new fame has also gained the attention of Dr. Weir who is obsessed with Dr. Dream's powers and seeks to capture those powers for himself--whatever the cost!

The team behind Dr. Dream: Keith Carmona (writer), Federico Sioc, Jr. (artist), Diego Vasquez (colors).

Dr. Dream is a 12 page all ages comic and the second book in the series. It is a classic good guy/bad guy story that kids enjoy and adults have come to love!

All the goodies from a comic convention...right to your door!

That's right! Since we can't meet in person, we'll bring the convention to you. In addition to the great items that went with the first issue, we've also got:

  • t-shirts
  • masks
  • stickers

You can also get Dr. Dream issue 1 as well!

New to the series? Here's your chance to get the 29 page award winning 1st issue--now, for the first time,  in both print and digital versions. Keep the prints at home and take the digitals with you in high resolution pdfs.

STRETCH GOALS:

IF WE HIT $500, all levels will get a digital wallpaper Dr Dream collage by Eli Beaird, exclusive to this Indiegogo campaign!

 

If we reach our goal of $2,000, all Double Dream and higher levels will get a physical print of the Dr. Dream collage by Eli Beaird!

 

The Goal

The goal with this campaign is to bring you fun entertaining stories featuring art by some of the best graphic storytellers. I will be shipping all materials utilizing Gemini Comic Flash Mailers so everything arrives in crisp, mint condition. 

Risks & Challenges

Okay--this is borrowed language from my publisher Jason Dube--but hey, why mess with  a good thing, right?

"The comic books are all completed. Everything is done, we just need to get it to the printers and ship it to you. Of course this is life and I suppose anything can happen, but I really don't foresee any kind of delay in getting these into your hands."

Help Spread the Word!

Share this page with family and friends! Just hit those share buttons up top!

You can check out my YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdg0UfH1zuXLmU...

Scattered Comics YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0Bdrmbn3pJhKr...

My webpage: https://www.keithcarmona.com/

And the Scattered Comics webpage: https://www.scatteredcomics.com/

Thanks for reading and thanks for your support!

Keith Carmona

story:
Yun is searching for a teacher to help her master her magical powers.

Radha is on a quest to find the ancestral home of her people.

Zara… just wants to go home.

When these three 14-year-old girls each find part of an ancient talisman – a doorway to a dimension of infinite knowledge – things look good. That is, until they discover that a murderous, insane cyborg is also after the talisman. Oh, and his army of robots has them surrounded.

(That's all the art that we can show without starting to get into spoilers, and nobody likes those, right?)

 

Tales of the Twelve Stars is a science-fantasy adventure which has been inspired by Dragon Ball, Final Fantasy and Avatar: The Last Airbender. After a successful first Indiegogo campaign on in November 2017, during which we raised enough to print issues #0 and #1... we’re back to continue the story with issue #2.

 

 

If you’re a returning supporter of the series, it’s good to have you back! We’ve got a lot of stuff for you as well, including some new perks, and we think you will really like them.

 

If you’re brand new to the series, welcome and thank you for joining us! We have set up a couple of catch-up packages just for you, and you can get a fully digital set for USD$15, or all three printed comics (and a lot of other goodies) for USD$30.

 

If you’re not sure whether this series is for you, then we’d like to invite you to read issues #0 and #1 for free! Just click the links below to download them. These are standard-edition issues, and if you want to dig deeper, the campaign features deluxe digital issues (including the full, original script, as well as additional articles that expand more on the galaxy of the Twelve Stars).

 

Click to download Tales of the Twelve Stars #0 & #1 (standard edition)

 

 

The comic book:

 

 

*Science-fantasy adventure story about family, friendship, teamwork and perseverance, suitable for young adults and up.

*Every issue features 32 full-colour pages of story.

*105 gsm (70 lbs.) interior paper, and a 210 gsm (~140 lbs) cover with matte lamination and a spot UV coating.

*26 cm x 10.83 cm (same size as a normal Marvel/DC/Image comic book)

*Part 3 of a 6-part mini-series.

 

Last campaign, one of our stretch goals was to give issues #0 and #1 a really slick spot UV treatment for the cover. That meant that we needed the covers to have matte lamination, and that meant we needed a stronger art card for the covers. So... having set that bar, we can't not do it again this time!

 

 

That's a picture of the cover to issue #0 - thanks to all the backers who made it a reality! We really like how the books feel when we pick them up, and we hope you will agree.

 

Perks!

Now it's time for the good stuff. Here are the rewards available to backers of this campaign!

 

Hang on... "talking PDF"? What's THAT?

 

These are digital pin-ups that we are offering the campaign. The only difference is that I will add unique word balloons to all of them, like so:

 

A talking pin-up is included in ALL pledge tiers, beginning at $10.

Every talking pin-up is completely unique, and no two backers will receive identical versions of a pin-up.

I'll be posting more examples from time to time in campaign updates, and on my Facebook page, which you can find here.

 

 

Campaign stuff:

 

Art for the book is nearing completion (at launch, it’s about 90% finished), and after that the pages just need to be lettered. We have learned A TON from our previous experience running a crowdfunding campaign, and fully expect to have all rewards ready to ship this October 2018.

In my limited experience, from the time I drop books off at the post office, it takes two weeks to ship to America. So that should mean that everyone who backs for physical rewards will have them by November, at the latest.

 

Here's what we will be doing with the money from this campaign. Any money we raise above our goal will be rolled directly into additional production costs, including:

  • Getting the pages for issue #2 professionally lettered (by our good friend and awesome letterer, Sean Rinehart, who handled lettering for issues #0 and #1).
  • Producing more campaign rewards, such as prints and sticker sheets - and new campaign rewards (that will be announced later!).
  • Art costs for the remaining issues of Tales of the Twelve Stars.

 

SHIPPING:

 

One of the biggest improvements we have made, based on our experiences, has been to our shipping game. Everything is streamlined and good to go!

Malaysia (yes, including East Malaysia!): US$3 for up to 3 comics.

Singapore, Brunei, Indonesia, Hong Kong, Thailand, Philippines: US$6 for up to 3 comics.

All other countries: US$12 for up to 3 comics.

 

Note: Yup, that's right, it costs the same to ship one comic as it does three!

 

 

The team:

 

Albert Lim

Albert Lim is a comics writer based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. An award-winning copywriter with a Bronze Lion at Cannes to his name, he is also a Comics Experience alumnus, having taken a number of comics writing courses and masterclasses taught by some of the best teachers in the industry. With almost two decades of experience in six martial arts, he has spent more than eight years coaching the gentle-not-gentle art of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, and was one of the first team of athletes to represent Malaysia in Jujitsu.

 

Tan Zie Aun

Zie Aun Tan, also based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, graduated with a degree in Software Engineering, and has been doing anything but. He recently sold his education business to pursue art full-time. He likes cute things and Magic: the Gathering. In his free time, he fights existential dread.

 

Risks and challenges:

 

This is my second crowdfunding campaign, having successfully run my first campaign in November 2017. I learned an incredible amount and have made every effort to learn from the past in order to make this the best campaign I can and improve as much as possible over my first outing.

 

I have put in a lot of time and effort into making this campaign run even more smoothly than my first, but one of the things I learned is that it's impossible to prepare for everything. Ultimately, if something's going to go wrong, it will. If anything does, I will do everything I can to make it right.

 

My goal is to make this campaign a great experience for backers, and I hope to leave every single one satisfied and looking forward to the next installment of Tales of the Twelve Stars. If you have any further questions, please feel free to send me a message.

 

Thank you!

story:
About the Project

Ancient Astronauts is a 168 page hardcover graphic novel, hand painted entirely in watercolor. It's a blend of science fiction and fantasy, taking place on Plaine, a highly developed planet-nation.

Vincent Pompetti, a classically trained artist from Belgium, developed Ancient Astronauts over the course of 10 years out of a love for the science fiction genre. The first project entirely written and illustrated by himself, the book was first published in France, and is now translated into English.

The book is completely finished and ready for print, with a free 15 page preview available here. With your support, we will bring Ancient Astronauts to print.

The Story

"In the infinite cosmos are scattered millions of galaxies. Lost among them, a world similar to ours develops in its own solar system. On Plaine, a highly developed planet-nation, the opening reveals Onys, a young and daring archer. She emerges from sleep, short of breath, alerted by a dangerous presence lingering around her. An imperceptible but undeniable entity, defying the laws of physics, manifesting itself like a cloud of smoke, almost palpable. A presence whose mysterious nature would soon rock her senses and shake her perceptions of reality."

Click here for a free 15 page sample of Ancient Astronauts.

 

 

The Artist

Vincent Pompetti is an italian artist born in Liège, Belgium, originally from Pineto and Atri, in the Abruzzo region of Italy. He graduated from the St. Luc Institute of Fine Arts in 1998 with a specialization in graphic novels. Two years later he authored and published his first graphic novel with Glénat called Planète Divine, leading to a collaboration with the scenarist and graffiti specialist Tarek. From that collaboration resulted several significant works including Sir Arthur Benton, and more recently The Gallic Wars and the pirate story, The Malouin. Both artists have invested in the independent publisher Tartamudo, with José Jover, and created the artist association known as Pegasus. Vincent collaborates with the Urban Art Magazine “Paris Tonkar”, and simultaneously develops his career in painting and illustration, having exhibited his art in Switzerland, Canada, Italy, and mainly in France. 

In 2012, with Tarek, Vincent began a pictorial adaptation of The Gallic Wars based on the texts by Julius Caesar, with the second part released in 2014 at a national exposition in Clermont-Ferrand and other historic sites around France., including the Saint-Romain-en-Gal museum of archaeology close to Lyon, France. Vincent served as professor of graphic novel narration and live model at l’École Pivaut in Nantes, France from 2010 to 2013. Since 2012, he has served as professor of painting and live model at The Ateliers Terre & Feu in Rennes, France.

The Editor

Andrew Benteau is the founder and primary translator at Black Panel Press. Since he was very young, he has loved drawing and has had a special interest in comic books.   

After graduating with a business degree in 2014, Andrew traveled to France to work and study for one year while learning French. There, he learned about the French "bande dessinée" style of comics, and how it differed from what he had seen in North America.  

In 2016, Andrew met with Vincent Pompetti to discuss the possibility of bringing his comics to North America. Shortly thereafter, Black Panel Press was formed with the mission of bringing exceptional graphic novels from all over the world to North American readers.

story: ...

“Prepare yourself for the most brutal Sport in the galaxy”

After witnessing the brutality of society via a randomized event on the street, an Overlord from the Planet Chaos, a realm where fighting to the death is not only a right but also a way of life, becomes enamored with the violence that desperation can cause. Inspired by a chance encounter with an old fighting show while blitzed out of his mind following a rough day at work, the wheels and cogs of his demented brain began to turn, launching into action the most vile and bloody gladiator fight in the history of the galaxy: The Intergalactic Deathmatch!

The most entertaining and capable fighters from all across the universe were gathered up, willingly or not, and dumped into a gauntlet fight where only one can come out alive and reign supreme




d

 

Name: Soul Rocket aka Jon Reinn

Species: Human

Planet: New Earth II

Gender: Male

Height: 6’2

Weight: 232

From a young age, Jon Reinn was captivated by the classical music of the 1970s. Growing up in the year 3257, Reinn revelled in the vintage delights of times gone by. Recruited into the Space Force from the Marines, Jon began his stint by commanding an army against outside invading forces on Space Station 50.

Given the nickname Soul Rocket by his comrades due to his love of soul music and incredible speed, Jon was thriving in his new role until a massive chunk of space junk slammed into him, damaging his spine and leaving him paralyzed.

His only hope was a dangerous and experimental surgery to encase him in a bionic exoskeleton. With no time to waste, the doctors began their work. When he awoke some time later, Jon was delighted to realize he could once again move but horrified at the realization that he was no longer on Space Station 50. The Overlord had stolen him away as a new contender for the top slot in the Intergalactic Deathmatch!

 Name: Bloodbath

 Species: Human

Planet: New Earth II

Gender: Male

Height: 7’1

Weight: 412

A massive, hulking monster, BloodBath is what many normal beings fear: a serial killer, cold and ruthless. He stands over seven feet tall and is nothing short of an emotionless killing machine with more than one hundred and fifty confirmed bodies in his murderous wake.

For years, BloodBath eluded authorities, killing as he moved just out of their reach in a seemingly unending game of chess where he sat as king. One mistake was made and soon, he landed himself in a maximum security prison on the planet ION-77, where he was placed on Death Row.

On the day of his execution, guards walked him down to his final ride and wasted no time strapping him into the chair. The electrified helmet was placed onto his head and the switch was flipped. Seconds before the current entered his body, the massive man disappeared into thin air, plucked from his death sentence to fight in the bloody Intergalactic Deathmatch by the Overlord himself.

Name: Tweaker

Species: Human

Planet: Annibus

Gender: Male

Height: 5'5

Weight: 170 pounds

Bio:

From humble beginnings in the slums of Annibus, Tweaker started out as little more than a petty thief, stealing to scrounge by. This theft resulted in him finding himself banished to the gritty underworld, where he gained quite the appetite for drugs.

Soon, Tweaker found himself addicted to a vile anabolic steroid muscle enhancer derived from various reptilian glands known as Slimitrophen. Referred to as Slim, the drug ate away at his arm, giving it a scalelike appearance akin to that of its slithering origins.

Tweaker’s cravings grew stronger and his debt began to mount, leading to him being sold off to fight in the Intergalactic Deathmatch to right his wrongs. Unfortunately, all Tweaker learned from this experience is that he easily developed

Name: The Bulger aka Nick Axl

Species: Creatiens (roid human)

Gender: Male

Height: 7’3

Weight: 441

Bio

As a citizen of Roid-X, Nick Axl was born into a society of buffed beyond belief men and women. Nick found himself as a participant in the Intergalactic Deathmatch following a failure of epic proportions. The spray tanned, oiled god marched onto stage in full anticipation of flexing the shit out of the crowd gathering to view his latest bodybuilding routine when he slipped on the gleaming oil that had dripped from the competitors who had gone before him.

As laughter filled his ears, Nick saw red and lost control, tearing into the crowd with his bare hands. When he came back to his senses, he was being carted off by the Overlord, surrounded by the carnage he had left in his wake during his moment of rage.

This raw power would be quite an asset to the Overlord as he began seeking out the most powerful fighter in the galaxy and with nothing to go back to aside from jail following his freakout of epic proportions, Nick Axl had no choice but to follow his new master into this modern gladiator battle

Name: Ironlung (aka: Captain Scorn)

Species

Planet

Gender male

Height 6’3

Weight 256

A space pirate, Captain Scorn was a vital part of the Overlord’s plan due to his ability to capture anyone fit to fight and hand deliver them to the arena. Unfortunately, he was exposed to the toxic pheromones of Siren while hunting her, rendering him damaged and in constant agony..

The Overlord recognized the Captain’s special kind of desperation and made him an offer he can't refuse: join the Deathmatch and earn his right to live and all of the riches he could ever hope for. Agreeing to the terms, Captain Scorn was whisked away to be repaired and rendered healthy enough to fight through a procedure that earned him the nickname, “Ironlung”. With nothing stopping him, Ironlung ventures into combat seeking vengeance against Siren and a new life of luxury.

And More...

Creators

As an emerging entity, Nukem Comics is a collaborative effort looking to create interesting comic serieses featuring fresh, new ideas. We started as a group of three friends just spinning ideas and dreaming of creating and now have gained footing and traction to work towards our ultimate goal of producing the kind of comics you can spend hours flipping through on your bedroom floor. 

Brothers George and Ron Dagan paired up with their longtime friend Randy Amoroso to begin this creative process. The trio aspire to produce something truly special, starting with their flagship piece: Intergalactic Deathmatch, a battle gauntlet story featuring gore, gross out humor, and throwback references tying together multiple genres in a new, niche style of comic creativity. 

Join Nukem Comics as they push forward with a new creative direction and experience the bloodlust and greed of the Overlord and his Intergalactic Deathmatch arenas as he pits his gladiators against one another in search of the galaxy’s greatest warrior!

 Aside from Intergalactic Deathmatch, Nukem Comics has many other projects in the works so keep your eyes peeled for other ventures that may soon appear on the production horizon! As avenue that welcomes creators with interesting ideas, Nukem Comics stands as a collaborative space. We want to help others bring their ideas to life and are entirely open to proposals andcreative input for new project ideas!

 

Artist

 Alzir Alves, lives in Brazil, founder of the school of visual arts Rascunho Studio, as well as a comic book artist and colorist, he also works as an art teacher. For over 15 years he has been working with comics and books. He went through several projects and publishers such as: Red Dragon Publisher, Grafset Publishers, Jester Press Comics, Monarch Comics, Big Dog Ink, Phl Interferon Sourse, Silver Fox Comics, Upper Deck Company in the production of Cards for Marvel Comics, Guará Entertainment, Jezebel, Carbon, Mirage Water Chaos, 2nd Coming Comix, TAFU, World of Superheroes, NeS publisher, Jambô publishers, Pooblicão and TimBerwolf Entertainment.

Alzir has a known career in Brazil and other countries. Currently, the artist is on the Nukem Comics project.

Writer

 Taylor Smith is a freelance content writer with close to a decade of experience. As part of the Nukem Comics team, she assists in stitching together the storyline and forming dialogue to bring the badass stories to life.

Lettering

 LetterSquids is a comic letterer and graphic designer based in Connecticut. They have projects with Scout Comics, Action Lab, Advent Comics, Insight Editions and tons of amazing indie creators.

Why Support Us?

With your support here on Kickstarter, we can achieve the Comic that Intergalactic Deathmatch should be. We want this project to be incredible and every little bit helps. Plus, you get some badass perks like stickers, Merch.

Thank You

None of this would be possible without all of our supporters. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Even the Overlord is grateful, in his own...special...way.

Jon St.John - Voice Actor

Logan Maxson - Concept Artist

Blake Mecklenburg - Concept Artist

Alzir Alves - Artist

Taylor Smith - Writer

LetterSquids - Letterer

Silvester Aguilar - Tshirt designer

Roger Bonet Martinez - Tshirt Designer 

And the fans 

We Thank you all!

Risks and challenges

us over here at Nukem Comics need your help to make our comics come to life . Thank you so much for being a part of something great!

story:
Stellar Odyssey is a science fiction adventure that launches readers into a brand-new universe. This comic will introduce readers to a handful of characters that live in the Stellar Odyssey universe and give them a glimpse of the wild adventures and epic journeys that lie ahead in future issues. Readers can expect encounters with amphibious alien creatures, shoot out battles with assassins and bounty hunters, an escape from a prison transfer ship, and the beginning of an odyssey. Stellar Odyssey is a 30-page full color comic book.

 

 

Cover Options

 

Pin Up Options

 

 

 

 

 

 

   All the comics and pin ups are already in stock and ready to ship out. We are running this campaign on Indiegogo as a follow up to our successful Kickstarter for those who may have missed out. All funds collected will cover the original production costs and for shipping out the rewards to our Indiegogo contributors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially sharing our links on social media and telling friends that may be interested helps out tremendously. Thank you!

story:
Year In Hereafter,YIH, is an ongoing webcomic running on it's website.
After 3 years of activity, YIH has uploaded 340 pages, and there are another +700 pages to come.
YIH is planned to be a 6 volume series, each spanning from 200 to 300 pages.

 

Mikael Rundstrom, a young mister from Helsinki with only hazy thoughts for a career and unfinished educations behind him, ventures to Lapland with the aspirations of becoming a rural entrepreneur, and needs an appropriate place for a 2 month long internship to further his college studies. 

Through his step-brother and sister in-law, he finds a position in a cozy little farm of Harmonsuo. They own a reindeer husbandry, and a massive swamp land just behind their doorstep.

The Harmonsuo are a varying lot of misfits who rather keep to themselves in their farm, strictly prohibiting anyone trespassing their swamp for odd reasons. Spirits. Monsters. Plain old odd stuff. Mikael hears quite the explanations. 

Mikael's two month long internship at the farm turns into an unwanted adventure in a foreign land of old-fashioned folk, and monsters also, in the land of Kalevala.

 

To preserve the briefness of this synopsis, here are links to information about Year In Hereafter that you might find interesting, but are way too plentiful to include here:
​
"The Cast" segment of all the characters that have appeared in the comic so far, a wider "About" section, and an "Archive" where all the comic pages can be accessed.

 

  • Shipping: 43% The books are quite sizable and heavy, hence the pricing
  • Printing: 31 % Expenses to get the books printed
  • Packaging: 11% So the books stay safe during their travels
  • Wiggle room: 10% Just in case anything unexpected comes up
  • Fees: 5% A standard fee for Indiegogo
    * The budgeting has been built around printing, packaging and shipping a minimum of 150 units


The main event!
The book, Year In Hereafter Volume I

Year In Hereafter's first 4 chapters + extra chapter in print.
 - 244 pages of content
- Full color
- Paperback

An E-book package 
Exact same content as the physical book, in two different formats:
- Single page format. Great for mobile devices.
- Spread format. Excellent for desktop reading.

Inks and Acrylics

- A traditional A5 artwork of the Year In Hereafter cast,
- Or for an added 20€,  a completely custom A5
traditional artwork tailored to your wishes!


And finally, Supporter Credit!

Your name will be included in the Thank You section of the book!
This is optional, you can opt to stay anonymous if you wish.

I will contact you on the name you'd like in the book, whether you want it to be a real name or an online nickname.

 

 

 

  1. The main challenge of this project is to get it succesfully funded.
     
  2. When it comes to the book print and other products, I am more than confident in being able to get them done in a timely manner and in quality I myself would be happy with. The artwork for the comic has been long finished, so I just need to get it to print.
     
  3. For Printing I intend to use the services and expertise of Comic Printing UK. They have been very happy to give me the insight I've needed to tally up the upcoming expenses and needs, and I've had previous experience working with them. Much appreciated!
     
  4. Then of course, there is Shipping. Not as much a challenge as a time consuming process, but it is arguably the most expensive part of the funding.

I'm a 25 year old artist in Finland, who goes by the name of Mikael H.
Formerly Karoliina H, the display name was changed in 2017.
For the curious, the character in the comic isn't a self-insert.
During 2017 I have had certain decisions made regarding my personal life, and I've adapted the name "Mikael" as an artist alias.



I studied cinema and video games, and the latter was where I hoped my career would head at. However, one summer I jokingly tried to experiment practicing my drawing in the form of comics, and I've not strayed since.

I've been part of 5 crowfunded comic projects in the near past, helping or fully responsible of the art department and supplying campaigns with necessary conceptuals and graphics. It has helped me figure out how this stuff works.

Year In Hereafter started updating July 2015, and the website has made over 300 page updates so far. Finishing Volume II isn't too far off and I'm planning to have the second crowfunded later in 2019, should this first volume be succesful.


The comic has been printed in 40~ page issues before, self-fundedly. 
Quickly I noticed that the short issue format does not suit this comic and I decided to shift to bigger volumes.

Just helping to get the word out is worth its weight in gold.

I wouldn't have gotten to this point if it wasn't for the people who have shared and selflessly helped raise awareness of what I do for the past 3 years, your voice is incredibly helpful to so many people.

 

Comic Examples

Various conceptual artwork from Year In Hereafter

The Harmonsuo are a varying lot of misfits who rather keep to themselves in their farm, strictly prohibiting anyone trespassing their swamp for odd reasons. Spirits. Monsters. Plain old odd stuff. Mikael hears quite the explanations. 
Mikael's two month long internship at the farm turns into an unwanted adventure in a foreign land of old-fashioned folk, and monsters also, in the land of Kalevala.
 

To preserve the briefness of this synopsis, here are links to information about Year In Hereafter that you might find interesting, but are way too plentiful to include here:​"The Cast" segment of all the characters that have appeared in the comic so far, a wider "About" section, and an "Archive" where all the comic pages can be accessed.
 







Shipping: 43% The books are quite sizable and heavy, hence the pricing


Printing: 31 % Expenses to get the books printed


Packaging: 11% So the books stay safe during their travels


Wiggle room: 10% Just in case anything unexpected comes up


Fees: 5% A standard fee for Indiegogo* The budgeting has been built around printing, packaging and shipping a minimum of 150 units





The main event!The book, Year In Hereafter Volume I
Year In Hereafter's first 4 chapters + extra chapter in print. - 244 pages of content- Full color- Paperback
An E-book package Exact same content as the physical book, in two different formats:- Single page format. Great for mobile devices.- Spread format. Excellent for desktop reading.
Inks and Acrylics
- A traditional A5 artwork of the Year In Hereafter cast,- Or for an added 20€,  a completely custom A5traditional artwork tailored to your wishes!
And finally, Supporter Credit!
Your name will be included in the Thank You section of the book!This is optional, you can opt to stay anonymous if you wish.
I will contact you on the name you'd like in the book, whether you want it to be a real name or an online nickname.
 

 


 


The main challenge of this project is to get it succesfully funded. 

When it comes to the book print and other products, I am more than confident in being able to get them done in a timely manner and in quality I myself would be happy with. The artwork for the comic has been long finished, so I just need to get it to print. 

For Printing I intend to use the services and expertise of Comic Printing UK. They have been very happy to give me the insight I've needed to tally up the upcoming expenses and needs, and I've had previous experience working with them. Much appreciated! 

Then of course, there is Shipping. Not as much a challenge as a time consuming process, but it is arguably the most expensive part of the funding.



I'm a 25 year old artist in Finland, who goes by the name of Mikael H.Formerly Karoliina H, the display name was changed in 2017.For the curious, the character in the comic isn't a self-insert.During 2017 I have had certain decisions made regarding my personal life, and I've adapted the name "Mikael" as an artist alias.

I studied cinema and video games, and the latter was where I hoped my career would head at. However, one summer I jokingly tried to experiment practicing my drawing in the form of comics, and I've not strayed since.I've been part of 5 crowfunded comic projects in the near past, helping or fully responsible of the art department and supplying campaigns with necessary conceptuals and graphics. It has helped me figure out how this stuff works.Year In Hereafter started updating July 2015, and the website has made over 300 page updates so far. Finishing Volume II isn't too far off and I'm planning to have the second crowfunded later in 2019, should this first volume be succesful.
The comic has been printed in 40~ page issues before, self-fundedly. Quickly I noticed that the short issue format does not suit this comic and I decided to shift to bigger volumes.



Just helping to get the word out is worth its weight in gold.
I wouldn't have gotten to this point if it wasn't for the people who have shared and selflessly helped raise awareness of what I do for the past 3 years, your voice is incredibly helpful to so many people.

 
Comic Examples

Various conceptual artwork from Year In Hereafter

story:
Story so far!

I've worked in tech and software for over 20 years, and have myself founded companies. I've been involved with silicon valley and other hubs - and frankly, I have been less than impressed.

We want to tell the story around the political and economic structures that have been wrongly erected

We want to make you laugh :)

We want to hear you, and reflect the reality on the ground - in a way that the news at large simply can't

Special Issues!

We want to create 12 issues:

for just $100 each (1200 total NZD) . Of course that doesn't cover our costs, and of course we hope for much much more - but this is about the message

This is an only chance to get a signed copy or the elusive "Issue 1"

If you've worked for or with me - would yoiu want to miss out? It could be worth ... well, lots!

What'll you do with the loot?

By contributing you will be supporting my small business, where I employ a bunch of awesome people in Auckland.

We are unlikely to make a profit from this

But - say we did - we would invest it right back into the platform we are building

Simply said, any funds will help us continue to employ our team here in Auckland - our team are all located here and come from NZ, Argentina, South Korea, Fiji and Belarus. Pretty cool, eh?! :)

Risks & Challenges

We've minimised the risks. If Phil suddenly dies ... that would be a major challenge!

Penniless?

We still love you.

If you want to help but don't have cash - please contact us on info@zyteapp.com - you can still be a very big help to us. It's not all about the money :)

story:
Short Summary

Humor, horror, sci fi, fantasy, and fun... These are the things my art is about, an these are the things I'm hoping, with your help, to bring to you and the world in my art/comic book "Gumdrops, Lollipops, and other Scary Things", which will include full size art pages as well as illustrated stories, all by yours truly

What We Need & What You Get

Since the plan is to self publish this book, I'm needing the capital to take the work to printer.  Helping with this gets you into MY world of weird and wonderful art, including stickers and illustrated color prints that are just for this project, including original art and orginal paintings for those willing and able to support at higher levels

The Impact

lets get my work out to the world,,, >BANG!< THE WORLD

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, I know that,,, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

AND use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Janibek and I am a mangaka, a comic author & artist for those not familiar with the concept. I have been into arts ever since I came to this world. The pencil has always been in my hand throughout my path from childhood to being a man. I have mostly done arts for myself or for orders by my friends and relatives, but never on a big scale, never gone worldwide. Until now

I was always inspired by the world’s greatest directors and screenwriters, artists and visual artists. Their work seemed stellar, so high on the Olympus that it felt treacherous to try to compete with them, until I realized that I would honor them by doing something of my own. Something to leave my name in history along with other legends

I am just getting started and I strongly believe I will not disappoint. I would be thrilled to share my work with others and hope  we can let this project go along. Together! Without your support and following I am just another artist, but together even the sky is not the limit!

Soul is a Manga format, so please keep in mind to read the panels in the correct order

What We Need & What You Get

An intriguing and exciting content is on the way, there is a lot I want to tell with this story, but I need your help to keep up the work! Soul opens doors to a deep and complex universe with multiple charaters who will see profound development, the plot is twisted and suspenseful. Such an endeavor is something that cannot rely solely on my persistence and enthusiasm. If you have an opportunity to help, this project will go on!

Perks will be available along the way, just a little extra for a unique contribution from you guys!

The funds will go into printing of chapter 1 'A Dance of Death-Chains' for unique perks and the creation of further chapters which will be at least 90 (long lasting Manga format) in authentic hand-drawn form

The Impact

Apart from being a very interesting Sci-Fi story Soul touches upon important issues of the world, some might not be on the surface, but will be seen between the lines. I am not perfect and devoid of subjectivity but I sincerely hope I can bring excitement to my readers

Risks & Challenges

Soul is my first self-published work and it is quite challenging in terms of funding and time, so there might be be obstacles along the way. But I am sure that all backers will not be dissapointed with the result

Current status

Soul Chapter 1 'A Dance of Death-Chains' is 100% finished in terms of drawing and lettering, but has not been printed into hard copies yet. The plan is to proceed with printing upon raising funds along with continuing the works on the next chapters

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate any contribution even non financial, spread the word out if you like it, make some noise on the internet about this campaign, anything helps. Use Indiegogo share tools to make it easier

Have a look into the FAQ for possible answers to questions you might have

All rights reserved by Janibek Nyssambekov

story:
INTRODUCING THE "SOME PEOPLE" (EVERY)BODY EXHIBITION and NATIONAL ENGAGEMENT PROJECT

To positively contribute to the healthcare policy debate and dialogue, I've united a group of top international essayists, journalists, photojournalists, artists, lawyers, medical students and medical brain trust to examine how we view the human body and the business systems that knowingly perpetuate harm. This is not a project about illness. The work reveals universal vulnerability and fragility through personal essays, photography and original new works of art.

The intention of the producer and collective of exceptionally talented contributors is to raise questions about Best Practice, social responsibility, values and fiscal priorities vis-à-vis the never ending healthcare policy debate in the United States.

This first round of fundraising will be allocated to renting the gallery space for our Chicago opening in October 2019 at Bridgeport Art Center and continuing to finance curation, website design and production of the exhibition.

The fundraising goal is $5,000 by April 12th, 2019.

The healthcare debate has never been louder or more forceful in the United States as business owners grapple with costs, individuals struggle for continuity of high quality healthcare and shareholders begin to question the source of their profits. Nurses, physicians, medical students and healthcare workers are publicly questioning the fiscal priorities and social values of the United States. The level of active organized engagement and mobilization for universal healthcare is unprecedented. 

People are asking: Is healthcare a moral, ethical, social, cultural and economic value to which the United States should assign fiscal priority?

We, as a community of engaged colleagues and professionals, believe the role of the artist/journalist/physician/essayist is to raise complex questions with art, images and the written word. We are creating a welcoming digital forum on Instagram—and will soon create the live experience—that invites people to truly see Every Body.

ABOUT THE PRODUCER/ CURATOR  For 25 years, Kimberly J. Soenen has worked for major news, policy and media arts organizations as a producer, writer, business development director and communications strategist. Known for her language fluency across private, nonprofit and public sector her expertise and vision have increased revenue and reach for journalism and media organizations, impacted policy and influenced legislation. Soenen's track record of high level business development, visual communications expertise and creative direction include noteworthy high profile successes at Pulitzer, Oscar, Emmy, World Press and Peabody Award winning companies including Harper's Magazine, National Public Radio, Kartemquin Films, Talking Eyes Media, Chicago Tribune and VII Photo Agency. Soenen is a sought after educator, writer and consultant. She teaches ethics in journalism, media literacy and visual communication. She has been published across policy, thought leadership, culture and news magazines. She resides in her hometown of Chicago.

View the Digital Exhibition on Instagram at @SomePeopleEveryBody https://www.instagram.com/somepeopleeverybody/

Live Exhibition

Opening Night: Friday, October 18th, 2019 

Bridgeport Art Center 

Third Floor Gallery

1200 West 35th Street

Chicago

6:30-10pm

Exhibition runs October 18-November 22, 2019.

story:
Hvad vil vi?

Karavane 908 er et kreativt fællesskab med en bred vifte af kompetencer indenfor kunst, kultur, events, musik, byggeri, planter og madlavning. 

Vi drømmer om at skabe et kreativt og inkluderende værkstedsfællesskab. Værkstedet skal være base for kreation af kunst og installationer i genbrugsmaterialer, og kulturevents, hvor gæster inviteres indenfor i karavanens unikke univers. 

Vi har fundet et skønt hjørne i Sydhavn og har overtaget 4 skibscontainere og en gammel garage, som vi ønsker at omdanne til kreative værksteder indenfor træ, metal, tegning, musik og madlavning. 

Vi er allerede i fuld gang med at omdanne en del af grunden til en frodig grøn byhave, hvor vi på sigt ønsker at afholde workshops inden for f.eks. genbrug og beplantning, og arrangementer som markedsdage, folkekøkken og sauna wellness.

Vi har brug for din hjælp! 

Vi er allerede kommet langt, men vi står overfor en række økonomiske og praktiske udfordringer som DU kan hjælpe med. 

På grund af verdens sære tilstand, der har gjort det stort set umuligt at afholde Karavane events i 2020,  står vi en meget kritisk økonomisk situation hvor vi ikke overlever ind i det nye år uden økonomisk hjælp til at betale leje af vores grund i Sydhavn! Derudover skal vi have indlagt el på grunden, så vi har lys og strøm til at komme videre med værkstedet og undgår miljøbelastende generatordrift. Vi skal istandsætte og isolere den gamle garage så vi kan indrette værksteder og opholdsrum. Vi skal på sigt lave et containerkøkken, så vi kan holde folkekøkken og lave produkter til vores events. Og til foråret skal vi videre med byhaven så der er plads til endnu flere planter, træer og dejlige gæster.

Opgaverne er samlet i følgende delmål, der skal til for at få  drømmen gjort til virkelighed. Vi håber via denne crowdfunding at kunne realisere de første to delmål, hvilket kræver en samlet sum på 60.000:

Delmål 1 = 40.000 til basale udgifter og EL. Vi har først og fremmest brug for at indsamle 40.000 til at dække basale udgifter til værkstedet og til at indlægge el, da strøm er helt essentielt for et funktionelt værkstedsfællesskab med elværktøj, lys, køkkenredskaber, musikproduktion mv.. 

Delmål 2 = Renovation af garage. De næste 20.000 går til byggematerialer til at renovere den gamle garagebygning, så vi kan indrette opholdsrum og metal- og træværksted. Renovering omfatter isolering af vægge, lapning af tag, en ny port så vi kan holde vores redskaber sikre, samt generel istandsættelse.

Delmål 3 = Køkkencontainer. Indsamler vi 20.000 mere, kan vi gå i gang med at indrette køkken så vi kan producere mad og drikke til events, og invitere venner, naboer og andet godtfolk til at spise med os i haven! 

Delmål 4 = værksteder og byhave. Hvis vi er så heldige at have penge til overs, så vil alt gå til at indrette værksteder, lave byhave med drivhus og planter og måske endda en sauna! 

Alle bidrag hjælper, uanset størrelsen, og vi garanterer masser karavane herligheder fremover til gengæld. 

Hvad får DU ud af at støtte os?

Når værkstedet står færdigt kan vi fortsætte med, at bidrage til en skør og alternativ kultur med kunst, musik, fede oplevelsesdesigns, genbrugsinstallationer og hjemmelavet mad og drikke. Vi vil også kunne lave en række mindre events og inspirerende workshops i Sydhavn, hvor alle kan være med.

Jeres bidrag bliver selvfølgelig også direkte belønnet med unikke karavane souvenirs, som T-shirts, plakater eller direkte billet til nye Karavane oplevelser. I kan SELVFØLGELIG  se frem til et brag af en støttefest, en ægte Karavane rumrejse tur/retur (Take off: så snart verden er klar til større forsamlinger igen!) Og for en ekstra gavmild donation kan du få billet til en intim oplevelse for få personer til et helt specielt karavane arrangement med kræsen for alle sanser, en flerretters menu, musik, lys og som altid med masser af overraskelser!

Gaverne kan afhentes i værkstedet i Sydhavn i løbet af foråret, datoer meldes ud eller kan aftales, og inkluderer naturligvis en rundvisning i værkstedet! Alternativt kan gaven afhentes til vores støttefest. Hvis din gave skal sendes må der forventes en ekstra-pris på mellem 50-100 kr.. Billetter til events er ikke personlige, og kan derfor gives i gave, til en man holder af.

Hvad kan du ellers gøre?

Hvis du ikke har mønter til overs kan du sagtens hjælpe alligevel! Du kan hjælpe med at sprede vores budskab og crowdfunding kampagne. Og så kan du ALTID møde op til gratis karavanefitness i værkstedet i Sydhavn, hvor der er masser at lave. Vi har mange praktiske gøremål foran os, og hjælpende hænder er guld værd. 

Vi har desuden åbent for nye medlemmer! Kontakt os endelig på mail: karavane908@gmail.com, hvis du er interesseret i at blive en fast del af Karavanen.
