Vi vil også kunne lave en række mindre events og inspirerende workshops i Sydhavn, hvor alle kan være med.Jeres bidrag bliver selvfølgelig også direkte belønnet med unikke karavane souvenirs, som T-shirts, plakater eller direkte billet til nye Karavane oplevelser. I kan SELVFØLGELIG  se frem til et brag af en støttefest, en ægte Karavane rumrejse tur/retur (Take off: så snart verden er klar til større forsamlinger igen!) Og for en ekstra gavmild donation kan du få billet til en intim oplevelse for få personer til et helt specielt karavane arrangement med kræsen for alle sanser, en flerretters menu, musik, lys og som altid med masser af overraskelser!Gaverne kan afhentes i værkstedet i Sydhavn i løbet af foråret, datoer meldes ud eller kan aftales, og inkluderer naturligvis en rundvisning i værkstedet! Alternativt kan gaven afhentes til vores støttefest. Hvis din gave skal sendes må der forventes en ekstra-pris på mellem 50-100 kr.. Billetter til events er ikke personlige, og kan derfor gives i gave, til en man holder af.Hvad kan du ellers gøre?Hvis du ikke har mønter til overs kan du sagtens hjælpe alligevel! Du kan hjælpe med at sprede vores budskab og crowdfunding kampagne. Og så kan du ALTID møde op til gratis karavanefitness i værkstedet i Sydhavn, hvor der er masser at lave. Vi har mange praktiske gøremål foran os, og hjælpende hænder er guld værd. Vi har desuden åbent for nye medlemmer! Kontakt os endelig på mail: karavane908@gmail.com, hvis du er interesseret i at blive en fast del af Karavanen.

story:
In English at the end of Spanish text. If you want to see the perks, slide the video to left or go to the perks section at the end of the text.

Necesitamos financiación. Te invitamos a ser mecenas.

(Si quieres ver las recompensas, desplaza el video hacia la izquierda o ve a la sección de recompensas al final del texto en Español).

Gracias por interesarte por SIANOJA, el encuentro internacional de artistas en Noja, que desde 2001, se celebra anualmente en Cantabria, España. En 21 años que llevamos gestionando y celebrando el simposio, es la primera vez que realizamos un crowdfunding para que formes parte de la financiación del mismo.

Te ofrecemos la posibilidad de ser mecenas, lo cual es maravilloso. Estás poniendo la piedra de una genial escultura, el lienzo de un óleo asombroso.

Esta edición se celebrará del 13 al 20 de septiembre de 2021 (fecha actualizada) en la actual sede del simposio: El Hotel Torre Cristina.

  • Siete artistas invitados: Ramón Cerezo (España), Monika Grygier (Polonia), Evelyn Hellenschmidt (Alemania),  Lika Shkhvatsabaia (Georgia), Tamara García (España), Pedro Calderón (España), Francisco Díaz (España), 
     

 

  • Crítico de Arte invitada: Wendy Navarro

 

¿Qué es SIANOJA?

Desde el 2001, SIANOJA es un simposio que reúne anualmente a artistas plásticos contemporáneos, nacionales e internacionales, en un espacio de convivencia y creación durante diez días (por el actual estado de alarma lo hemos reducido a una semana). Los invitados disfrutan de alojamiento a pensión completa, así como de los materiales necesarios para la creación. A modo de agradecimiento, estos se comprometen a crear y donar al menos una obra de arte que pasa a formar parte de la colección gestionada por la Asociación Amigos de SIANOJA.

 

Un poco de historia...

La historia de este simposio es experiencial y como tal, no está exenta de cambios: 

En 2017 la nueva corporación del Ayuntamiento de Noja retiró la colaboración con SIANOJA, siendo este nuestro principal patrocinador. Dado el excelente rendimiento del simposio durante los diecisiete años de contrato, el Ayuntamiento recibió una colección de cuatrocientas treinta obras de arte valoradas en más de un millón de euros. Resultando un alto valor en el retorno de inversión.

Desde entonces, la financiación de esta actividad que genera un notable capital cultural para todos, corre a cuenta de la Asociación Amigos de SIANOJA, sin olvidar las colaboraciones que recibimos por parte del sector privado: Estelacaeli, Ámbito Cultural El Corte Inglés, Hotel Torre Cristina (actual sede del simposio), Mara Pardo Estudio...

Por SIANOJA han pasado más de doscientos cincuenta artistas, noveles y de reconocida trayectoria, procedentes de más de cuarenta y cuatro países: España, Inglaterra, China, EE. UU., Suiza, México, Alemania, Japón, Brasil… creando obras de arte que enriquecen el valor patrimonial no solo de la región, sino de toda la humanidad, sumando un total de quinientas cuarenta y cinco obras de arte creadas y donadas hasta la anterior edición SIANOJA 2020.

Queremos continuar con un evento cultural tan necesario para el avance y desarrollo de las artes, y para ello necesitamos tu apoyo. Cualquier contribución es bienvenida y nos ayudará a continuar y hacer crecer este singular proyecto.

¿Por qué SIANOJA?

Los artistas somos catalizadores de nuestro tiempo y SIANOJA más allá de ser un encuentro internacional de artistas, (que puede sonar muy bohemio y hasta “cool”) es un encuentro entre artistas procedentes de los lugares más dispares del planeta, personas con una particular cosmovisión de la vida devenida de la cultura de la que proceden. SIANOJA es un totum revolutum de intercambio cultural, dónde los creadores dialogan, debaten e intercambian perspectivas, con o sin punto de fuga, impregnándose de nuevas percepciones que se manifiestan en el siguiente dialogo; el que mantienen con su obra durante la creación.

Las primeras piezas de este mágico proceso se dan lugar en SIANOJA. Enriquecen el patrimonio cultural, no solo de Cantabria, si no de la humanidad, gracias a la experiencia vital que fruto de este intercambio, los artistas, como embajadores de su tierra, portan a sus hogares, a sus países.

Desde este nuevo lenguaje nacen bifurcaciones en las expresiones artístico culturales. bifurcaciones que aportan nuevos planos para un prisma desde el que, para comprenderlo y avanzar, catalizamos nuestro tiempo.

 

La recaudación

El crowfunding lo hemos seccionado en cuatro hitos:

Hito I: 9 000 €

Los fondos recaudados se utilizarán para sufragar los costes de puesta en escena: materiales para la producción y reproducción de las obras de arte, el caché, el hospedaje (alojamiento a pensión completa más dietas extras) de los artistas y personalidades implicadas. 

Así como la elaboración y distribución de las recompensas para ustedes, los micro–mecenas, sin los cuales, esto no sería posible.

Hito II: 12 000 €

Actualización y mejora del portal web www.sianoja.es.com para convertirlo en un museo público y virtual que alojará videografía, imágenes e información, tanto de los artistas como de las obras de arte creadas durante el transcurso de loa veintiún años de vida de SIANOJA.

El portal contará con un time-line de noticias para informar de actividades relacionadas con SIANOJA.

Hito III: 22 000 €

Porque por amor al arte pueden hacerse muchas cosas, pero no todas. Superado el hito anterior, nos ayudas a costear los gastos de dirección, gestión y comunicación del simposio: Gestorías; Gráfica publicitaria; Marketing: online y offline; Gastos derivados como dietas y transporte o actividades secundarias; etc.. Es mucho trabajo y mucha gente implicada.

Hito IV: +22 000 €

Estos fondos pasarán a formar parte de las arcas de la Asociación Amigos de SIANOJA, y serán destinados a la continuación y buen funcionamiento de este simposio internacional en ediciones futuras. Te mantendremos al tanto de todas ellas.

Cuando los fondos recaudados superen la cantidad de financiación solicitada para un hito, estos irán destinados al hito siguiente.

Todos los fondos recaudados serán utilizados exclusivamente para el desarrollo y realización de SIANOJA.

 

Recompensas

Los Factory (Warhol):

  • Eterna Gratitud en:
    • Redes sociales: (facebook, twitter, instagram y youtube).
    • Sección destinada en nuestra web.
    • En el catálogo SIANOJA 2021
       


Los Lázaro:

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Postal-Art: 
    • A elegir entre seis postales diferentes obra de artistas participantes en SIANOJA: Emilia Trueba, Manolo Belzunce, Carmen Van Den Eynde, Manolo Sáenz Messía y Joaquín Martínez Cano.
    • Firmada y dedicada por el artista y director de SIANOJA: Manolo Sáenz-Messia (Opcional)

Los North:

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Postal-Art.
  • Camiseta: ¡Hazte con todas!  son de algodón 153g/m2 ilustradas con un dibujo obra del artista Manuel Pereda. 
    • Retrato acorde al mecenazgo en el que participes, más logotipo de SIANOJA y año.
    • Tallas disponibles: S, M, L y XL
    • Colores: blanco, negro azul marino, y gris.
    • Disponible para elegir también los retratos: Los Factory (Warhol) y Los Lázaro.

  • Asociado durante 1 año:

Los Thyssen:

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Postal-Art.
  • Camiseta.
  • Asociado durante 1 año.
  • Taza de desayuno: con el logotipo universal de SIANOJA
    • Material: cerámica.
    • Capacidad: 33cl/11oz.
    • Color: blanco.

Los Rothschild

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Postal-Art.
  • Camiseta.
  • Asociado durante 1 año.
  • Taza de desayuno.
  • Libro catálogo en formato físico: A elegir entre los años:
    • 2017: Texto: Artistas:
    • 2018: Texto: Artistas:
    • 2019: Texto: Artistas:

Los Stein

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Asociado durante 1 año.
  • Libro catálogo.
  • Delantal de Artista con el logo de SIANOJA bordado
  • Digigraphie firmada y numerada 50/u. del artista Manolo Sáenz-Messía.
    • Dimensiones:
    • Papel:


Los Guggenheim

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Asociado durante 1 año.
  • Libro catálogo.
  • Delantal de Artista con el logo de SIANOJA bordado (todo un clásico del simposio).
  • Una obra de arte original. Una pieza única. Reproducción de alta calidad seriadas y autenticadas a 15/u. de obras pertenecientes a la colección SIANOJA a elegir entre
    • Cuatro artistas: Calo Carratalá, María Bejarano, Constanza López Schlichting, Guido Velasco.
    • Dimensiones: variables aprox. 30x50 cm

Los Medici

  • Eterna Gratitud.
  • Asociado durante 1 año.
  • Libro catálogo.
  • Delantal de Artista con el logo de SIANOJA bordado.
  • Una obra de arte original a elegir entre diversos artistas. Para más información contactar con nosotros a través de gestionsianoja@gmail.com 

 

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 

We need funding. We invite you to become a patron.

Thank you for your interest in SIANOJA, the international meeting of artists in Noja, which since 2001, is held annually in Cantabria, Spain. In 21 years that we have been managing and celebrating the symposium, this is the first time that we make a crowfunding for you to be part of its financing.

We offer you the possibility of being a patron, which is wonderful. You are laying the stone of a brilliant sculpture, the canvas of an amazing oil painting.

This edition will be held from June 07 to 14, 2021 at the current venue of the symposium: The Torre Cristina Hotel.

  • The seven artists: Ramón Cerezo (España), Monika Grygier (Polonia), Evelyn Hellenschmidt (Alemania),  Lika Shkhvatsabaia (Georgia), Tamara García (España), Pedro Calderón (España), Francisco Díaz (España),

 

 

 

  • Guest Art critic: Wendy Navarro

 

What is SIANOJA?

Since 2001, SIANOJA is a symposium that annually brings together national and international contemporary visual artists in a space of coexistence and creation for ten days (due to the current state of alarm we have reduced it to one week). Guests are provided with full board accommodation, as well as the necessary materials for creation. As a thank you, they commit to create and donate at least one work of art that becomes part of the collection managed by the Friends of SIANOJA Association.

 

A bit of history...

The history of this symposium is experiential and as such, it is not without change: 

In 2017 the new corporation of the Noja City Council withdrew the collaboration with SIANOJA, being this our main sponsor. Given the excellent performance of the symposium during the seventeen years of contract, the City Council received a collection of four hundred and thirty works of art valued at more than one million euros. Resulting in a high return on investment.

Since then, the financing of this activity, which generates a remarkable cultural capital for all, is the responsibility of the Friends of SIANOJA Association, without forgetting the collaborations that we receive from the private sector: Estelacaeli, Ámbito Cultural El Corte Inglés, Hotel Torre Cristina (current venue of the symposium), Mara Pardo Estudio...

More than two hundred and fifty artists have passed through SIANOJA, both new and renowned, from more than forty-four countries: Spain, England, China, USA, Switzerland, Mexico, Germany, Japan, Brazil... creating works of art that enrich the heritage value not only of the region, but of all humanity, adding up to a total of five hundred and forty-five works of art created and donated until the previous edition SIANOJA 2020.

We want to continue with a cultural event so necessary for the advancement and development of the arts, and for this we need your support. Any contribution is welcome and will help us to continue and grow this unique project.

Why SIANOJA?

Artists are catalysts of our time and SIANOJA, beyond being an international meeting of artists, (which may sound very bohemian and even "cool") is a meeting between artists from the most disparate places on the planet, people with a particular worldview of life derived from the culture they come from. SIANOJA is a totum revolutum of cultural exchange, where creators dialogue, debate and exchange perspectives, with or without a vanishing point, impregnating themselves with new perceptions that are manifested in the following dialogue; the one they maintain with their work during the creation.

The first pieces of this magical process take place in SIANOJA. They enrich the cultural heritage, not only of Cantabria, but also of humanity, thanks to the vital experience that, as a result of this exchange, the artists, as ambassadors of their land, take back home to their countries.

From this new language, bifurcations are born in the artistic and cultural expressions, bifurcations that contribute new planes for a prism from which, to understand it and to advance, we catalyze our time.

 

The fundraising

We have divided the crowfunding into four milestones:


Milestone I: 9 000 €.

The funds raised will be used to cover the costs of staging: materials for the production and reproduction of the works of art, the cache, accommodation (full board accommodation plus extra per diem) of the artists and personalities involved. 

As well as the elaboration and distribution of the rewards for you, the micro-members, without whom this would not be possible.

Milestone II: 12 000 €.

Updating and improvement of the web portal www.sianoja.es.com to turn it into a public and virtual museum that will house videography, images and information, both of the artists and of the works of art created during the course of the twenty-one years of SIANOJA's life.

The portal will have a news time-line to report on activities related to SIANOJA.

Milestone III: 22 000 €.

Because for the love of art many things can be done, but not all. Having passed the previous milestone, you help us to cover the costs of the direction, management and communication of the symposium: Management; Advertising graphics; Marketing: online and offline; Expenses derived as per diems and transportation or secondary activities; etc.. It is a lot of work and a lot of people involved.

Milestone IV: +22 000 €.

These funds will become part of the coffers of the Friends of SIANOJA Association, and will be destined to the continuation and proper functioning of this international symposium in future editions. We will keep you updated on all of them.

When the funds raised exceed the amount of funding requested for a milestone, they will go to the next milestone.

All funds raised will be used exclusively for the development and realization of SIANOJA.

 

Perks

Los Factory (Warhol):

  • Eternal Gratitude on:
    • Social Networks: (facebook, twitter, instagram and youtube).
    • Section on our website.
    • In the SIANOJA 2021 catalog
       


Los Lázaro:

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Postcard-Art: A choice of six different postcards by artists participating in SIANOJA: Emilia Trueba, Manolo Belzunce, Carmen Van Den Eynde, Manolo Sáenz Messía y Joaquín Martínez Cano.
  • Signed and dedicated by the artist and director of SIANOJA: Manolo Sáenz-Messia (Optional)

Los North:

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Postcard-Art.
  • T-shirt with a "Soy Mecenas" & SIANOJA logotype. 153g/m2 cotton. and year 2021.
    • Available sizes: S, M, L and XL.
    • Colors: white, and gray.
    • Associated for 1 year: You are the first to know the SIANOJA's news

Los Thyssen:

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Postcard-Art.
  • T-shirt.
  • Associate for 1 year.
  • Breakfast mug: with the universal SIANOJA logo.
    • Material: ceramic.
    • Capacity: 33cl/11oz.
    • Color: white.

Los Rothschild

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Postcard-Art.
  • T-shirt.
  • Associate for 1 year.
  • Breakfast mug.
  • Catalog book in physical format: To choose between the years:
    • 2017: Text: Artists:
    • 2018: Text: Artists:
    • 2019: Text: Artists:

Los Stein

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Associate for 1 year.
  • Catalog book.
  • Artist's apron with SIANOJA logo embroidered.
  • Digigraphie signed and numbered 50/u. by the artist Manolo Sáenz-Messía.
    • Dimensions:
    • Paper:


Los Guggenheim

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Associated for 1 year.
  • Catalog book.
  • Artist's apron with SIANOJA logo embroidered (a classic of the symposium).
  • An original work of art. A unique piece. High quality reproduction serialized and authenticated at 15/u. of works belonging to the SIANOJA collection to choose between
    • Four artists: Calo Carratalá, María Bejarano, Constanza López Schlichting, Guido Velasco.
    • Dimensions: variable approx. 30x50 cm

Los Medici

  • Eternal Gratitude.
  • Associated for 1 year.
  • Catalog book.
  • Artist's apron with SIANOJA logo embroidered.
  • An original work of art to choose from a variety of artists. For more information please contact us at gestionsianoja@gmail.com

Una obra de arte original. Una pieza única. Reproducción de alta calidad seriadas y autenticadas a 15/u. de obras pertenecientes a la colección SIANOJA a elegir entre

Cuatro artistas: Calo Carratalá, María Bejarano, Constanza López Schlichting, Guido Velasco.

Los Medici
Eterna Gratitud.
Asociado durante 1 año.
Libro catálogo.
Delantal de Artista con el logo de SIANOJA bordado.

Una obra de arte original a elegir entre diversos artistas. Para más información contactar con nosotros a través de gestionsianoja@gmail.com 
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- We need funding. We invite you to become a patron.Thank you for your interest in SIANOJA, the international meeting of artists in Noja, which since 2001, is held annually in Cantabria, Spain. In 21 years that we have been managing and celebrating the symposium, this is the first time that we make a crowfunding for you to be part of its financing.We offer you the possibility of being a patron, which is wonderful. You are laying the stone of a brilliant sculpture, the canvas of an amazing oil painting.This edition will be held from June 07 to 14, 2021 at the current venue of the symposium: The Torre Cristina Hotel.The seven artists: Ramón Cerezo (España), Monika Grygier (Polonia), Evelyn Hellenschmidt (Alemania),  Lika Shkhvatsabaia (Georgia), Tamara García (España), Pedro Calderón (España), Francisco Díaz (España),   Guest Art critic: Wendy Navarro What is SIANOJA?Since 2001, SIANOJA is a symposium that annually brings together national and international contemporary visual artists in a space of coexistence and creation for ten days (due to the current state of alarm we have reduced it to one week). Guests are provided with full board accommodation, as well as the necessary materials for creation. As a thank you, they commit to create and donate at least one work of art that becomes part of the collection managed by the Friends of SIANOJA Association. A bit of history...The history of this symposium is experiential and as such, it is not without change: In 2017 the new corporation of the Noja City Council withdrew the collaboration with SIANOJA, being this our main sponsor. Given the excellent performance of the symposium during the seventeen years of contract, the City Council received a collection of four hundred and thirty works of art valued at more than one million euros. Resulting in a high return on investment.Since then, the financing of this activity, which generates a remarkable cultural capital for all, is the responsibility of the Friends of SIANOJA Association, without forgetting the collaborations that we receive from the private sector: Estelacaeli, Ámbito Cultural El Corte Inglés, Hotel Torre Cristina (current venue of the symposium), Mara Pardo Estudio...More than two hundred and fifty artists have passed through SIANOJA, both new and renowned, from more than forty-four countries: Spain, England, China, USA, Switzerland, Mexico, Germany, Japan, Brazil... creating works of art that enrich the heritage value not only of the region, but of all humanity, adding up to a total of five hundred and forty-five works of art created and donated until the previous edition SIANOJA 2020.We want to continue with a cultural event so necessary for the advancement and development of the arts, and for this we need your support. Any contribution is welcome and will help us to continue and grow this unique project.Why SIANOJA?Artists are catalysts of our time and SIANOJA, beyond being an international meeting of artists, (which may sound very bohemian and even "cool") is a meeting between artists from the most disparate places on the planet, people with a particular worldview of life derived from the culture they come from. SIANOJA is a totum revolutum of cultural exchange, where creators dialogue, debate and exchange perspectives, with or without a vanishing point, impregnating themselves with new perceptions that are manifested in the following dialogue; the one they maintain with their work during the creation.The first pieces of this magical process take place in SIANOJA. They enrich the cultural heritage, not only of Cantabria, but also of humanity, thanks to the vital experience that, as a result of this exchange, the artists, as ambassadors of their land, take back home to their countries.From this new language, bifurcations are born in the artistic and cultural expressions, bifurcations that contribute new planes for a prism from which, to understand it and to advance, we catalyze our time. The fundraisingWe have divided the crowfunding into four milestones:Milestone I: 9 000 €.The funds raised will be used to cover the costs of staging: materials for the production and reproduction of the works of art, the cache, accommodation (full board accommodation plus extra per diem) of the artists and personalities involved. As well as the elaboration and distribution of the rewards for you, the micro-members, without whom this would not be possible.Milestone II: 12 000 €.Updating and improvement of the web portal www.sianoja.es.com to turn it into a public and virtual museum that will house videography, images and information, both of the artists and of the works of art created during the course of the twenty-one years of SIANOJA's life.The portal will have a news time-line to report on activities related to SIANOJA.Milestone III: 22 000 €.Because for the love of art many things can be done, but not all. Having passed the previous milestone, you help us to cover the costs of the direction, management and communication of the symposium: Management; Advertising graphics; Marketing: online and offline; Expenses derived as per diems and transportation or secondary activities; etc.. It is a lot of work and a lot of people involved.Milestone IV: +22 000 €.These funds will become part of the coffers of the Friends of SIANOJA Association, and will be destined to the continuation and proper functioning of this international symposium in future editions. We will keep you updated on all of them.When the funds raised exceed the amount of funding requested for a milestone, they will go to the next milestone.All funds raised will be used exclusively for the development and realization of SIANOJA. PerksLos Factory (Warhol):Eternal Gratitude on:
Social Networks: (facebook, twitter, instagram and youtube).

story:
What's It All About

[update edit -August, 2021]: Belatedly in this update, Namkabuan has sadly6 passed in April, but we were able to raise and donate more than $2,000 USD to him and his family in support before he left us. We are still raising money in support of legends and krus in the Library during this time of COVID. There have been some very generous recent donations.

100% of all donations are sent to the krus and legends in the Library as we cover all fees to make sure what you give gets to them.

[update edit -Jan, 2021]: This page, in addition to the COVID help below, is now also used for those who want to send support to Namkabuan who has recently been diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer. You can send money to him through this page, we will cover all transfer fees to make sure he gets everything you send. Just message us so we know the donation is for him:

Namkabuan, a legend of the Golden Age, getting care (above).

 

COVID Help

We all are struggling in some way, with some people facing tragedy, this is not that. But, if you find yourself in a stable situation and these men are among those that you care for, here is a way to help. The greatest fighters of Muay Thai, after retirement, often don't have financial stability. Many of the Legends we know and love live week-to-week, month-to-month, earning money in unstable circumstances and largely relying on their vast knowledge, skills and experience in Muay Thai by teaching, making appearances at important events, or various other means in the varied and large Muay Thai Community of Thailand. It can be unsure even in the best of times. Now that Thailand has shut down all fights, all public gatherings, all events, and gyms all around the country, many of these greats are without a means to support themselves during this difficult time.

If you'd like to see the Legends and Krus who we are supporting, take a look at the Muay Thai Library Table of Contents . This Library Project is supported by patrons and 10% of the net of all patron pledges is distributed every year to the Krus and Legends documented in the Library.

What Can Be Done

All these Legends and Krus are in the Muay Thai Library, a "Preserve the Legacy Project" to preserve the Muay Thai of Thailand and archive the Legends and Greats who carry that knowledge (over 94 hours documented, a full list below). We've always offered the option to send a donation as an additional "thank you" to any Kru in the Library, and now is a time when that gratitude is perhaps much more needed and appreciated.  So if you have been inspired or learned something from one of the Krus in the Muay Thai Library you can send a donation to someone who has impacted you or connected to you through the Library.

The Impact

The reason I started this site page is that I was taking donations through my Paypal, individually, and the response was so strong that it just needed to be centralized. So far, we've raised over $2000 USD, which I've directly sent to Legends and Krus of the Muay Thai Library. 

The people who have received this support from people they inspired, so far are: 

  • Yodkhunpon Sitraipum
  • Dieselnoi Chor Tanasukarn
  • Karuhat Sor Supawan
  • Sagat Petchyindee
  • Rambaa Somdet M16
  • Boonlai Sor Tanikul
  • Samson Isaan
  • Kru Noi Sityodtong
  • Luktum Winner Muaythai Gym
  • Langsuan Panyutapum
  • Thanadet Tor. Pran49
  • Yodwicha Kem Muaythai Gym
  • Kru Ali Phet-Kalim Muay Thai Gym
  • for a full list of every kru and legend in the Library so far see here

It's not just monetary support. These Legends and Krus have all received this financial support with immense gratitude, but also are very moved by being remembered, recognized, and valued by the global Muay Thai Community. There is a strong importance in Thai culture of being "taken care of," and in many circumstances these Legends and Krus don't experience that care. But by the donations they have absolutely felt this. It's quite profound.

*my email is svondoom@gmail.com use in the Subject Line "Kru Support". Shoot me a message and say: "Hey Sylvie, I just donated $50 (or whatever the amount) to help with Kru (whatever name). Any donations that are un-designated will be sent according to our impression of need, which is just taking a rough temperature of things. It's really best that you say who you would like to offer appreciation to.

A Buffer of Support During the Covid-19 Crisis

We're running the campaign just for the time that gyms and events are closed/cancelled for Public Health amidst the Covid-19 Crisis, to give cushion to the lives of these wonderful teachers.

 

 

Some of the Donations That Came Through My Instagram

My Instagram

story:
Our goal is to help young people discover their passions in life, connect, become empowered and to find their place in the world, and positively contribute to their communities.

This crowdfunding is to help launch an Art Facility for children and the youths in Aida Youth Center. To teach the craft of screen-printing for the young people to use for their own projects and encourage entrepreneurship. 

 

WHY PALESTINE?

HYPEPEACE has always been vocal about supporting human rights and this region has faced decades of injustice and political crisis.

For many people across the West Bank and Gaza, cultural opportunities are severely limited.

It’s a critical time to support Palestinian youths and more than ever they need our support not just in aid but also help build foundations for their future.

Help us provide creative outlets for children and young adults to use creativity as self-expression, gain skills and bring out their natural creative talent to pursue their own goals and dreams.

HYPEPEACE 'In Solidarity' 
 

ART AS THERAPY

Art and it's creative process relieves stress, encourages creative thinking, boosts self-esteem, and provides a sense of accomplishment.

Whatever the case, the arts play a big role in how humans see and interact with others and the world in general. There are so many reasons why art is important in the world, today and always.

 

WORKSHOP, ACTIVITIES & COLLABORATION

This Art Facility will open and be run by Aida Youth Center (AYC) who is located in Aida Refugee Camp, an area north of the West Bank city of Bethlehem. It was founded in 1968 with the main purpose of serving the local community – especially its children and youth. Today it represents a recreational hub that aims to improve living conditions for camp residents.

LEARNING FOR YOUNG PEOPLE

AYC caters to children from the age of 5 and the youth up to the age of 25. We will set up age appropriate creative learning activities that are fun and imaginative for the young people.

For the older age group we hope to further refine their creative skills by introducing the craft of screen-printing. This technique is used for creating bold canvases, posters and artwork, but also used to print fabrics and textiles, so it's great for creating all sorts of custom clothing and products. We want to pass on our experience with using the craft and inspire them to create their own projects and pursue their own goals and dreams. 

COLLABORATION

As part of our commitment in supporting young people, we will host an annual creative competition together with an artist or organisation to give an exceptional young talent a platform to showcase their work to an international audience. This will further provide them collaborative experience, have fresh perspective and be more empowered.

We also welcome creative VOLUNTEERS from all fields to host art workshops in Aida Camp. This can be done remotely or in person. If you are interested in volunteering please get in touch via info@hypepeace.com.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The funds will be allocated foremost to:

  • Refurbishment for an art classroom. This requires new furnishings such as worktop tables and storage units for materials.
  • General running cost of the facility for the coming year. We will be training AYC staff specific printing and design techniques.

Should we only raise our goal partially we will focus in providing the general art materials.

If we surpass the goal then we shall open up a second art facility in the region!!

 

THE IMPACT

We understand the importance of supportive engagement for young people. It helps build on important protective factors related to mental health, since it provides opportunities for youth to connect with their peers, build networks, and increase the sense that they're not alone. 

This is why we want to launch this Art Facility together with Aida Youth Center so that we can maintain this vital contribution for the Palestinian children and youth. We have seen how such organisations really play an important role.  

Our biggest contribution to date was donating £6,000 to Sharek Youth Forum. We understood the important work they do and thanks to all our customers who purchased our clothes we were able to raise and donate the money to help expand their Youth Village playground area. Now they can host more young people and enjoy more activities. 

Watch HYPEPEACE contribution to Sharek Youth Forum

 

RISK & CHALLENGES

Launching this project has some challenges. Palestine is a contentious country, with the growing political crisis we can face restrictions in setting up the facility. Sending materials or donations can be flagged by border control and jeopardise the whole project.

We will do our utmost to launch this on time. We have been supported by Aida Youth Center throughout the process so far and we would not be able to do this without them, so both of us will deliver our best, and we will keep you updated on any challenges along the way.

 

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some of you may not be able to donate but that doesn't mean you can't help!

We would truly appreciate it if you can share and make some noise about our campaign. 

  • Share on Facebook, Twitter @HypePeace, Instagram @hype.peace by using the share links above.

Please donate and share with as many people as possible, send it to friends and families and share it on your social media accounts.

And that's all there is to it.

We hope to connect to the hearts and minds of people that resonates with this project to bring it to life. 

THANK YOU FOR READING ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN ❤️

story:
WE KEEP ON QUAKING !!!

8th Psychobilly Earthquake

30.09. & 01.10.2017 - KUBA, Bremen

12 Bands ... two days of drinking, wrecking and fun !

(Full Line-Up will be announced on the 01.04.2017)

Thanks to our new partner in crime

rebels club Irish Pub & Kultur Guerilla Bremen

You can still support us by buying tickets in advance

Tickets : www.psychobillyearthquake.de

 

 

 


Diesmal seid ihr gefragt, ohne Eure Unterstützung bekommen wir es einfach nicht hin !!!

  • Wir wollen Euch gerne eine 8te Runde bieten, aber leider haben die Vorjahre gezeigt das es heutzutage nicht mehr so einfach ist und sehr Risikoreich ein Festival zu organisieren. Um es an unserem favorisiertem Datum und unserem favorisiertem Veranstaltungsort hinzubekommen brauchen wir Eure Hilfe (FESTIVAL FINDET STATT)
  • Dies ist der Grund warum wir es einfach mal mit Crowdfunding probieren und hoffen das wir das Ziel innerhalb der Frist erreichen und damit Euch erneut ein schönes Festival präsentieren können (FESTIVAL FINDET JETZT AUF JEDEN FALL STATT)
  • Die Summe die wir anstreben, benötigen wir, um alle anfallenden Kosten abzudecken 
  • Natürlich ist es möglich uns einfach Geld zu spenden, ein T-Shirt oder Patch etc. zu kaufen und darüber freuen wir uns natürlich, aber das eigentliche Ziel ist, das Ihr Eure Tickets einfach innerhalb der nächsten 30 Tage kauft
  • Oder wer es dicke hat .. kauft einfach alles 
  • Jeder Euro hilft, aber auch das teilen dieser Aktion ist natürlich sehr wichtig, da wir einfach nicht jeden erreichen können 
  • Design für Patch & T-Shirts kommt so schnell wie möglich und wird dann hier in der Bildergalerie hochgeladen
story_txt:
WE KEEP ON QUAKING !!!
8th Psychobilly Earthquake
30.09. & 01.10.2017 - KUBA, Bremen
12 Bands ... two days of drinking, wrecking and fun !
(Full Line-Up will be announced on the 01.04.2017)
Thanks to our new partner in crime
rebels club Irish Pub & Kultur Guerilla Bremen
You can still support us by buying tickets in advance
Tickets : www.psychobillyearthquake.de
 
 
 

Diesmal seid ihr gefragt, ohne Eure Unterstützung bekommen wir es einfach nicht hin !!!

Wir wollen Euch gerne eine 8te Runde bieten, aber leider haben die Vorjahre gezeigt das es heutzutage nicht mehr so einfach ist und sehr Risikoreich ein Festival zu organisieren. Um es an unserem favorisiertem Datum und unserem favorisiertem Veranstaltungsort hinzubekommen brauchen wir Eure Hilfe (FESTIVAL FINDET STATT)
Dies ist der Grund warum wir es einfach mal mit Crowdfunding probieren und hoffen das wir das Ziel innerhalb der Frist erreichen und damit Euch erneut ein schönes Festival präsentieren können (FESTIVAL FINDET JETZT AUF JEDEN FALL STATT)
Die Summe die wir anstreben, benötigen wir, um alle anfallenden Kosten abzudecken 
Natürlich ist es möglich uns einfach Geld zu spenden, ein T-Shirt oder Patch etc. zu kaufen und darüber freuen wir uns natürlich, aber das eigentliche Ziel ist, das Ihr Eure Tickets einfach innerhalb der nächsten 30 Tage kauft
Oder wer es dicke hat .. kauft einfach alles 
Jeder Euro hilft, aber auch das teilen dieser Aktion ist natürlich sehr wichtig, da wir einfach nicht jeden erreichen können 
Design für Patch & T-Shirts kommt so schnell wie möglich und wird dann hier in der Bildergalerie hochgeladen

story:
Je baigne dans la culture depuis quelques années et j'en suis très heureuse! Je suis comblée et choyée de piloter tous les projets enclenchés jusqu'à maintenant. Confidence: un lieu que je n'ai pas encore exploré professionnellement me titille depuis quelques années: les hôpitaux m'attirent comme des aimants, je m'y sens bien! Je ne peux rien y faire, j'entre là et j'ai envie de me sentir utile, d'être signifiante pour les gens qui y sont de passage pour une courte ou une longue durée. 


C'est durant le congé parental pour mon fils Gaspard que l'idée a germé plus sérieusement de plonger dans ce milieu et, en fouinant sur le web, je suis tombée miraculeusement sur le site de ce petit organisme sans but lucratif belge Le pont des arts . Je les ai contacté immédiatement. Typique du congé de maternité, je voulais tout faire, tout de suite et maintenant! J'ai dû attendre que mon bébé grandisse et travailler ma patience durant 4 années, jusqu'à cet été pour les rencontrer enfin. Je me suis rendue en Belgique pour les vacances avec ma marmaille afin de rencontrer Inghe, fondatrice du Pont et conteuse. Véritable passionnée, une touche-à-tout, un peu comme moi, elle est une rassembleuse jusqu'à la moelle, une médiatrice dans l'âme. Le clic fut instantané et nous nous sommes dit:" À très vite". 

Ceux qui me connaissent savent à quel point j'aime le contact avec l'imaginaire des enfants et combien j'aime créer des bulles où leur créativité peut s'épanouir librement. J'aime aussi savoir que mon clan autour se porte bien; un clan au travail, un clan à la maison, un clan d'amis. J'en suis maintenant à ajouter un clan à l'hôpital... C'est spécifiquement la raison pour laquelle je pars. Je veux voir comment un organisme pluridisciplinaire a pu s'intégrer dans plusieurs hôpitaux de la région Bruxelloise, et ce, depuis plus de 20 déjà.. Comment l'organisme s'intègre à l'équipe de soins, comment les enfants sont abordés et comment le lien se tisse, le rôle des parents dans tout ça, en bref, comment tout ce beau monde interagit ensemble, avec un support psychologique au besoin. Je pars observer un projet fantastique pour emmagasiner toutes les infos, les rencontres, la structure: tout, et tout ramener ici.

N'ayez crainte que les sous que vous donnerai pour supporter ce projet seront utilisés à bon escient et de manière honnête. C'est littéralement pour payer mes frais de voyage et d'hébergement. Ce projet pourra faire des petits ( plein, je le souhaite!) ici, au Québec grâce à vous!

Pour en savoir plus sur l'organisme Le Pont des arts: www.lepontdesarts.be

Si vous ne pouvez m'aider financièrement, il y a d'autres moyens: simplement partager ce lien dans votre réseau. Merci encore!

story:
Its objective is to help churches organize themselves in new ways that meet the needs of people in the modern world and to create a central place for believers to find new sources of fellowship and services that are crucial to their wellbeing. 

 

A bit about the founder and what ChurchWeave is trying to achieve:

I grew up in the church, my father was a youth pastor, and where we attended, they tried really hard to create activities that gave kids something to do. And I always wondered why there weren't similar events happening around town on other days of the week, because there are a lot of lonely Christians and non-believers who just want things to do with other human beings.  But as I got older I realized just how hard it is to keep steady volunteers and maintain consistent interest for events within the population of a single congregation. And keeping people updated on what was going on in your church was really difficult to do in this busy world. 

ChurchWeave addresses the problems of developing robust communities by putting all of the pieces together that allow people to create events with other like-minded individuals and by allowing anybody to find meaningful activities to participate in through an event calendar that lets users know what is happening at all of the churches in their cities, each day of the week, on an hourly basis. 

We believe that this website and app have the potential to breathe new life into the church, enrich the lives of believers, and to truly change the world. Its features are aimed at helping to strengthen communities and acting as another layer of support for vulnerable populations. And its framework is built around fostering love and new relationships between brothers and sisters from different denominations, as well as creating a bridge between Christians and non-Christians at the place where our love for our fellow man meets.

 

What We Need & What You Get:

What we need from you is $1 and a share on social media. Because in order to begin building ChurchWeave Lite, which will be a universal event calendar for churches in every city, we need at least $25,000.  But we will also need an additional $300,000 to create a fully functional version of the website we showed in our video. If our campaign is successful, we would also like to fund the completion of our app for both iOS and Android. This means hiring an entire website development team to turn the framework we've built, into a home for users across the globe. We believe that the world needs this technology now and we need your help to make it possible.

As a perk for funding this campaign, instead of offering you merchandise like stickers or swag, or a gadget that you will eventually throw away we are bringing you a website and app that will continue to give to you and the rest of the world for many years to come. 

BUT IN ADDITION!!!  

We will be giving you back the proceeds from the money you give us after we launch our website, to support projects you believe in! So if you see someone trying to create something you want to exist in our world, you will have credit that will be available to you upon launch, to help them fund their project!  Our hope is that this will get people invested in the website and in one another from the beginning. 


If you have gotten this far, maybe look around Indiegogo and see the things that are being funded, and ask yourself if this technology could have more impact on the world than a new type of earphones, shoes, or some other fancy gadget, because only people like you can help to bring this to life. The more that we all contribute, the more we all get back. There are over 400,000 churches in America alone!!! And 2.3 billion Christians worldwide!!!!  If each of us pitch in a small amount, we can reach our goal and create an entirely new kind of community.

Even if you can't help us fund it, there are tons of ways to assist us. The easiest thing you can do is to share this on social media. If you work in ministry, you could share our video during your weekly bulletin or as a pastor you could share this in your newsletter, with other leaders in your denomination, or with other sister churches that you are involved within your city.  Whatever you can do, we are grateful for your help.

We can't wait to see how this all comes together over the duration of the campaign. I will personally be traveling around the United States and stopping at churches and Christian universities along the way to share this idea with as many people as I can. I am super excited to see what kinds of ways God moves throughout this adventure and who I meet along the way.  You can follow ChurchWeave on Instagram, Facebook, or Twitter.  I would love to hear from any of you!                                                                                                                       

Thank you,

Tyler Jacobs -Founder of ChurchWeave

story:
On January 18, 2020, Retroformat Silent Films will present our most exciting screening to date — Charlie Chaplin's masterpiece The Gold Rush, presented in 35mm with live musical accompaniment at Hollywood's stunning new venue: The American Legion Theater on Highland Avenue.  For this one-of-a-kind screening, the Chaplin Office has waived its usual requirement that the film be accompanied by recorded music, giving Retroformat Silent Films' resident Musical Director Cliff Retallick permission to improvise a live, grand piano score! 

As a recently formed nonprofit, we need your help to make this dream of an event a reality. Costs include a rented grand piano, at least 18 theater personnel, and 35mm projection and print expenses. Our fundraising goal of $9,000 will go a long way toward covering these costs, and making the event the unequivocal success it deserves to be.
 

The new Hollywood Legion Theater is among the most beautiful in the country. 

Our giving levels are generously packed with perks and rewards, including original artwork, food and drink, VIP tickets to the event, and of course our heartfelt gratitude. Please give what you can, and help us in our mission to keep silent film alive and thriving. You can also help by spreading the word. Please share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or anywhere else. Thank you!
 

The restoration of Chaplin's original 1925 cut, to be presented at the Hollywood Legion Theater, is rarely screened. The 1942 recut with added sound is more commonly seen.

“The miracle of Chaplin is the miracle of cinema itself — for the first time in history, people of all races, ages, classes and ethnicities laughed at the same things and without words, and we owe each successive generation an introduction to Charlie,” says film director, screenwriter and Retroformat Silent Films board member Alexander Payne.  “The Gold Rush is a great place to start and this is a wonderful chance to see the movie projected. It’s a movie that sticks with you for the rest of your life.”
 

A sample of the masterful, one-of-a-kind artwork created exclusively for this screening by artist Sean Rangel.
 

Retroformat Silent Films is a new nonprofit. We re-create the original moviegoing experience of in-person screenings with live musical accompaniment, introducing new generations to the joy and power of early cinema. Our sole mission is to educate and inspire enthusiasm for the art and history of Silent Film.

story:
We present Nacer Matsigenka!

We are proud to present  Nacer Matsigenka / Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku which brings to the world our work documenting and making visible the knowledge of the Matsigenka community of Camisea through the voices of women. Nacer Matsigenka is a bilingual (Spanish/Matsigenka) book illustrated by Yaquemilsa Matiashi Vicente about the practices and beliefs related to childbirth in Camisea, an indigenous Matsigenka community of the Lower Urubamba, in the Peruvian Amazon.

The creators of the book are Yaquemilsa Matiashi Vicente, a young Matsigenka mother and artist who is currently a student of environmental engineering at UPEU-Tarapoto and Brenda Araujo Salas, who researches traditional knowledge focused on women's health. 

The aim in the creation of this book is to honor the knowledge of the Matsigenka people. With the money from this campaign we will be presenting the women of Camisea who lent their voices to this project a copy of the book. We will also be presenting the book to women in 3 other communities around the Lower Urubamba (Ticumpinia, Timpia and Shivankoreni) with the aim of creating dialogues about their traditional birth practices and their rights as indigenous women to receive health care that respects these practices.

We think it is critical that this information is visible, and we hope this book can help support the continued passing of this knowledge down through the generations. We believe these traditional practices and knowledge make us stronger as people and can help revitalize indigenous Amazon identity. Having a strong identity and pride as indigenous Matsigenka people is important in the defense of ourselves and our territories.

What will you find in this book?

This bilingual book contains some answers and we hope will inspire many questions. It will provide illustrations and the words (in Spanish and Matsigenka) of women of Camisea to explain their traditions around the birth. It will ask you to think about the way your culture brings children into the world and what we are doing to bring them in to the world with love.

Why we need you to participate

As mentioned, your support makes it possible for us to publish and present 1500 copies of Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku to the women of Camisea and 3 other communities of the Lower Urubamba in the Amazon of Peru.

The printing will be done in the second half of June 2018 and we are planning to travel to the Lower Urubamba to present the books to the communities in early July. We will begin in Camisea and travel to the other three communities explaining the process of creating these books.

During these presentations we will also be holding workshops in Matsigenka and Spanish ​​on reproductive health and the rights of indigenous women to give birth in the way they choose and to receive culturally responsive health care. 

We are also planning to deliver PDF versions of Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku to the nurses and OBGYNs who work with women in these communities.  We are excited to use this book to strengthen conversations between these health workers and community leaders about what culturally responsive healthcare can look like.

Supporting with $10 will get you a PDF version of Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku.  We are excited for you to see the beautiful illustrations by Yaquemilsa!

There will also be postcards and posters for sale depicting 5 stages of women’s health and childbirth: the first menstruation, pregnancy, delivery, care of the newborn and care of the baby as it grows.  The postcards will feature illustrations and a brief explanation in Matsigenka and Spanish.  

The explanations of the posters and postcards and additional information will also be in English, Italian, German, Portuguese and French on our blog, http://omoguitoinkite.blogspot.com thanks to our dear friends and supporters of this project.

One last request: If you decide to support this project, please send us a photograph of you  with your full name. These will go on the Acknowledgments page of the blog, and, if we receive them before May 30th, we can show your pictures to the women of Camisea during our presentations.  We want to be able to show the women all the individuals who donated to support their knowledge and words and create Nacer Matsigenka.

What is happening and why it is so urgent to value cultural practices

We believe that strengthening identity from birth is very important, especially now that there is more and more of a foreign presence in the indigenous communities in the Amazon. 30 years ago there were not many outsiders in the region, but since 1980, oil and gas extraction have started taking place and more and more outside workers and merchants have been arriving. In the last 30 years there has also been a more consistent presence of the Peruvian government, which has created public projects such as health clinics and schools.

It is critical these health clinics and schools provide culturally appropriate and responsive services, but this is usually not the case.  A clear example: in schools in the Lower Urubamba children often want to stop speaking in their mother tongue.  This was not found before public schools entered the region and reflects a deep need to create similar dialogues around respectful, culturally responsive education.

With healthcare, it is now considered more “civilized” to give birth in one of the public health clinics.  Traditional midwives and other health workers in the community are gradually giving up their work. As they stop, community members are losing traditional practices and remedies to keep themselves healthy and balanced within themselves and with their environment.  While there are some clinic personnel who are respectful and want to learn and provide culturally responsive care, they are not the majority.

We believe that these communities deserve knowledge about their rights as indigenous people and specifically as indigenous women. We believe that the solutions to providing this culturally relevant health care, health care with dignity, will not only come from the Ministry of Health, the Peruvian government, but the communities themselves. And we believe that strengthening cultural practices around health is an important way to strengthen cultural identity as a whole.

Nacer Matsigenka is the first step that we have developed to revitalize Matsigenka indigenous identity in the Lower Urubamba. We have the support of the leadership of Camisea and are looking forward to use this work to continue to strengthen cultural identity with the Matsigenka youth of Camisea.

Help disseminate!

Thank you very much for your support, for bringing to life Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku!

Help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about this campaign!

Follow our blog, http://omoguitoinkite.blogspot.com, to see our  journey to create and present this beautiful book to the women of the indigenous communities the Amazon of Cusco, Peru. Muchas gracias a todos! Ariove maganiroegui!!!

The printing will be done in the second half of June 2018 and we are planning to travel to the Lower Urubamba to present the books to the communities in early July. We will begin in Camisea and travel to the other three communities explaining the process of creating these books.
During these presentations we will also be holding workshops in Matsigenka and Spanish ​​on reproductive health and the rights of indigenous women to give birth in the way they choose and to receive culturally responsive health care. 
We are also planning to deliver PDF versions of Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku to the nurses and OBGYNs who work with women in these communities.  We are excited to use this book to strengthen conversations between these health workers and community leaders about what culturally responsive healthcare can look like.
Supporting with $10 will get you a PDF version of Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku.  We are excited for you to see the beautiful illustrations by Yaquemilsa!
There will also be postcards and posters for sale depicting 5 stages of women’s health and childbirth: the first menstruation, pregnancy, delivery, care of the newborn and care of the baby as it grows.  The postcards will feature illustrations and a brief explanation in Matsigenka and Spanish.  
The explanations of the posters and postcards and additional information will also be in English, Italian, German, Portuguese and French on our blog, http://omoguitoinkite.blogspot.com thanks to our dear friends and supporters of this project.
One last request: If you decide to support this project, please send us a photograph of you  with your full name. These will go on the Acknowledgments page of the blog, and, if we receive them before May 30th, we can show your pictures to the women of Camisea during our presentations.  We want to be able to show the women all the individuals who donated to support their knowledge and words and create Nacer Matsigenka.

What is happening and why it is so urgent to value cultural practices

We believe that strengthening identity from birth is very important, especially now that there is more and more of a foreign presence in the indigenous communities in the Amazon. 30 years ago there were not many outsiders in the region, but since 1980, oil and gas extraction have started taking place and more and more outside workers and merchants have been arriving. In the last 30 years there has also been a more consistent presence of the Peruvian government, which has created public projects such as health clinics and schools.
It is critical these health clinics and schools provide culturally appropriate and responsive services, but this is usually not the case.  A clear example: in schools in the Lower Urubamba children often want to stop speaking in their mother tongue.  This was not found before public schools entered the region and reflects a deep need to create similar dialogues around respectful, culturally responsive education.
With healthcare, it is now considered more “civilized” to give birth in one of the public health clinics.  Traditional midwives and other health workers in the community are gradually giving up their work. As they stop, community members are losing traditional practices and remedies to keep themselves healthy and balanced within themselves and with their environment.  While there are some clinic personnel who are respectful and want to learn and provide culturally responsive care, they are not the majority.
We believe that these communities deserve knowledge about their rights as indigenous people and specifically as indigenous women. We believe that the solutions to providing this culturally relevant health care, health care with dignity, will not only come from the Ministry of Health, the Peruvian government, but the communities themselves. And we believe that strengthening cultural practices around health is an important way to strengthen cultural identity as a whole.
Nacer Matsigenka is the first step that we have developed to revitalize Matsigenka indigenous identity in the Lower Urubamba. We have the support of the leadership of Camisea and are looking forward to use this work to continue to strengthen cultural identity with the Matsigenka youth of Camisea.
Help disseminate!Thank you very much for your support, for bringing to life Nacer Matsigenka/Omechotaganira Matsigenkaku!Help us achieve our goal by spreading the word about this campaign!Follow our blog, http://omoguitoinkite.blogspot.com, to see our  journey to create and present this beautiful book to the women of the indigenous communities the Amazon of Cusco, Peru. Muchas gracias a todos! Ariove maganiroegui!!!

story:
What

The Artist in Residence Program at Free Cycles is a new initiative to connect Artists with the Missoula community through the love of cycling. Artists are invited through a public art call, and when selected may spend up to one month in the warehouse studio. Here Artists are granted the time, space, materials, and equipment to create. Artist participants are able to source materials from the thousands of donated bikes in stock on the Free Cycles property, as well as donated and reclaimed construction materials from local materials giving partner Home ReSource. Upon completion of their residency Artists in Residence are asked to provide one workshop day to staff and volunteers, one workshop day to be offered free of charge to the public, and one work of art suitable for installation on the Free Cycles 2 acre property. In its initial year the program is set to offer residencies to four local artists. At this point in the fundraising stipends will not be able to be offered without your help! The program’s goal is to be able to offer Artists fair compensation for their educational work and provide a stipend for their time in residence with hopes that future funding can grow these amounts to seek Artists in all stages of their careers.

WHY?!

The planning process for this project has been happening informally for many years. By offering a community space, that encourages citizen interaction, Artists are attracted organically out of their love for creative process. For more than two decades Artists have been creating with materials from Free Cycles, often in their own shops but sometimes on site. With the recent purchase of the two-acre property and 28,000-square feet of building space this year has provided opportunity to formalize our Artist oriented programming and increase our community workshop offerings.  This program will ensure the future of the Free Cycles warehouse as a permanent part of the Free Cycles Community Bike Shop’s engagement at a pivotal time in the property’s future. 

Who We Are

MIST, the Missoula Institute for Sustainable Transportation, is a citizen-based non-profit organization in Missoula, Montana. We have a strong focus on making walking, bicycling, and public transit more complete, accessible and enjoyable. We work to create a system of movement that is safe, equitable and environmentally sound. Four programs work towards these goals, of which Free Cycles Community Bicycle Shop is one. Free Cycles Community Bicycle Shopseeks to create a healthy community through a wide range of strategies. The goal of Free Cycles is to help Missoula, Montana transition to a more sustainable transportation system while simultaneously setting a strong example for other places. Through our programs we hope to help individuals we work with to be active stewards of the community with an emphasis on social and environmental justice. We work towards this mission through education, empowerment, and engagement. Our education programs strive to give people the knowledge to maintain their bicycle independently, use it safely, and eventually share their skills with others. By increasing the accessibility of human powered transportation, we seek to directly empower individuals from all walks of life with the ability to move themselves. Our projects focus on community engagement to facilitate a sense of collective responsibility, a strong sense of place, and human connectivity. Free cycles has had approximately 200,000 total participants to date. There have been 38,000 bikes donated since 1996 of which about half gone out as free bikes while about one quarter have beenrecycled and one quarter have been repurposed. About 6,000 have taken the BikeWell safety, maintenance, and orientation class.

story:
The Utah Steampunk Society Community Planning Group is producing the Utah Steampunk Society Steaming cOn in August on the 16th and 17th. Every member of the committee loves the genre, is active in Steampunk events, and has wanted  to do a convention event for the community for a long time.
 
We need your help and commitment to the event.  Producing even a small convention is expensive, perhaps more so than most people realize. 
 
Here's a breakdown of most of the expense categories:
Building Rental - 2 days with multiple rooms and set-up and breakdown hours. Minimum $4,000
Event Insurance  $300-$400
Required Security Staff $60 per hour
Website  $200
Promotional Materials  $700 (includes promotional merchandise)
Payment for Entertainers  $1000
Food, Beverages, etc. for The Afternoon tea.  $400
 
As you can see, we're not trying to finance the whole event through this campaign, but if we get it fully funded it is a huge part of the amount we need, plus we know we'll see a lot of people coming out to join us.
 
 What You Get
 
Almost every one of our perks includes some form of ticket to the convention. In addition you'll get some fun swag that will be an indicator that you are one of our base supporters.  We have done our best to keep our ticket prices reasonable, and we can do that because every single person working on this event is volunteering their time, energy, and in some cases donating goods, furnishings, decor pieces and more to make this a delightful time for all.
 
Perks are picked up at the event when you check in.
 
You'll get the chance to interact with other Steampunk enthusiasts in a friendly environment, make new friends, exchange information and ideas, play games,  attend panels, and be involved in activities of your choice. You can shop with Steampunk-specific vendors, and partake of on-site food from our food vendors.
 

We haven't had a Steampunk-specific convention in Utah for some time. The planning committee agreed that we'd stage one this year. All the members of the committee have extensive experience in organizing and producing events, so the depth of knowledge and expertise is impressive. 

It's difficult for the community to associate and grow without opportunities like this event. We're starting somewhat small, but we are hopeful that with a successful convention this year we can grow year by year.

The Risks
We can build it, but we can't make you attend. That's the gamble we are making;  that there are enough interested people in our community who will attend so that we at least break even.  If we were to make a profit that profit would go towards Steampunk activities, including planning for next year's convention. We chose not to do a Kickstarter because we intend to go through with this event regardless.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't attend, but would like to be supportive, we have a perks category entitled Well Wishes, where you can contribute a small amount.

Spread the word to friends, family, other Steampunk folk you encounter at other events.

Share the campaign.

story:
Welcome to FreeCon 2019!

FreeCon, the convention run by students and for everyone, is back for its fifteenth year! We have been working tirelessly since the beginning of the school year to create a large-scale event that has a unique story, characters, and interactive events that will make your experience one to remember. Of course, with such big plans, we can not do it alone. With your support, we can fund high-profile media guests, quality programming, and the equipment necessary to make this year's FreeCon the best one yet.

As the continuing directors of FreeCon, we are honored to carry the torch that our predecessors have passed on to us. This ambitious project has been a memorable experience unlike any other, and we want to encourage the administrative team to make this the best event possible. FreeCon has always been an event for fans, by fans, and we want to make it stand out not only as an annual Tallahassee event, but as a free, college-run convention. Most of all, we hope that all of you will get the most out of FreeCon and enjoy every moment of the experience. This convention means a lot to us, and your donations will be greatly appreciated.

FreeCon Directors: Serene Smallwood, Alexandria Rogers, Timothy Surface, and Joel Ochoa.

 

What is FreeCon?

Check out the official FreeCon website

FreeCon is an annual anime, science-fiction, video game, comic book, and enthusiast convention, now held at the Student Services Building and Globe in Florida State University. Check out the Vendor Room and Artist's Alley to get yourself some awesome treasures. Come see our AMV and Costume Contests, or even compete in them. Attend one of our many panels and events going on all throughout FreeCon!

This year in FreeCon, join our mascots and their giant mech in a world of nature and technology, to experience everything FreeCon has to offer! The mascots will be walking around all day, so if you need help, or want a picture, feel free to ask them! FreeCon 15 begins on Saturday, March 9th, ends on Sunday, March 10th, and is absolutely FREE to attend!

Your Contribution to Us

With your contribution, we will be able to bring in Media Guests, Cosplay Guests, Music Guests enhance our programming, and make FreeCon even more fun for everyone!

By contributing to our campaign, you can receive the following perks:

  • Buttons: Wear your commitment on your sleeve with buttons based on this year's characters.
     
  • Commissions: A variety of artwork done by the talented artists on the FreeCon team. See the "Commissions!" section below for more details.
     
  • FreeCon T-Shirt: The FreeCon T-Shirts are in limited supply, so we run out pretty quickly. With this perk, we will make sure to hold on to one for you. After you donate, be sure to contact us and tell us your shirt size.
     
  • Maid Café Fast Pass: Don't like waiting in line? With the Maid Café fast pass, you and a friend can cut right to the front!
     
  • Main Event Fast Pass: For any one main Event (Cosplay Contest, Maid Cafe, Murder mystery, etc) get to the front of the line to get the best seat in the house!
     
  • Personalized Badge: A special name tag printed with the name of your choosing and embellished with our artists’ lovely handiwork. These will be available on the day of the convention, at the registration desk.
     
  • Prints: High quality 13”x19” prints of official FreeCon artwork. You may request to have the print signed by the artist.

 

  • Name in Program: As a special thanks to your contribution, your name will be included in the FreeCon program.
     
  • Name in Opening Ceremony: During the opening ceremony, we will mention you as one of our top contributors.
     
  • Collection of Mascot Materials: from story to art, we will provide all the materials that went into shaping the theme for this FreeCon.

 

Commissions!

For art commissions, you will get a different level of detail depending on your contribution level. You can request the character, pose, and, on S-level commissions, background. Note that the character of your choosing does not need to be one of the FreeCon Characters. The commissions this year will be done by our artists: Serene Smallwood, Vivian Murphy, Megan Staszkiewicz, and Uma Alcala. We encourage you to check out the samples for each artist and level in the gallery tab. The descriptions of each level are as follows:

Level C Commission: A bust with no color, or a "chibi" version of a single character (of your choosing). After donation, we can discuss the specifics of the commission.
 

Level B Commission: A bust with color, or a full-body commission of a single character (of your choosing) in monochrome. After donation, we can discuss the specifics of the commission.
 

Level A Commission: A full-body, full-color commission of a single character (of your choosing). After donation, we can discuss the specifics of the commission.
 

Level S Commission: A full-body commission of a single character (of your choosing) and a background, in full color. Poster quality. After donation, we can discuss the specifics of the commission.

Here are examples from each artist: You can also see their art in the Gallery 

Serene Smallwood: All Levels

Megan Staszkiewicz: Levels C-A


 

 

Thank You for Your Support!

We are not professionals; just college students with a passion for Japanese animation, cosplay, science-fiction, art, video games, comic books, and everything in between! We have been working tirelessly to make this year’s FreeCon fun for everyone, and your help is greatly appreciated! We can’t do it without you!

Please, tell your friends and family about this campaign! Every dollar helps!

Megan Staszkiewicz: Levels C-A
 
 
Thank You for Your Support!

We have been working tirelessly to make this year’s FreeCon fun for everyone, and your help is greatly appreciated! We can’t do it without you!
Please, tell your friends and family about this campaign! Every dollar helps!

story:
How this came to be

My name is Tucker Brennan. As far back as I can remember, I was obsessed with film and home video. I have manifested this passion on social media. I gained some notoriety on Vine, but I have relocated since their demise to Instagram (@ogvhs). For years, I have had the dream of making a career out of my passion. Now, it can become a reality.

A generation ago, director Kevin Smith introduced us to the existential hell of menial retail jobs in his seminal independent comedy Clerks. Quick Stop, the convenience store that has spanned Smith’s View Askewniverse in subsequent decades, still stands. The neighbor business, RST Video, has long since closed. In fact, in Smith’s forthcoming Jay and Silent Bob Reboot, the mecca of hit movies like Happy Scrappy Hero Pup, The Best of Both Worlds, and Navy Seals has been replaced with a Redbox.

Now, our vision is to resurrect RST Video as it was in its heyday, and then some. This not just a nostalgia haven, or a recreation of a cinematic landmark.

By reopening the store, we plan to offer a tangible experience that has dwindled in the wake of streaming and, yes, Redbox. Our hope is that RST Video can usher the video store into the era of social media. We plan to create an experience that caters to everyone’s niche. Entertainment is not uniform the way it was in the golden age of video stores.

That is why we intend for RST Video to be a boutique store that caters to as many niches as possible within our space, including:

  • Home video sales and rentals on DVD, Blu-ray, 4K Blu-ray, and of course, VHS and other retro formats, including the original RST Video stock;
  • An impeccable selection of video game consoles and games, also available for sale and rent;
  • Antique electronics, from VCR’s to turntables;
  • And much more.

We are planning to open the doors to a fresh, unique destination with the intention of keeping video store culture and physical media alive. This, my friends, is the pop-culture paradise we have dreamed of for 25 years.

What We Need & What You Get

·      While much of the store and stock have been untouched, there is a great deal of work to be done to renovate the store. We need to replace shelving, install a modern rental system, restore the signage, and promote the new RST Video!

·      In exchange for your support, we have a lot of merchandise and experiences available, including RST-branded clothing, invites to the grand opening, swag boxes, and more!

·      We have an agreement in place with the owners. RST Video WILL open. However, if we fail, any unused funds will be donated to Family Promise of Monmouth County Food and Shelter Services in Middletown, NJ.

Risks & Challenges

If you are not a fan of Kevin Smith or do not get the appeal of a video store in 2019, rest assured that this we plan to stand alone in practice, if not spirit.

  • We understand Smith’s fans.
  • We know how much we value the significance of RST video, as well as the looming shadow of video store nostalgia.
  • VHS is making a comeback! Even if you do not plan to buy or rent tapes, there will be plenty more to gravitate you.
  • We cannot do this without you! Tell us what you want to see at RST VIDEO!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t help financially, you can still help us spread the word about this campaign and about RST’s reopening! Every mention, post, tweet, and message helps us get one step closer! We appreciate any form of support!

 

Spread the word on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, or whatever social media platform you use, and remember to use the tools on this campaign to share this Indiegogo!
