It is the primary reason we are "moving back and moving on" with the business of opening these irreplaceable pieces of Outer Banks History as a full time attraction.________________________________________________________________________________________ Visitors at the "Touch Table" Dorothy has set up for some "Hands On" experience.The new site will provide many opportunities for educational exhibits and outdoor areas.______________________________________________________________Cecelia Walton Anderson reviewed Outer Banks Beachcomber Museum — 5 starAugust 31, 2017: "The Beachcomber Museum is even more wonderful than I expected. I wanted to go here from the first I read about it. So much to see and think about...a perfect example of "material culture" describing the people and their lifestyle."_____________________________________You can read more reviews HERE... OUR GOAL: $235,000This will allow us to pick up and move Mattie Midgette's Store to property we own nearby.    Julian and Stephen Bray have been working with us on this project and will be moving the buildings to the new site. After that, a foundation will be constructed of pilings and girders to accept the structures when they are lowered.We will install parking, septic system, and a cistern for storm water management. Bathrooms, handicapped ramp, and access to the site from the road will also have to be constructed. The property will then be returned to its natural state as much as possible. All funds will be used to complete the move of the structures, prepare the site to open as a self sustaining conservation ~ preservation venture, and photograph and archive the entire collection so the inventory can be placed online at some point to assist students, scholars, and researchers, to name a few. Other Ways to Help...You can also get involved by spreading the word amongst your friends and family who                might be interested in knowing about this important preservation effort! Let us know                    if you would like to walk the property, we look forward to showing you the potential                        we see in the new site!!Thank you for your interest, let's make some history together!!Dorothy Hope & Chaz Winkler252-564-5317osobnc@gmail.comwww.osobnc.com"Old School Outer Banks"

story:
How the Project Came to Form

I was born in post-war Vietnam in 1976; less than a year later my family escaped on our small fishing boat across treacherous open waters. For two long months we went from port to port trying to find safety. We eventually landed in Bogor, Indonesia where we stayed for 11 months before being sponsored by my uncle to live in Toronto, Canada.

As a refugee child, I grew up in a family that blurred the lines between tradition and western life and values. As is the case with many refugee and immigrant families, we never talked about the experience of leaving our homeland behind, the war, of what it was like to move to a new country where we didn’t speak the language or understand the culture. I had no Vietnamese friends growing up and lived a very Western life.

As an adult in 2007, I returned to live and work in Vietnam, where I was exposed to a whole new world. For the first time, I met people like me, second generation Vietnamese immigrants who had returned, and were struggling to find their own identity between two conflicting worlds. I slowly began to ask the tough questions about my family’s history.  My family was getting older and time was running out. I wanted to capture our family’s story before they were gone forever, but I didn’t know how.

Then in 2016 there were two momentous events that helped bring this project to life. First was the Syrian refugee crisis, which brought conversations about the Vietnamese boat people to the table once again. It brought back questions and memories I had about my own family’s experiences.  Secondly, my grandmother who had cradled me on the boat, who had raised me, taken me to school, guided me through life, passed away.  I have been trying to tell her story for a long time but I didn’t know how. When she arrived in Canada, she recorded our journey on an audio cassette tape and I am finally ready to tell her story and in a way that I felt would pay homage to her by using her voice. The timing just feels right and I am able to bring it into a format that both helps me come to terms with my own personal story, make it relevant to people like me and add to the current refugee narrative.

 

What Your Contribution Will Fund

Your donation will fund the research and development phase as well as the continuation of the digital campaign to build community.

  • Creation of Short Films of Immigrant & Refugee Experiences as Part of the "My Story" and "My Kitsch" Series
  • Research the stories and ideas we will include on the website
  • Research the design and interactivity of the website
  • Community Outreach
  • Online and Social Media Strategy
  • Surveys and Focus Groups
  • Training - Facilitation, Participatory Storytelling
  • Production Phase Funding Pitching and Research
  • Ethical Issues Research & Case Study Analysis of Storytelling and Trauma. How do we deal with the trauma that may arise from this storytelling process?
  • Reporting/Tracking/Analytics Research

 

Aims and Goals

  • To capture the micro history of unique and individual stories of the Vietnamese refugee and immigrant families through their own voices by using various community participatory methodologies – Digital Storytelling, Photo Voice, Journals. Provide supporting digital media on the website to enrich the main stories (photos, maps, letters, artwork, audio recordings, video interviews, etc.…)
  • To encourage 1st, 2nd and 3rd generation immigrants and refugees to explore and connect to their history, their family and their community. 
  • To create a safe space for subjects to self-reflect and to engage with one another
  • To create a highly interactive, innovative site with engaging user experience that appeals to the tech and culture savvy users
  • To create an interactive Art Exhibit featuring content from the website that can be taken on the road. Additional stories will be collected at the exhibition

 

Testimonials

Take a look at a few testimonials about HERE AND THERE and the founder of the project, Linh Phan.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We don't anticipate any major risks for this project. One of the biggest challenges during this phase would be building community awareness and outreach. However, based on the pre-campaign so far, feedback about the project has been extremely positive. We've had people reach out to us to offer assistance and offer introductions to others as far as Los Angeles, London, and Denmark.

We also have a talk planned in Saigon on August 9th at one of the top contemporary galleries in Vietnam as well as potential talks in London, Paris and Berlin in late September.

 

Check Out Some of the Perks!

    

Here's just a teaser of some of the amazing perks we have:

  • Do you want to tell your own story? We will work with you to help you create it and then add it to the digital campaign and website.
  • Ho Chi Minh City is a beautiful, colourful city and we will create a personalised Thank You Photo in the city just for you!
  • We've recruited some Vietnamese artists to design limited edition totebags and notebooks
  • The Vietnamese fishing boat is an iconic image in many stories. We have handmade Here and There Vietnamese Fishing Boat model.

*Note, final product may differ to the images above. Fishing boat image is for reference only.

 

What Else Can You Do?

Do you love the idea Here and There and want to do more? We need help from the community to spread the word around, not only about the IndieGoGo campaign but also about the project.

  • Follow us on Facebook & Instagram: @vietnamhereandthere
  • Hashtag #vietnamhereandthere
  • Subscribe to our YouTube Channel: www.youtube.com/hereandthere
  • Want to keep up to date about the project? Not ready to donate yet? No worries. Join our mailing list. Just click here: http://eepurl.com/cSprAv

 

Upcoming Community Building Events

We love sharing information about our project to the community and are always looking for opportunities to speak and engage with the public. Here are some upcoming events we have planned or in the works:

  • July 13th, 2017: HERE AND THERE IndieGoGo Launch Party @ Rogue Saigon, 13 Pasteur Street, 2nd Floor, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
  • August 12th 2017: Creative Sessions: Community Storytelling Through Digital Media with Case Study of HERE AND THERE @ The Factory Contemporary Art Centre, 15 Nguyen U Di, District 2, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
  • September 2017: Introduction to HERE AND THERE Talk in London, UK (Date and Venue To Be Confirmed)

 

Want to Learn More About Linh Phan?

Linh Phan is a Vietnamese-Canadian Creative Producer based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.  She was a partner at Fact and Fiction Films, a media production house in Vietnam that focused on content creation of art, culture, music and community engagement projects. She is the co-winner of two International Public Engagement grants from the Wellcome Trust, UK, the 2nd highest funding body for health and science research in the world, after Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.  For the past 4 years, she has been collaborating with The Oxford University Clinical Research Unit, Vietnam (OUCRU-VN) on various public engagement projects utiilising digital media, helping marginalised communities create films about their lives and health issues such as HIV, Zoonotic Diseases, Dengue and Malaria. She has spoken at several International public engagement conferences, ran workshops on Digital Storytelling and facilitated discussions about producing and filmmaking.

With a passion in music all her life, soon after she landed in Saigon, she began to DJ and organize music events.  She played a pivotal role in the development the Saigon underground music scene, bringing in top international DJs such as Bottin, Rodion, Trus’Me, and Voodoo Frank. Her parties are featured in the Lonely Planet Guide Vietnam and Southeast Asia as one of the “hippest club nights in Ho Chi Minh City”.  She is an avid supporter of the creative community and frequently collaborates with other promoters and artists.

story:
Why Tour Guides?

Naoki started out as a host on Airbnb, the worldwide service allowing guests from around the world to stay in the home of a local. In three and a half years, Naoki greeted over 150 guests from around the world. Kevin was his second-ever guest, and from the moment of his arrival, he was moved by Naoki and his friends' genuine friendliness and eagerness to give him an amazing first impression of Tokyo, and decided to join him in showing Tokyo to the guests who followed. The two of them realized together that the most important thing in a foreign country is not seeing the sights or trying the food, but sharing those experiences with the people who live in and love their city.

That's why when Naoki was struggling with giving up the Tokyo Handsome Boys Airbnb to join the workforce, Kevin said, why not become a tour guide and keep doing Tokyo Handsome Boys as a career? It was a crazy idea, but we thought it just might work, and we want to prove that it can.

 

The Reality of the Tokyo Tour Industry

So what's so crazy about becoming a tour guide? Both Naoki and I were moved by our experiences with meeting international people and sharing our city with them, and in fact, we know many other young people share that experience. But becoming a tour guide isn't even considered as an option.

[Source: Japan Tourism Industry Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism]

In fact, only 1% of all tour guides in Japan are in their 20's. But in a modern and evolving city like Tokyo, isn't it strange that the people introducing the city aren't the ones who are actually creating it, like the artists, musicians, and fashionistas we actually see enjoying and pouring their hearts into the city? We thought so too - but the problem is not without a reason.

The hard truth is, only 4% of tour guides in Japan make a salary of over $40,000, that is, anywhere close to a regular full-time employee's salary. That's why it's generally the domain of retirees and mothers working to make extra pocket money, and not considered a real career. But we believe that's all going to change.

Even in just the last 5 years, the number of yearly visitors to Japan has tripled from 8 million in 2012 to 24 million last year. And with the Olympics arriving in Tokyo in 2020, it's not about to stop. The time to act is now. That's why we decided to give up on becoming tour guides, and get started on creating our own tour business. But what young people boast in energy and passion, they lack in resources and experience. So it's no easy task for us to win against the currently established tour industry, which values repeating the same tour and the same information over and over for each client, like a conveyor belt. We think all these people visiting Tokyo for the first time deserve something better, and we think its young people have what it takes to provide it.

 

How Tokyo Handsome Boys are Changing That

So we thought - How do we bridge this gap in people who love sharing experiences with international people but wouldn't dream of becoming a tour guide? The answer lies in giving tours that guides want to give, and guests want to receive. That's not accomplished by making guides memorizing the same textbook information that anyone can look up on Wikipedia in this day and age; it's accomplished by realizing the potential of their love for the city. And this isn't just some pie in the sky dream - Tokyo Handsome Boys is already running two types of tours which we believe embody that principle.

1. Custom Tokyo Tour

Tokyo's first ever custom tours; this is no private tour which might accommodate for a request or two, these are fully customized tours designed based around a questionnaire submitted to our guests in the weeks before the tour.

Below: An example submission for our Custom Tour survey.

We're also currently offering a one-on-one Skype session preceding the tour to confirm the course we've planned and get personally acquainted with the guest before the tour. The custom tour has been our most popular tour up to this point, because it challenges us to be original, and provides our guests with the adventure and real local experience they're looking for. When the guides and guests create and live that one-of-a-kind experience together, the walls between guides and guests break down - they become friends who shared an amazing day in a city that's constantly full of surprises.

 

2. Shinjuku Nichome "Rainbow Tokyo" Tour

With over 300 bars crammed into the size of a football field, Shinjuku Nichome is the densest gay bar district in the world. In recent years, it's gained popularity worldwide as a landmark of LGBT culture in Japan, but visiting tourists often don't make it beyond the five or six most visible bars and clubs. That's because all the unique, narrow snack bars here are windowless, with heavy doors, and even Shinjuku locals could have no idea what might lay inside each one. It's not easy to simply wander into any bar that catches your eye - Only true regulars here can break into the community and find the real nichome. That's why we spent a month before this tour exploring bars and finding the bar mamas who provide the best hospitality and entertainment to their guests. 

STEP INTO RAINBOW TOKYO!

 

What We Can Do With Your Contribution

Cash is powerful, but without a clear direction it can vanish without a trace. We've laid out a concrete business plan to ensure that your investment will go into one place and one place only: Tours.

 

Funding our tours will have two main effects:

1. Giving us the ability to improve and deeper our existing tours with funding to research not just on the internet, but firsthand, laying foot to earth and food to mouth in Tokyo's local places

2. Allowing us to invest in creating new tours beyond our current limited scope

 

If we are able to fund our mission thanks to everyone's help in this campaign, we plan to accomplish these goals with two significant types of expenses.

 

1. Exploring areas suited to our upcoming Custom Tours

The most important part of a tour is the preparation stage. No amount of charisma can save a tour which is not properly structured and consistently entertaining. That's why for our custom tours, which are specially suited and designed to match each guest's interests and hopes for Tokyo, the preparation stage is where we spend the majority of our time and money. In order to find the most delicious and authentic food in each area and to plan the optimal course between each location, funds are absolutely essential. Your investment now will pay in the long run because it will improve the quality not only of our Custom Tours, but of all of our future tours as we use the areas we newly explore in designing new first-of-their-kind tours.

 

2. Electric bicycles to multiply our potential variety of tours

Tokyo is a sprawling city, and the number of tours which are feasible by walking and taking trains is limited, with most three-hour tours only covering a single area. Electric bicycles for us and our guests will give us the potential to cover huge swaths of land in a breeze, and to grasp the overall nature of Tokyo in a single tour instead of just one small portion. For the chaotic and disunified city of Tokyo, a Custom Tour with electric bicycles is ideal to cross from the peaceful temples, gardens and shopping streets of the shitamachi old town of the east in the day, to the whirling city of the future of the west city at night. Electric bicycles are easy to ride for the young and old, the energetic and the exhausted alike, and at only around $500 each they're well worth the investment. And as a bonus, since we can ride our own electric bicycles to explore new potential tour sites, they'll boost our efficiency during both preparation and the tours themselves.

 

Making these tours is our passion, but nothing compares to the joy of seeing our guests' faces light up upon seeing a side of Tokyo they never expected. If we can succeed even a bit in bringing that guest-first spirit to the world of Tokyo tours, it is worth anything we can give. We would be so honored to have you be a part of this dream!

 

~ Naoki and Kevin, the TOKYO HANDSOME BOYS

story:
О чем:

Мы придумали приложение которое создаст прозрачную систему благотворительности

 

Какую проблему решает:

Вы видели, как в новостях показывают разоблачение групп людей, которые от лица благотворительного фонда собирают деньги на свои нужды. Сейчас каждый согласится с тем, что есть нуждающиеся в посторонней помощи и люди которые готовы помочь, если будут уверены, что деньги дойдут до адресата.

 

Как это работает:

1. Мы показываем все источники сбора средств, чтобы исключить историю с отмыванием денег

2. Пожертвования исключительно адресные (вылечить конкетного щенка или помочь конкретному человеку)

3. Если проект не набирает необходимую сумму в течение недели - мы возвращаем пожертвования обратно пользователям

4. Если проекту удается собрать сумму, то мы назначаем команду исполнителей, которые занимаются исполнением проекта и выкладывают все чеки, фото и видео материалы

5. Каждый пользователь может пожертвовать только 300 руб. в неделю на один из пяти проектов.

Благотворительный фонд:

Перед разработкой концепта, мы протестировали наш проект на всех стадиях работы: "От поиска проекта до реализации". Вы можете посмотреть презентацию по нашему проекту здесь

Ссылки на наши материалы:

1. Мы создали прототип мобильного приложения

2. Мы создали сайт, где вы можете зарегистрироваться, и вам придёт уведомление, когда приложение будет разработано

3. Мы описали маркетинговую стратегию, которая позволит набрать популярность и обеспечить необходимый поток пользователей

Хочется, чтобы люди придерживали двери в метро для тех, кто идет сзади. Хочется, чтобы помогали пожилым поднимать их сумки. Хочется, чтобы заботились друг о друге.

Помогите нам собрать необходимую сумму на разработку прилжоения, которое будет делать 52 благотворительных проекта в год.

___

С уважением,

Команда Project-C

story:
THEME Animal Rights/Veganism
DATE 9 - 11 FEB 2019
LOCATION Paintworks Event Space, Bristol 

 

Set inside a spacious modern venue, the show will feature art of all kinds, speakers, performers, workshops, vegan food and art stalls; all reflecting an animal rights theme. Come join us on Sunday 10th of Feb 2019 for a day of vegan culture. 

 

 

What you can expect to see

Here are just some of the great things we have in store...

- ART of all mediums including photography, painting, video, sculpture, spoken word and more! 
- WORKSHOPS design and make your own tote bags, banners and badges. Learn how to create your own artwork as a way of spreading a positive vegan message. 
- TALKS/PERFORMANCES by artists, Youtubers and local activist groups. We'll have talks ranging from 'how to go vegan', to 'how art has been used throughout history to create change'.
- ART STALLS selling clothing, artwork and prints to cover the walls of your own home. Support vegan artists at the same time!
- FOOD tasty vegan delights sold at the event. LibArts will also feature a food demo or two.

 


Opportunities

- ARTIST CALL  are you a passionate vegan artist? Submit your own animal rights inspired artwork for a chance to be featured in the show! 

- INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE  we have a range of volunteer opportunities for those seeking experience within the arts industry, while supporting a cause you care about. 

- STALL HIRE sell your animal arts/crafts/clothing/jewelry at our event!

 

Where your money will go

As you can imagine, organizing a large-scale event such as this can take a lot of time, energy and money. When you donate to this cause, here is where your money will go...

  • Venue Hire
  • Exhibition Tools
  • Performance Equipment
  • Workshop Materials
  • Volunteer Expenses
  • Admin Costs
  • Speakers Expenses
  • Event Promotion
  • Staff
  • Indiegogo takes a %

 

 

What you will gain

As a way of thanking you for your generosity and support, we are offering you some querky perks in return. Perks include free entry to the event and participation in all workshops, a vegan postcard collection and even your business logo on all our leaflets (depending on how much you donate). 

 

Find out more

We will be announcing the lineup on our website and other social media. You can keep up to date with this as well as find out more by checking out our:

  • Website
  • Facebook
  • Youtube

 

9 FEB 2019

UK Vegan Film Festival: A variety of vegan documentaries and films will be shown throughout the day. Films will cover all aspects of veganism as it relates to ethics, the environment and health. By one get one free ticket system for £6 available via perks.

10 FEB 2019

All activities including workshops, speeches, performances, arts and some small food stalls will occur on this day. Tickets are £6, which can be purchased using our perk system. 

11 FEB 2019

UK Vegan Film Festival. By one get one free ticket system for £6 available via perks.

 

 

Our mission is to unite animal rights with art and artists as a way of supporting, advancing and raising awareness of both. We look forward to seeing you at this exciting, vegan art event!

story:
COVID-19 UPDATE

To our attendees, vendors, artists, community partners, sponsors, and team members:

After much consideration, we have decided to postpone the Riverlights Music Festival, which was scheduled to take place on June 5 and 6, 2020. This was a very difficult decision, but given the current state of the COVID-19 pandemic, this was the only realistic option. Our hearts go out to everyone who has been affected by this pandemic. In these difficult times, we will do our part to ensure the protection of public health while also helping our community recover.

We have decided to continue the Indiegogo campaign but will be donating all proceeds to our local musicians who are in desperate need of support.  All claimed perks will be honored. In addition you can choose to get a refund if you decide to withdraw your previous (pre-update) contribution to this campaign. Please email us if you have any questions (riverlightsmusicfestival@gmail.com).

There is so much work and planning that goes into our music festival. Our team was excited about this year’s new location of Howard Park and the experience enhancements that we had planned. Rest assured that this excitement will carry on into the next phase of Riverlights Music Festival planning. Because of the uncertainty of the current pandemic, it is unclear at this time just how and when we will return. While we have hopes of having an event within this calendar year, we will almost certainly be back in 2021. In the meantime, the talented and generous members of the Riverlights team will be exploring new and creative ways to help support our local artist community. Please keep an eye on our social media platforms for new announcements as we move forward.

South Bend is a town that knows something about perseverance. The Riverlights Music Festival team will be a proud partner in its recovery. Today the rule is social distancing, but there will come a time when normality will resume and we will be free to enjoy live music on warm summer days. Until then, please stay safe and be healthy.

Warmest Regards,

Matt and the Riverlights Music Festival Team

story:
Who we are

We are Marilyn's Secret, a social networking community designed for women by women to help uplift and support women in all communities around the world.  Marilyn's Secret is a place for women to confide in, motivate, laugh, cry and build relationships with other women who desire to better themselves and live happy lives.  It is extremely important for women to encourage one another to live shamelessly in their truth.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000 to pay for servers, development, and all of the other expenses that go with running a grass roots social network.  We are currently in Beta, and are learning a lot about what our community of women wants in a social network.  The money will also be used to do our next release, which will be us coming out of Beta.

We are committed to empowering our community of women, and we will continue to work on this no matter how close or far from our fundraising we end up.  We will continue to bug our friends and family for donations, and we will continue to offer a safe place for women to be themselves.

 

Our Goal

We want to ensure that the community stays women only, as we value the privacy of all of our users.  We aim to provide women with a secure community that ensures that their identities, pictures, and anything else that they post will be kept private unless they other wise choose to change it.  We also aim to provide a comfort zone where women can be as open and expressive as they would like without the fear of negative repercussions.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to help out in a financial way, but there are other ways in which you can help Marilyn's Secret be a success.  Please share this campaign link with any and every woman that you know who believes in empowering other women.  Also, please share our Facebook and Instagram accounts with them.  

Facebook: Marilyn's Secret LLC

Instagram: @marilyns_secretllc

 Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Founder & CEO: Nigel Jones has over 20 year of experience in the retail management industry. The idea to create the PromoCaribbean app all started with Nigel, who is from the small Island of Grenada (also in the Caribbean). iDestiny Tech Lab (app developer) has 4+ years experience in the Mobile App industry and 7+ years experience in the Web Development industry.

We have taken this idea from concept to reality in a matter of about 6 months (app launch October 2016). Now we need Indiegogo's help to take us to the next level.  We need funding for advertising that will generate more downloads throughout North America and the United Kingdom.  The funding will also be used to continue with branding such as Caribbean community event sponsorship (specifically for summer 2017).

Contributors will help us to achieve more downloads and user ship, making PromoCaribbean more attractive to the businesses we target to list in our business listings category.  Business listings in turn will generate the revenue we need to make PromoCaribbean a self sustaining business.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for 15,000 USD. The amounts will be distributed as follows: 5,000 USD for download advertising.  Another 5,000 USD for PromoCaribbean branding and sponsorship initiatives. Lastly, for legal fees and product development 5,000 USD.

Contributors will get 6 months of free advertising on our app with a minimum of 100 USD contribution. PromoCaribbean is the one stop shop for everything Caribbean! Users have access to Caribbean news, live TV streaming, over 380 Caribbean radio stations, Caribbean music and much more in the palm of their hands.  All of this and the app is absolutely FREE to download!

If we are not able to raise the full amount we need, we will use the funds for download advertising and branding.  These two areas are most important to our success.

The Impact

The PromoCaribbean app is the first of its kind.  Our app targets the entire Caribbean (English, Spanish, French and Dutch).  So far we have been rated as #2 in "Travel" apps on Appliv (a mobile app discovery platform) read more.  The app is available for download from Play Store and the App Store; it has over 57,000 downloads. 

Outreach is very important to us. One of our missions is to give back to the Caribbean community. Your support enables PromoCaribbean to help others in the Caribbean region.

Risks & Challenges

The major obstacle we face is reaching our targeted users. We need additional funding for more advertising to reach them. With a wider audience, businesses will find it more attractive to list with us. Using social media advertising we are able to specifically select our users.  We also been participating in a variety of Caribbean events in North American to generate brand awareness.

The Brampton Entrepreneurial Centre and the Research Innovation and Commercialization Centre have been very supportive in helping with business seminars, access to market data and soft skills development.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, we would love to have you download the app, rate it and share it.  We are also welcome to any suggestions or advice on product improvement. You can also use the Indigogo share feature to invite a friend to contribute!

story:
Rocanotherworld was created to promote three core values (curiosity, courage and empathy) among members of a generation that wants to be open, special and connected in the real world, rather than mostly online. 

The first edition took place in June 2016 in Iași, in memoriam of Ioan Dan Niculescu, also known as Roca, a designer, a traveler, a foodie, a dog-lover, and a changer of hearts who created the online presidential campaign for Klaus Iohannis in 2014. We completely ignored the "no, can't do" attitude and showed that three days are enough for organizing a music event out of donations, where five of the top Romanian alternative rock bands shared the stage. 

This year, we are bringing more than 40 bands and DJs to the stage, in a three-day event with free admission meant to break the usual festival concept, and we need you to rock this world.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to offer people the unexpected, we would like to raise 33,000$ so that we are able to ensure all the logistics behind the festival, alongside other attractions that participants will enjoy on site, for free.

Our perks are what we can offer backers who ultimately become sponsors and part of the Rocanotherworld team, as we would love to create connections, experiences and feelings to bring us closer to each other and our goal.

We want to make it clear that if we do not reach our entire goal, every donation will be well spent on whatever we can provide within the festival, so that every participant experiences this movement his/her own way and is sure to have rocked another world. 

The Impact

Rocanotherworld is a whole experience made out of smaller happenings that go all over the city. 

​L​isten

For three days and nights in a row, enjoy a handful of rock bands, DJs, special guests and local underground talent, who will make your heart vibrate or pound in tune with thousands of other hearts.

​T​aste

The Vasile Pogor street, where Roca lived, will host a culinary orgasmatron from all around the world, with the support of top chefs and local restaurants.

​Dream

We’re bringing art installations that will change your perception of the world through mind-blowing statements. Then, the streets of Iași will be the canvas for top grafitti artists who will leave a different city behind.

​Let go

In the last night of the festival we’ll light up the sky by launching 5,000 sky lanterns, as a symbol of enlightenment and love, and a process of giving up fears, regrets or other negative feelings.

Give

Dedicate fully to others and learn how it feels to give from the heart—from experiences to advice, from gifts to donations to the causes that we support this year.

Risks & Challenges

Free festival. Wink-wink.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't want to buy one of our perks, be sure you can make any kind of donation. More than that, it doesn't matter if you can't help us now.

On the day of the event you will be able to adopt and care for a dog, offer a gift to anyone at the festival, get involved in different activities, which, to be honest, will make our hearts full.

Join us here and let's Rocanotherworld together!
story_txt: Rocanotherworld was created to promote three core values (curiosity, courage and empathy) among members of a generation that wants to be open, special and connected in the real world, rather than mostly online. The first edition took place in June 2016 in Iași, in memoriam of Ioan Dan Niculescu, also known as Roca, a designer, a traveler, a foodie, a dog-lover, and a changer of hearts who created the online presidential campaign for Klaus Iohannis in 2014. We completely ignored the "no, can't do" attitude and showed that three days are enough for organizing a music event out of donations, where five of the top Romanian alternative rock bands shared the stage. This year, we are bringing more than 40 bands and DJs to the stage, in a three-day event with free admission meant to break the usual festival concept, and we need you to rock this world.What We Need & What You GetIn order to offer people the unexpected, we would like to raise 33,000$ so that we are able to ensure all the logistics behind the festival, alongside other attractions that participants will enjoy on site, for free.Our perks are what we can offer backers who ultimately become sponsors and part of the Rocanotherworld team, as we would love to create connections, experiences and feelings to bring us closer to each other and our goal.We want to make it clear that if we do not reach our entire goal, every donation will be well spent on whatever we can provide within the festival, so that every participant experiences this movement his/her own way and is sure to have rocked another world. The ImpactRocanotherworld is a whole experience made out of smaller happenings that go all over the city. ​L​istenFor three days and nights in a row, enjoy a handful of rock bands, DJs, special guests and local underground talent, who will make your heart vibrate or pound in tune with thousands of other hearts.​T​asteThe Vasile Pogor street, where Roca lived, will host a culinary orgasmatron from all around the world, with the support of top chefs and local restaurants.​DreamWe’re bringing art installations that will change your perception of the world through mind-blowing statements. Then, the streets of Iași will be the canvas for top grafitti artists who will leave a different city behind.​Let goIn the last night of the festival we’ll light up the sky by launching 5,000 sky lanterns, as a symbol of enlightenment and love, and a process of giving up fears, regrets or other negative feelings.GiveDedicate fully to others and learn how it feels to give from the heart—from experiences to advice, from gifts to donations to the causes that we support this year.Risks & ChallengesFree festival. Wink-wink.Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you don't want to buy one of our perks, be sure you can make any kind of donation. More than that, it doesn't matter if you can't help us now.On the day of the event you will be able to adopt and care for a dog, offer a gift to anyone at the festival, get involved in different activities, which, to be honest, will make our hearts full.Join us here and let's Rocanotherworld together!

story:
Utopia is made out of YOU

We imagine a place, a home for restless spirits, to create and accomplish their ideas. We want an available space for projects including dance, theater, music, photography, literature, architecture, crafts, poetry, performing arts, painting, and philosophy, psychology, even for inner self research or meditation and energy balance. It is a very big project, a lot of people thought we were crazy; we are trying to make it work. This is why we call it Utopia.

We have a vision of an active community, in the center of Athens. A community that interacts and helps others get to their goals. Where great minds will find the room to come up with big ideas. Artists will collaborate and share their art and everyone will be able to research, balance and come in a better state of being, with themselves as a person and as a human.

 

To make all the above viable, we put in use an exchange program. This program regulates the use of the space and facilities. It is based on the idea of self-management. People who use the space are responsible for it and they offer their time and skills for every need that comes up, like cleaning, equipment, supplies and more. The exchange program is an important tool to maintain but not to fund Utopia. Nevertheless it removes the stress and gives the opportunity for artists to focus their energy on their projects.

https://www.facebook.com/pg/utopialaboratory/ph...

Facilities are very important to us. We design everything to be functional, with the best quality given the circumstances. We are making research for the materials, the placement and the functionality of every structure inside the space, from the main studio till the bathroom and the back yard. We reuse materials, we built everything ecofriendly based on the concept “rethink-reuse-repurpose-recycle”. We worked with reclaimed wood like pallets, old furniture and used construction timber. This gave us joy by forming them to serve a new purpose, through a creative procedure.

 

We began from scratch, with very few funds, just a bunch of people hoping to become a big community. Our country is in difficult times. There are a lot of deficiencies. But instead of complaining about them, we decided to create what we need, regarding the phenomenal risks. We see solutions everywhere. It’s not difficult to come up with them. But it takes a lot of courage to make that first step. To believe in your dreams and decide to make the effort, towards them.

Half of the funds will helps us complete the floor in the main space, for intensive activities and performances. We also need sound and electrical equipment as well as for bathroom and kitchen. Furthermore, we want to design the back yard as a small garden in the center of the city and make it real. The other half will provides our maintenance of our basic expenses for about a year. 

We believe in a universal state of art. Art should not be an advantage for the elite. Everyone in this world has the potential to create, to explore new ways of being and enjoy creative moments. In Greece lately it seems a luxury to promote art by the belief that culture is a necessity.

What is “Utopia” to others, for us is a necessity. With a clear purpose and vision: to leave this place, a better world, with more love, care and sensitivity.

Athens needs a place like this close to our philosophy and our perspective. 

Be with us, be a dreamer, join our vision and help us build Utopia!

story:
We want to save the oldest Baptist Church building in Canada.

Goat Island Baptist Church is located a short distance outside Annapolis Royal, Nova Scotia, and dates to c.1810 when the Second Great Awakening swept through the province. The church was renovated in the 1840s to add a steeple and gothic-style windows, but otherwise retains its original charm. 

Our group is the Goat Island Church Preservation Society. In 2006, local residents formed the society to take over the maintenance of the church and its surrounding cemetery from the Baptist congregation which was dwindling in number and lacked the financial resources to maintain the building. The Preservation Society is a federally registered charity. 

In late 2016, we noticed a problem with the foundation and floor and hired a structural engineer to conduction an inspection. He found that a beam supporting the floor joists had collapsed, that the entire substructure lacked adequate support, and that foundation walls were falling away resulting in the upper walls bowing outwards. The entire floor is in serious risk of collapse. As a result, no further events can occur in the building until repairs are made.

Our society has received estimates for repairs and engaged in local fundraising. The response has been heartening, as we have raised a significant amount of money and added many new members and volunteers to the organization. We are still, however, $21,000 short of our fundraising target. Hence our decision to try crowdfunding.

story:
The Global Arts and Politics Alliance (GAPA) is a vision, a network, and a movement centring on critical political innovation, artistic expression, and the advancement of art activism.
 

Text also available in Francais, Italiano, Crno gorski/Srpski, Russki, Deutsch and Español! 

Through our three pillars, we bring together a unique mix of artists, activists, and change-makers. It is our goal to unite these groups in an environment of exchange and creation, where talents meet ideas!

We take an active part in strengthening the role of the arts in altering the political discourse, generating innovative knowledge and practices, and creating a space for artistic activism and change-making!

Click to enlarge:

We work around three pillars that empower, enable and connect the community:

  • The online platform gathers an international community of artists, activists, and change-makers and provides unique opportunities for them to exchange about the work and ideas. We feature a unique blog with a wide range of guest posters, private online groups and galleries, extensive professional and creative opportunities , networking and project facilities, and a vast network of over 300 GAPActivists all around the globe!

  • Our events are where the magic happens, and talents meet ideas. With previous events in London and in Graz, GAPA is dedicated to fostering local community throughout the world and to facilitate the political discourse through inviting speakers, hosting workshops, providing exhibition spaces, and holding capacity trainings to empower local artists/activists and groups

  • Our think tank gathers a unique team of 14 researchers from around the world to advance the study of arts and politics - in the tradition of Rancière, Adorno, Benjamin and their colleagues in the mid 20th century. With its International Journal of Arts and Politics (IJAP), it ensures the cutting-edge research resonates within the academic community and is adequately represented and acknowledged in political/social/cultural disciplines
     

Through these actions, GAPA is a unique organisation that plays an active part in strengthening the role of the arts in altering the political discourse, generating innovative knowledge and practices, and creating a space for artistic activism and change-making!

Want to read more about us? Read the GAPA manifesto, join our over 600 newsletter subscribers or 14.000 facebook followers, and visit our website at www.ga-pa.org!

What will we use the money for? (click to enlarge!)


Who are we?

We are GAPActivists, a group of under 30-year old volunteers from all over the world. We run GAPA in our free time next to studying, working and travelling. GAPA stands for Global Arts and Politics Alliance, but also for art, activism, critical discourse, political, social and cultural awareness. We DO believe change is possible. We question, we critique, we work hard, we empower.

For enquiries please contact us at office@ga-pa.org

If you do not have a credit card or PayPal, our NGO account details are

The Global Arts and Politics Alliance (GAPA)
IBAN: DE96 5123 0800 6530 5721 01
BIC:WIREDEMM

story:
GARNER Arts Center and Building 35

Thanks to the tremendous support of our community we have made excellent progress in turning Building 35, the Historic District’s former cafeteria, into a state of the art interdisciplinary arts center. Focus groups held along the way have taught us a great deal, but the one thing that resonates with us the most is that this community needs a meeting place. A place open 7 days a week. A place accepting of everyone. A place that can create, nurture and sustain the local arts community while connecting with the regional and national arts scene. Once complete, Building 35 will be the gateway to this historic complex and a true community treasure.

Your help thus far has allowed us to lay a new floor, upgrade electrical work, begin landscaping the sculpture garden and more. But it’s time for us to focus on what’s most important – access for everyone. This major infrastructure setback has been a thorn in our side since we lost our Gallery in Hurricane Irene and we are ready to make a change, but we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

You helped us lay down the floor, you’ve helped us with the foundation and the sculpture garden and the electrical work. You’ve helped us remain optimistic - keeping our eyes on the potential of the future, and now we need your help raising $15,000 to demolish the old stairs and create something a little more welcoming.

"GARNER, besides being a part of something cool - what are the perks?"
 

$10 or more - A great big "THANK YOU" and your name listed on our website donor wall

$25 or more – A great big “THANK YOU” plus a DVD on the history of this crazy, beautiful, historic site.

$75 or more – All of the above PLUS a bag of coffee from our on-site café, Stack Street Café

$100 or more – All of the above PLUS – we’ll give you a GARNER reusable tote bag and send you over to our friends at Area24 Radio for some serious crate digging. Find a gem, throw it in your tote and be on your way!

$250 or more – All of the above PLUS – personalized studio visits with Garnerville Artists. Up to 8 people, for a one hour tour (2 studios).

$500 or more – All of the above PLUS – an Industrial Arts Brewing Company tasting/tour guided by brewery Founder & Owner, Jeff O’Neil. Up to 8 people.

$750 or more – A signed (unframed) Frank Welles etching

$1250 or more – A signed (unframed) Frank Welles etching PLUS a brick on the “Visionary Walk”, the brick path leading into Building 35. A permanent display of your support for making art accessible to everyone!

$2500 – Tour of the GARNER Historic District guided by 2nd generation owner & President, Robin E. Rosenberg. Her knowledge of the grounds will take you and your party on a journey through past, present & future. End the tour with privately catered, pop-up warehouse dinner in a surprise location. We’ll do the decorating, we’ll provide the drinks, and Susan Stava Photography will capture all the happy memories. This is available for up to 8 people.

The Impact

Your donation is crucial in becoming the community resource we know we have the potential to be, but in order to do that we need to be able to be everyone’s community resource. We want to be your arts center; a place to connect, to seek inspiration, to challenge yourself, and to discover qualities in yourself and your community you didn’t know existed before. Be a part of that development, help us to open our doors to anyone who wants to come in. 

Risks & Challenges

We are a small, but mighty organization. Our Board of Directors is a volunteer board, and our staff is small. We are reliant on the kindness of our community to help us in our transformation. We know that your time and resources are valuable, and we appreciate every little bit anyone can give.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t make a financial contribution? That’s ok! This campaign is dependent on social sharing, please email/tweet/snap/post/gram to anyone in your circle who you think may be able to help. Not that into social sharing, but you’re willing to roll up your sleeves? A grassroots campaign like this one heavily relies on the kindness of strangers, and friends. A significant portion of the labor on this project has been generously donated, and our needs aren’t slowing down. We desperately need certified laborers, passionate gardeners, and visionaries. If you think you can help by providing in-kind labor please email info@garnerartscenter.org. We’re also always seeking material donations – give us a call and see how your business can make a tax deductible product donation today!
